value.name: absolute
value.description: Caches the results for the period of time that is specified by the Cache Lifetime. The lifetime is the explicit time-to-live (TTL).

value.name: disabled
value.description: Disables caching. The system does not cache results. Instead, users must authenticate each time they request access.

value.name: maximum
value.description: Compares the explicit TTL to the TTL in the response, if any. Caches results for the maximum of the two values.

value.name: minimum
value.description: Compares the explicit TTL to the TTL in the response, if any. Caches results for the minimum of the two values.

property.name: AUMethod
property.description: Select a method for authenticating the extracted identity.

property.name: AUCustomURL
property.description: The request is forwarded to the URL identified here for authenticating an identity.

property.name: AUMapURL
property.description: The location of an XML file adhering to the format of an AAAInfo file. This file contains a list of authenticated identities and the various values needed to successfully authenticate.

property.name: AUHost
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the authentication server.

property.name: AUPort
property.description: The port number to use for the Authentication service

property.name: AUSSLValcred
property.description: An optional set of validation credentials used to authenticate the certificate sent by a remote SSL peer during the SSL handshake.

property.name: AUCacheAllow
property.description: Select how to control caching of AAA authentication results.

property.name: AUKerberosPrincipal
property.summary: Principal name that must appear as the server name in the Kerberos ticket. This must be a full principal name, including the Kerberos realm (for example, "foo/bar@REALM").

property.name: AUKerberosPassword
property.summary: Password for the Kerberos server principal. This password is required to decrypt the client's Kerberos ticket.

property.name: AUClearTrustServerURL
property.summary: URL for accessing the ClearTrust server for authentication

property.name: AUClearTrustApplication
property.summary: Name of the application put in the authentication request to the ClearTrust server.

property.name: AUSAMLArtifactResponder
property.summary: URL of the SAML Artifact responder

property.name: AUKerberosVerifySignature
property.display: Verify signature using Kerberos session key
property.summary: Verify signature using Kerberos session key
property.description: If this option is enabled, the message must be signed with an HMAC signature based on the Kerberos session key. If the signature can not be verified, authentication will fail.

property.name: AUNetegrityBaseURI
property.description: The Base URI is combined with the Host and Port configuration items to form the URL for attempting Netegrity authentication. This Base URI should equal the concatenation of the servlet's servlet-name and its url-pattern set in its web.xml configuration file. If the servlet name is "datapoweragent" and the url-pattern is /, then the Base URI should be "datapoweragent/".

property.name: AUSAMLAuthQueryServer
property.description: URL to which to post a SAML Authentication query

property.name: AUSAMLVersion
property.summary: Select the version of the SAML messages

property.name: AULDAPPrefix
property.summary: The prefix used to construct the lookup DN

property.name: AULDAPSuffix
property.summary: The suffix used to construct the lookup DN

property.name: AUKerberosKeytab
property.summary: Keytab for the Kerberos server principal. This keytab is required to decrypt the client's Kerberos ticket.

property.name: AUSAML2Issuer
property.summary: The Identifier of the SAML 2.x protocol message Issuer

property.name: AUSignerValcred
property.summary: The validation credentials for a signing certificate.
property.description: An optional set of validation credentials used to verify the signature validity for the incoming message. When a Validation Credential is set, the signer's certificate must be contained in the selected Validation credential or the signature is rejected as untrusted.

property.name: AUSignedXPath
property.summary: XPath expression for the XML entity protected by signature
property.description: If the incoming message is digitally signed, first verify the signature validity; when the signature is valid, optionally verify if the specific XPath expression, defined with this optional property, is part of the signed memessage.

property.name: AUSSLProxyProfile
property.description: If a value is specified for the SSL Proxy Profile, communication with the specified external Authentication provider will take place over an SSL connection.

property.name: AULDAPBindDN
property.summary: Distinguished name used to bind to LDAP server
property.description: This is only used when the password from the Extract Identity stage is a WS-Security UsernameToken PasswordDigest, in which case the LDAP server is searched for the corresponding password so the PasswordDigest may be verified. This Distinguished Name is used to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULDAPBindPassword
property.summary: Password used to bind to LDAP server
property.description: This is only used when the password from the Extract Identity stage is a WS-Security UsernameToken PasswordDigest, in which case the LDAP server is searched for the corresponding password so the PasswordDigest may be verified. This Bind Password is the password used to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULDAPSearchAttribute
property.description: This is only used when the password from the Extract Identity stage is a WS-Security UsernameToken PasswordDigest, in which case the LDAP server is searched for the corresponding password so the PasswordDigest may be verified. This Search Attribute is the attribute used in the LDAP search.

property.name: AULTPATokenVersionsBitmap
property.description: Select which LTPA token versions are acceptable. For additional information about LTPA tokens, refer to the WebGUI Guide.

property.name: AULTPAKeyFile
property.description: The LTPA key file contains the cryptographic material necessary to create an LTPA token that can be consumed by WebSphere (both v1 and v2) or Domino. For WebSphere token creation, you must export the LTPA key file from WebSphere; this file will have portions encrypted by a password you enter below. For Domino token creation, the key file should contain only the base 64-encoded Domino shared secret.

property.name: AULTPAKeyFilePassword
property.description: The key file password is used to decrypt certain entries in a WebSphere LTPA key file (versions 1 and 2). It is not applicable to Domino key files.

property.name: AULTPAStashFile
property.description: The file containing the LTPA key file password.

property.name: AUBinaryTokenX509Valcred
property.description: A set of Validation Credentials used to validate the X.509 certificate in the BinarySecurityToken.

property.name: AUTAMServer
property.description: Select a TAM object from the values list. You can use the + and ... buttons to create a new TAM object or edit an existing one.

property.name: AUAllowRemoteTokenReference
property.summary: Whether allow this action to get a remote security token or not.
property.description: If the message indicates that the WSSec token is at a remote location, for example, the SAML assertion that holds the signer's public cert or the SAML assertion that the signed Security Token Reference (STR de-reference transform) pointing at is not with the local message, this setting will determines whether retrieval of remote WS-Sec token is allowed or prohibited.

property.name: AURemoteTokenProcessService
property.display: URL to Process the Remote Token
property.summary: The URL for a service which can process the remote security token.
property.description: The remote WS-Sec token could be signed, encrypted or encoded. A firewall or proxy service with different actions can be used to process the remote token, either decrypting pieces of a remote SAML assertion, doing a xslt transform, or using AAA to assert the token. This setting is the URL for that service, which accepts the security token as the request of the SOAP call, and provides the final security token as the response if successful.

property.name: AUWSTrustVersion
property.summary: The version of WS-Trust/WS-SecureConversation to use. Usually both specs versions are updated together.
property.description: Specify the WS-Trust/WS-SecureConversation version to use when the "ws-trust" AU sends a request to a remote STS. The default version is v1.2.

property.name: AULDAPSearchForDN
property.summary: Whether user's DN should be retrieved using an LDAP search.
property.description: If this option is enabled, the login-name presented by the user will be used along with the LDAP Search Parameters as part of an LDAP search to retrieve the user's DN. If this option is disabled, the login-name presented by the user will be used along with the LDAP Prefix and LDAP Suffix to construct the user's DN.

property.name: AULDAPSearchParameters
property.description: The LDAP search parameters used to perform an LDAP Search in order to retrieve the user's DN. If the "LDAP Search For DN" option is enabled, this property is relevant and it must be specified; if the option is disabled, this property is not used.

property.name: AUWSTrustRequireClientEntropy
property.summary: Require client entropy in the WS-Trust request
property.description: A WS-Trust entropy element will be sent by the client as part of the security token request exchange. Note that if a WS-Trust encryption certificate is used, the client entropy material will be encrypted. If the certificate is not configured, then a WS-Trust BinarySecret element will contain the entropy material. In this case, a SSL proxy profile should be used to secure the exchange with the WS-Trust server.

property.name: AUWSTrustClientEntropySize
property.summary: Length in bytes for the WS-Trust client entropy value
property.description: If client entropy has been configured, this parameter determines the size in bytes of the entropy material. Note that the size refers to the length of the entropy prior to base 64-encoding.

property.name: AUWSTrustRequireServerEntropy
property.summary: Require server entropy in the WS-Trust response
property.description: A WS-Trust entropy element must be returned to the client as part of the security token request exchange.

property.name: AUWSTrustServerEntropySize
property.summary: Minimum length in bytes for the WS-Trust server entropy value
property.description: If server entropy is required, this parameter determines the minimum allowable size in bytes of the received entropy material. Note that the size refers to the length of the entropy prior to base 64-encoding.

property.name: AUWSTrustRequireRSTC
property.description: This parameter determines whether a WS-Trust RequestSecurityToken or a WS-Trust RequestSecurityTokenCollection element is sent by the client as part of the message exchange.

property.name: AUWSTrustRequireAppliesToHeader
property.description: This parameter allows configuration of a WS-Addressing AppliesTo header.

property.name: AUWSTrustAppliesToHeader
property.summary: Value used for the WS-Addressing AppliesTo header
property.description: The WS-Addressing AppliesTo header value. The header element is included in the WS-Trust request security token message sent to the WS-Trust server.

property.name: AUWSTrustEncryptionCertificate
property.summary: Certificate used to encrypt WS-Trust elements for recipient
property.description: If client entropy has been configured, the certificate's public key will encrypt the material for the recipient. If client entropy is configured and this certificate is not specified, a SSL proxy profile should be used to secure the message exchange.

property.name: AUZOSNSSConfig
property.summary: ZOS/NSS client configuration for SAF communication
property.description: Select a SAF Client object from the values list. You can use the + and ... buttons to create a new NSS object or edit an existing one.

value.name: xmlfile
value.description: The requester is autheticated by an XML file (a list of authenticated users). The XML file can authenticate UserName, Password, IP Host, DN, or CustomToken. When selected, specify the URL of the file.

value.name: ldap
value.description: The requester is authenticated by an LDAP server. When selected, specify the details relevant to connecting to the LDAP srever. The extracted identity should conform to the LDAP DN format (such as, CN=Alice).

value.name: tivoli
value.description: The requester is authenticated by Tivoli Access Manager (TAM). A valid TAM object must exist in the system to use this method. When selected, specify the TAM object.

value.name: netegrity
value.description: The requester is authenticated by a Netegrity Server. When selected, specify the details relevant to connecting to the Netegrity server.

value.name: oblix
value.description: Not supported.

value.name: cleartrust
value.description: The requester is authenticated by a ClearTrust server. When selected, specify the details relevant to connecting to the ClearTrust server.

value.name: radius
value.description: The requester is authenticated bu a RADIUS server. The device automatically contacts the RADIUS servers that are configured for use. A least one AAA RADIUS server must be configured.

value.name: client-ssl
value.display: Validate the SSL Certificate from the Connection Peer
value.description: The requested is authenticated by its client SSL credentials. When selected, specify the Validation Credential object.

value.name: validate-signer
value.display: Validate the Signer Certificate for a Digitally Signed Message.
value.description: The requester is authenticated via the certificate that is passed as part of the X509 element of the digitally signed message. When selected, specify the XPath expression to extract the signed portion of the message and optionally specify the Validation Credential object.

value.name: saml-signature
value.display: Accept a SAML Assertion with a Valid Signature
value.description: The requester is authenticated by a SAML assertion with a valid signature. When selected, optionally specify the Validation Credential object.

value.name: saml-artifact
value.display: Retrieve SAML Assertions Corresponding to a SAML Browser Artifact
value.description: The requester is authenticated by a SAML responder. When selected, specify the details required to identify the issuer of the artifact.

value.name: saml-authen-query
value.display: Contact a SAML Server for a SAML Authentication Statement
value.description: The requester is authenticated by a SAML server. If authentication succeeds, a SAML Authentication statement is returned and used for further communication. When selected, specify the details to retrieve the Authentication statement from the SAML Authentication server.

value.name: ws-trust
value.display: Contact a WS-Trust Server for a WS-Trust Token
value.description: The requester is authenticated by a WS-Trust server. The server authenticates the requester and returns a WS-Trust token that is then used for further communication. When selected, specify the details relevent to accessing the WS-Trust server.

value.name: ws-secureconversation
value.display: Use an Established WS-SecureConversation Security Context
value.description: The requester is authenticated by reference to an establish WS-SecureConversation security context. This context must already be established before invoking a AAA policy.

value.name: token
value.display: Pass Identity Token to the Authorize Step
value.description: The extracted identity is passed to the authorization step for disposition. Authentication, if efects, succeeds.

value.name: kerberos
value.display: Validate a Kerberos AP-REQ for the Correct Server Principal
value.description: The requester is authenticated via a Kerberos AP-REQ in the WS-Security header. When selected, specify the Kerberos Keytab.

value.name: ltpa
value.description: The requester is authenticated by an encrypted LTPA token. When selected, specify the format and decryption details.

value.name: binarytokenx509
value.description: The requester is authenticated by a certificate that is included with a BinarySecurityToken. When selected, specify the Validation Credential object to use to validate the extracted certificate.

value.name: zosnss
value.description: The requester is authenticated by SAF through NSS. A valid NSS Client config object must exist in the system to use this method.

value.name: custom
value.description: The requested is authenticated by an unlisted resource (for example, a stylesheet). When selected, specify the URL of this unlisted resource.

property.name: AZMethod
property.description: Select the authorization method. The default is Allow any Authenticated Client.

property.name: AZHost
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the authorization server.

property.name: AZPort
property.description: Specify the listening port on the authorization server.

property.name: AZSAMLType
property.description: Select the way to match SAML attribute names and values. The default is Any.

property.name: AZSAMLXPath
property.summary: The XPath to execute against the SAML statement

property.name: AZSAMLNameQualifier
property.summary: This is the value of the NameQualifier attribute of the NameIdentifier in the generated SAML query. It is an optional attribute, but some SAML implementations require it to be present.

property.name: AZCacheAllow
property.description: Select how to control caching of AAA authorization results.

property.name: AZNetegrityBaseURI
property.description: The Netegrity Base URI is combined with the Host, Port and Netegrity Operation Name Extension configuration items to form the URL for attempting Netegrity authentication. So the URL is of the form: http://Host:Port/NetegrityBaseURI/operationNetegrityOpNameExtension where NetegrityOpNameExtension is concatenated directly with the operation name.

property.name: AZNetegrityOpNameExtension
property.summary: Extension for URI sent to Netegrity server
property.description: The Netegrity Base URI is combined with the Host, Port and Netegrity Operation Name Extension configuration items to form the URL for attempting Netegrity authentication. So the URL is of the form: http://Host:Port/NetegrityBaseURI/operationNetegrityOpNameExtension where NetegrityOpNameExtension is concatenated directly with the operation name.

property.name: AZClearTrustServerURL
property.summary: URL for accessing the ClearTrust server for authorization

property.name: AZSAMLVersion
property.summary: Select the version to use for SAML messages

property.name: AZLDAPBindDN
property.summary: Distinguished name used to bind to LDAP server

property.name: AZLDAPBindPassword
property.summary: Password used to bind to LDAP server

property.name: AZLDAPGroupAttribute
property.summary: The LDAP group's attribute name to check for membership. The authorizing identity must exist as an attribute value within the group.

property.name: AZSSLProxyProfile
property.description: If a value is specified for the SSL Proxy Profile, communication with the specified external Authorization provider will take place over an SSL connection.

property.name: AZLDAPSearchScope
property.description: Select the scope of the search relative to the input. The default is Subtree.

property.name: AZLDAPSearchFilter
property.description: The LDAP search filter for the search.

property.name: AZXACMLVersion
property.description: Select the XACML version to use for the communication between the PDP and the AAA Policy. The AAA Policy acts as an XACML Policy Enforcement Point (PEP). The default is 2.0.

property.name: AZXACMLPEPType
property.description: Select how the AAA Policy processes the PDP authorization response. The AAA Policy acts as an XACML PEP. The default is Deny-biased PEP.

property.name: AZXACMLUseOnBoxPDP
property.summary: Use The Built-In XACML Policy Decision Point (PDP) or not.
property.description: If the value is true, DataPower built-in XACML Policy Decision Point (PDP) will be used, the XACML PDP object is required, otherwise the external XACML PDP service URL is required.

property.name: AZXACMLPDP
property.summary: The PDP object name for DataPower built-in PDP feature.
property.description: Specify the XACML Policy Decision Point (PDP) object name. This setting takes effect only if the "Use On Box PDP" setting is set.

property.name: AZXACMLExternalPDPUrl
property.display: URL for External Policy Decision Point
property.summary: The external service URL that this XACML PEP sends the authorization request to and gets authorization response from.
property.description: Specify the external service URL that this XACML PEP sends the authorization request to and gets authorization response from. This setting takes effect only if the "Use On Box PDP" setting is not set.

property.name: AZXACMLBindingMethod
property.description: Select the method to use to generate the XACML context request. The default is Custom Stylesheet.

property.name: AZXACMLBindingObject
property.summary: Specify the AAA XACML Binding object.
property.description: Specify the AAA XACML Binding object name, which defines how our device can map the AAA result and/or input message tinto the XACML context request. This setting takes effect only if "AAA XACML Binding Method" is "dp-pdp".

property.name: AZXACMLBindingXSL
property.display: Custom Stylesheet to Bind AAA and XACML
property.summary: The URL of a custom stylesheet that can generate the XACML context request.
property.description: Specify the URL of a custom stylesheet which can map the AAA result and/or input message into the XACML context request. That request will be used to contact PDP for a XACML decision. This setting takes effect only if "AAA XACML Binding Method" is "custom".

property.name: AZXACMLCustomObligation
property.summary: The URL of the Obligation Fulfillment Custom Stylesheet
property.description: The custom stylesheet that can understand the obligations sent back from PDP, and then take actions to fulfill the obligations base on the request context. When the obligations are fulfilled, the he stylesheet should output text of <xsl:value-of select="true()"/>, otherwise, output text of <xsl:value-of select="false()"/>.

property.name: AZXACMLUseSAML2
property.summary: Use SAML2.0 Profile to communicate with the external PDP Service.
property.description:
If the custom binding xslt already generated the SAML 2.0 query, this setting should be kept 'off'. This setting is for the external PDP only.
If it is 'on', this field will force the PEP to talk with the external PDP by using <xacml-samlp:XACMLAuthzDecisionQuery> defined by SAML2.0 Profile of XACML v2.0. This setting can be combined with "SOAP Enveloping" if the xacml-samlp:XACMLAuthzDecisionQuery needs to be wrapped by a SOAP Body element.

property.name: AZTAMServer
property.description: Select a TAM object from the values list. You can use the + and ... buttons to create a new TAM object or edit an existing one.

property.name: AZTAMDefaultAction
property.description: Select the default Action. Defaults to T (traverse).

property.name: AZTAMActionResourceMap
property.description: Use the values list to select an existing action map. You can use the + and ... buttons to create a new action map or to edit an existing action map.

property.name: AZXACMLUseSOAP
property.summary: Whether or not the external PDP requires SOAP envelope
property.description:
If the custom binding xslt already generated the SOAP envelope this setting should be kept 'off'. This setting is for the external PDP only.
If it is 'off', the PEP will directly post the xacml-context:Request, whether or not wrapped by SAML Profile element <xacml-samlp:XACMLAuthzDecisionQuery>, to the external PDP via HTTP Post method, otherwise the request will be additionally wrapped by a SOAP Body. This setting can be combined with "PDP Requires SAML 2.0" if the XACML request should be wrapped by xacml-samlp:XACMLAuthzDecisionQuery.

property.name: AZZOSNSSConfig
property.summary: ZOS/NSS client configuration for SAF communication
property.description: Select a SAF Client object from the values list. You can use the + and ... buttons to create a new NSS object or edit an existing one.

property.name: AZSAFDefaultAction
property.description: Select the default Action. Defaults to R (Read).

value.name: anyauthenticated
value.description: All messages from an authenticated client are forwarded to the backend server.

value.name: passthrough
value.description: All messages are forwarded to the backend server.

value.name: tivoli
value.description: The requester is authorized by Tivoli Access Manager (TAM). A TAM object must exist. When selected, specify the TAM object, the default action, and the action map for the resource.

value.name: netegrity
value.description: The requester is authorized by a Netegrity server. When selected, specify the details relevant to connecting to the Netegrity server.

value.name: oblix
value.description: Not supported.

value.name: cleartrust
value.description: The requester is authorized by a ClearTrust server. When selected, specify the details relevant to connecting to the ClearTrust server.

value.name: custom
value.description: The requester is authorized by an unlisted resource. When selected, specify the URL of the unlisted resource.

value.name: ldap
value.display: Check for Membership in an LDAP Group
value.description: The requester is authorized by an LDAP server. When selected, specify the details relevant to connecting to the LDAP server.

value.name: saml-authz
value.description: The requester is authorized by a SAML authorization query. When selected, specify the details relevant to generating the query against the SAML server.

value.name: saml-attr
value.description: The requester is authorized by a SAML attribute query. When selected, specify the details relevant to generating the query against the SAML server.

value.name: use-authen-attr
value.description: The requester is authorized using the SAML attributes from the Authentication phase. These attributes are compared to the SAML Attributes that are configured for this policy. When selected, specify the match criteria.

value.name: xacml
value.description: The requester is authorized by an internal or external XACML Policy Decision Point (PDP). When selected, specify the details relevant to policy enforcement points for the policy decision points.

value.name: xmlfile
value.description: The requester is authorized by an XML file as the authorization resource. When selected, specify the URL of the XML file.

value.name: zosnss
value.description: The requester is authorized by SAF through NSS. A valid NSS Client config object must exist in the system to use this method.

value.name: http-basic-auth
value.description: This is the username and password from the "Authorization:" header sent in the HTTP request. When selected, it is strongly suggested to use SSL to prevent the password from being sent as clear text.

value.name: wssec-username
value.display: Password-carrying UsernameToken Element from WS-Security Header
value.description: If the SOAP header contains a Web Services Security UsernameToken element that carries a password or password-digest, extract the username and password from the element. (When using this method, it is strongly suggested to use SSL to prevent the password from being sent as cleartext.)

value.name: wssec-derived-key
value.display: Derived-key UsernameToken Element from WS-Security Header
value.description: If the SOAP header contains a Web Services Security UsernameToken element that specifies a password-derived symmetric key, extract the username and regenerate the key.

value.name: wssec-binary-token
value.description: If the SOAP header contains a Web Services Security BinarySecurityToken element, use the string value of the element as the identity token.

value.name: ws-secure-conversation
value.description: Use the established WS-SecureConversation context.

value.name: ws-trust
value.description: Use the token contained or referenced in the WS-Trust Base or Supporting elements.

value.name: kerberos
value.description: If the SOAP header contains a Web Services Security BinarySecurityToken element of type Kerberosv5_AP_REQ, use the string value of the element as the identity token.

value.name: kerberos-spnego
value.description: Use the SPNEGO token from the "Authorization: Negotiate" header sent in the HTTP request. It must include an optimistic Kerberos mechType token. The string value of the SPNEGO token is used as the identity token.

value.name: client-ssl
value.display: Subject DN of the SSL Certificate from the Connection Peer
value.description: If the peer, being connected with device on the other end, sent a certificate in the SSL handshake, use the Subject DN in the certificate as the identity.

value.name: saml-attr-name
value.description: If the message contains a SAML Assertion containing a SAML attribute statement, use the name contained in the Subject element of the attribute statement as the identity.

value.name: saml-authen-name
value.description: If the message contains a SAML Assertion containing a SAML authentication statement, use the name contained in the Subject element of the authentication statement as the identity.

value.name: saml-artifact
value.description: Use a SAML artifact as described in the SAML Browser Artifact Profile.

value.name: client-ip-address
value.description: Use the IP address of the client for authentication.

value.name: signer-dn
value.display: Subject DN from Certificate in the Message's signature
value.description: If the incoming message is digitally signed, verify the signature validity. If the signature is valid, use the Subject DN extracted from the certificate associated with the signature as the identity.

value.name: token
value.description: Apply the specified XPath expression to the incoming message. The result, which should be a string, is the identity token.

value.name: cookie-token
value.description: Find the named cookie in the HTTP Cookie header in the incoming message. The result, which is a URL decoded string, is the identity token.

value.name: ltpa
value.description: Extract the user identity from an LTPA token.

value.name: metadata
value.description: Extract the identity from the processing metadata, such as protocol headers, system variables, and other custom metadata sources. Uses a Processing Metadata object to identify extracted items. Must use a custom stylesheet for Authentication.

value.name: custom
value.description: Apply the specified XSL stylesheet to the incoming message to determine the identity.

value.name: target-url
value.description: The URL that that is presented to the server. This URL reflects the result of applying the configured URL Rewrite Policy objects to the original URL.

value.name: original-url
value.description: The original URL from the client request before applying the URL Rewrite Policy objects.

value.name: request-uri
value.display: URI of Toplevel Element in the Message
value.description: If the message is a SOAP message, the namespace URI of the name of the child element of the SOAP Body element. Otherwise, the namespace URI of the name of the root element of the message.

value.name: request-opname
value.description: If the message is a SOAP message, the local name of the child element of the SOAP Body element. Otherwise, this the local name of the root element of the message.

value.name: http-method
value.description: This is the HTTP request type extracted from the client request.

value.name: XPath
value.description: Apply the specified XPath expression to the incoming message. The result should be a string.

value.name: metadata
value.description: Extract the Resource requested from the processing metadata, which includes protocol headers, system variables, or custom items. Requires a Processing Metadata object. Must use custom stylesheet for Authorization.

property.name: EIBitmap
property.summary: Select the types of identity data to extract

property.name: EICustomURL
property.description: The request is forwarded to the URL identified here for extracting an identity. The custom process should return an identity.

property.name: EIXPath
property.description: When XPath is enabled for identity extraction, this XPath expression will be applied to the entire message. The value of this expression (as a string) will be used as the extracted identity.

property.name: EISignerDNValcred
property.description: An optional set of Validation Credentials used to validate the signer's certificate when the method "Subject DN from certificate in the message's signature" is in use.

property.name: EICookieName
property.description: The name of the cookie in the HTTP Cookie header to extract and use as the identity token.

property.name: EIBasicAuthRealm
property.description: The name of the HTTP Basic Authentication Realm as described by RFC 2617. A web browser may display this name to the user to help in determining what credentials need to be supplied.

property.name: EIUseWSSec
property.summary: If there is more than tokens available, it will use token from the apropriate WS-Security Security Header
property.description: By default, the token will be extracted somewhere other than WS-Security <Security/> header by default. For example, LTPA token is extracted from cookie header, set this option 'on' will use the one with WS-Security if it is avaible.

property.name: EIMetadata
property.description: Extract the identity from processing metadata, such as variables, protocol headers and so forth. If you configure this object, only the metadata items contained by this object will be fetched and return. If this object is not selected for the Extract Identity method, all the metadata items applicable for the current processing rule will be returned.

property.name: EIAllowRemoteTokenReference
property.summary: Whether allow this action to get a remote security token or not.
property.description: If the message indicates that the WSSec token is at a remote location, for example, the SAML assertion that holds the signer's public cert or the SAML assertion that the signed Security Token Reference (STR de-reference transform) pointing at is not with the local message, this setting will determines whether retrieval of remote WS-Sec token is allowed or prohibited.

property.name: EIRemoteTokenProcessService
property.display: URL to Process the Remote Token
property.summary: The URL for a service which can process the remote security token.
property.description: The remote WS-Sec token could be signed, encrypted or encoded. A firewall or proxy service with different actions can be used to process the remote token, either decrypting pieces of a remote SAML assertion, doing a xslt transform, or using AAA to assert the token. This setting is the URL for that service, which accepts the security token as the request of the SOAP call, and provides the final security token as the response if successful.

description.p: Select the method to obtain the user password. The password is required to calculate the derived symmetric key.
The property is available when the identity extraction method is Derived-Key UsernameToken.

property.name: EIPasswordRetrievalCustomURL
property.description: The specified stylesheet is invoked to obtain the user's password

property.name: EIPasswordRetrievalAAAInfoURL
property.summary: URL for DataPower AAA Info file
property.description: The password will be obtained from the specified file

property.name: EISSLProxyProfile
property.description: If a value is specified for the SSL Proxy Profile, communication with the specified external provider will take place over an SSL connection.

type.name: dmAAAPExtractResource

property.name: ERXPath
property.description: When "XPath" is selected for extracting the resource, this XPath expression will be applied to the entire message. The string result will be used as the resource.

property.name: ERMetadata
property.description: Use the processing metadata as the resource to authorize the access, such as variables, protocol headers and so forth. If you configure this object, only the metadata items contained by this object will be fetched and return. If this object is not selected for the Extract Resource method, all the metadata items applicable for the current processing rule will be returned.

type.summary: Information to extract to identify the resource

type.name: dmAAAPMapCredentials

property.name: MCMethod
property.summary: Select the mapping method to use

type.summary: How to map credentials or resources

value.name: none
value.description: Does not perform credential mapping.

value.name: custom
value.description: Identifies a custom mapping resource. When selected, specify the URL of the custom resource.

value.name: xmlfile
value.description: Identifies an XML file as the mapping resource. When selected, specify the URL of the XML file.

value.name: xpath
value.description: Identifies an XPath expression as the mapping resource. When selected, specify the XPath expression to apply to the extracted identity.

value.name: ws-secureconversation
value.description: Identifies that credentials are taken from the WS-SecureConversation context token.

value.name: TFIM
value.display: Credentials from Tivoli Federated Identity Manager
value.description: Identifies that credentials are taken from a TFIM configuration. When selected, select the TFIM object.

type.name: dmAAAPMapResource

property.name: MRTAMMap
property.description:
Tivoli Access Manager organizes resources into a hierarchical protected object space. Each protected object space has a defined convention. Select which style of object space to concatenate with the extracted resource.
Custom: <prefix>
TAMBI: /PDMQ/<prefix>
TFIM: /itfim-wssm/wssm-default/<prefix>
WebSEAL: /WebSEAL/<prefix>
These different options help in mapping the extracted resource to a resource string that follow a Tivoli naming conventions.

property.name: MRTAMInstancePrefix
property.description:
The prefix to use in the naming convention. The value of the entered property will customize the naming convention to your specific environment.
Custom: Any user defined prefix
TAMBI: The queue manager and queue separated with a forward slash
TFIM: The name of the TFIM domain
WebSEAL: The name of the WebSEAL instance

property.name: MRTAMWebSEALDynURLFile
property.description: When configured and an entry is matched for a request, the DynURL output replaces the output of the extracted resource string that is appended to the TAM object space prefix.

type.summary: How to map credentials or resrouces

value.name: none
value.description: Does not perform resource mapping.

value.name: custom
value.description: Identifies a custom mapping resource. When selected, specify the URL of the custom resource.

value.name: xmlfile
value.description: Identifies an XML file as the mapping resource. When selected, specify the URL of the XML file.

value.name: xpath
value.description: Identifies an XPath expression as the mapping resource. When selected, specify the XPath expression to apply to the extracted resource.

value.name: tivoli
value.description: Identifies a Tivoli Access Manager style mapping resource. When selected, specify the the style of object space prefix to concatenate to the extracted resource.

property.name: PPSAMLAuthAssertion
property.summary: Generate a SAML Authentication Assertion for the authenticated identity. If there is a custom stylesheet, which successfully generates a SAML Assertion, features with this setting won't generate additional SAML Assertions, that is to say this setting is functionally disabled if a custom stylesheet already provides this feature.

property.name: PPSAMLServerName
property.summary: This is the value of the Issuer attribute (required) of the saml:Assertion element. It identifies the server that is making the assertion.

property.name: PPSAMLNameQualifier
property.summary: This is the value of the NameQualifier attribute of the NameIdentifier in the generated SAML assertion. It is an optional attribute, but some SAML implementations require it to be present.

property.name: PPKerberosTicket
property.display: Include a WS-Security Kerberos AP-REQ token
property.summary: Include a WS-Security Kerberos AP-REQ BinarySecurityToken for the specified client and server principals in the WS-Security header.

property.name: PPKerberosClient
property.summary: This is the principal name in the client portion of the Kerberos ticket.

property.name: PPKerberosClientPassword
property.summary: This is the password for the client. This password is required to authenticate the client to the KDC.

property.name: PPKerberosServer
property.summary: This is the principal name in the server portion of the Kerberos ticket.

property.name: PPWSTrust
property.summary: For a valid WS-Trust SecurityContextToken request, generate the appropriate security token response. This PostProcessing works as WS-Trust STS, right now only WS-SecureConversation SCT is supported.

property.name: PPTimestamp
property.summary: Output the Timestamp or not for the generated Security Context token

property.name: PPTimestampExpiry
property.summary: Allow an explicit validity interval for the generated WS-Trust security context token. If the system variable "defaultexpiry" is set, the default value 0 will use its value as the duration in seconds while issuing a new security context or renewing a context instance with new instance; if that system variable is not set, the default value 14400 (that is 4 hours) will be used. Please note: If this setting is used to renew an existing security context or instance, the default value 0 means the old duration will be used for the renewed cycle. The maximum validity is 366 days (31,622,400 seconds).

property.name: PPAllowRenewal
property.summary: If selected, issued WS-Trust tokens may have their lifetime period reset without a new bootstrapping authentication event. If the ws-trust request specifically asks that the issued should be renewable, this setting will be ignored.

property.name: PPSAMLVersion
property.summary: Select the version of SAML assertion to generate.

property.name: PPSAMLSendSLO
property.summary: Send SAML 2.0 Single Logout Message. there is a custom stylesheet with PostPorcess step, which generates a XML doc, this setting will be functionally so that the final XML still has valid format.

property.name: PPSAMLSLOEndpoint
property.summary: Endpoint for SAML 2.0 single logout messages. This is the authority that authenticated the assertion subject.

property.name: PPSSLProxyProfile
property.description: If a value is specified for the SSL Proxy Profile, communication with the specified SAML SLO Session Authority will take place over an SSL connection.

property.name: PPWSUsernameToken
property.description: Add a WS-Security UsernameToken to the message. The username and password are taken from the output of the Mapped Credentials stage.

property.name: PPWSUsernameTokenPasswordType
property.description: Select the type of password that the UsernameToken provides.

property.name: PPSAMLValidity
property.summary: This is the value of the SAML Assertion validity in seconds. This value and Skew Time setting will be used for a fine control of Assertion validity duration.

property.name: PPSAMLSkew
property.summary: The IdP and SP system clocks may have a skew time. To set the SAML Assertion expiration properly, it should take this skew time into account. NotBefore will have value of (CurrentTime - SkewTime). NotOnOrAfter will have the value of (CurrentTime + Validity + SkewTime).

property.name: PPWSUsernameTokenIncludePwd
property.summary: Whether a Password must be included in WS-Security UsernameToken
property.description: Whether a Password must be included in WS-Security UsernameToken.

property.name: PPLTPA
property.description: Select this toggle to enable LTPA token generation.

property.name: PPLTPAVersion
property.summary: The LTPA token version to create
property.description: Select the LTPA token version to generate. For additional information about LTPA tokens, refer to the WebGUI Guide.

property.name: PPLTPAExpiry
property.summary: Lifetime of LTPA token in seconds

property.name: PPLTPAKeyFile
property.summary: The file containing the key used to secure the LTPA token.

property.name: PPLTPAKeyFilePassword
property.summary: The password used to decrypt the encrypted keys in the LTPA key file.
property.description: The LTPA key file contains the cryptographic material necessary to create an LTPA token that can be consumed by WebSphere (both v1 and v2) or Domino. For WebSphere token creation, you must export the LTPA key file from WebSphere; this file will have portions encrypted by a password you enter below. For Domino token creation, the key file should contain only the base 64-encoded Domino shared secret.

property.name: PPLTPAStashFile
property.summary: The file containing the LTPA key file password.

property.name: PPKerberosSPNEGOToken
property.summary: Generate a Kerberos SPNEGO token to be inserted into the WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.

property.name: PPKerberosBstValueType
property.summary: Value of the ValueType attribute in the Kerberos AP-REQ message
property.description: Select the value for the ValueType attribute of the WS-Security BinarySecurityToken. The Kerberos AP-REQ message will contain the ValueType attribute.

property.name: PPSAMLUseWSSec
property.display: Wrap SAML Assertion in a WS-Security Header (SAML 1.1 only)
property.summary: By default, the SAML assertion is inserted as a child element of the SOAP header. Setting the toggle to "on" will place the SAML assertion within a WS-Security compliant header, as detailed in the WS-Security SAML token profile.

property.name: PPKerberosClientKeytab
property.summary: This is the keytab for the client. This keytab is required to authenticate the client to the KDC.

property.name: PPUseWSSec
property.display: Wrap Token in a WS-Security Security Header
property.summary: Generate a WS-Security Security Header to wrap the token
property.description: By default, the token may not be wrapped by the WS-Security standard <Security/> header, set this option 'on' to generate a WS-Security header which contains the token, otherwise the default wrapping for that token type will be used. This setting is used for LTPA token generatiion, it can be used for other PP method too.

property.name: PPActorRoleID
property.summary: Specify the Actor/Role Identifier for the WS-Security Security header
property.description:
Specify the identifier for the SOAP1.1 actor or SOAP1.2 role in processing a WS-Sec Security Header. This is only effective when a SOAP message is being used for WS-Security 1.0/1.1. Some well-known values are:
http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/actor/next Every one, including the intermediary and ultimate receiver, receives the message should be able to processing the Security header.
http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/role/none No one should process the Security Header.
http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/role/next Every one, including the intermediary and ultimate receiver, receives the message should be able to processing the Security header.
http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/role/ultimateReceiver The message ultimate receiver can process the Security header. This is the default value if such setting is not configured.
<blank or empty string> The empty string "" (without quotes) indicates that no "actor/role" identifier is configured. if there is no actor/role setting configured, the ultimateReceiver is assumed when processing the message, and no actor/role attribute will be added when generating the ws-security Security header. Please note: there should not be more than one Security headers omitting the actor/role identifier.
USE_MESSAGE_BASE_URI The value "USE_MESSAGE_BASE_URI" without quotes indicates that the actor/role identifier will be the base url of the message, if the SOAP message is transported using HTTP, the base URI is the Request-URI of the http request.
any other customized string You can input any string to identify the Security header's actor or role.

property.name: PPWSDerivedKeyUsernameToken
property.display: Use Derived-Key variant of WS-Security UsernameToken
property.description: Add a WS-Security Derived-Key UsernameToken to the message, and add an HMAC signature using the derived-key. The username and password are taken from the output of the Mapped Credentials stage.

property.name: PPWSDerivedKeyUsernameTokenIterations
property.summary: Number of rounds of hashing to perform
property.description: Number of rounds of hashing to use when generating a derived key from a password. Typically 1000 (the default setting); must be at least 2

property.name: PPWSUsernameTokenAllowReplacement
property.summary: If a username token already exists, should it be replaced
property.description: If generation of a username token has been requested in Post-Processing, but the message already contains a username token, the default behavior is to retain the original token (and not generate a new one). Setting this option will cause the generated token to replace any existing one.

property.name: PPTFIMReplaceMethod
property.summary: Method to use with TFIM responses
property.description: Select a method on how to handle the token that TFIM returns.

property.name: PPTFIMRetrieveMode
property.description: Select method to retrieve token from Tivoli Federated Identity Manager.

property.name: PPHMACSigningAlg
property.summary: The algorithm to sign the token.
property.description: Select the HMAC algorithm to sign the token. This option is available if WS-Secuirty UsernameToken was requested in post-processing and WS-Security Derived-Key UsernameToken is added to the message with a HMAC signature.

property.name: PPSigningHashAlg
property.description: Select the algorithm for the Message Digest when generating a digital signature. This alogrithm is used with the UsernameToken post-processing method only.

property.name: PPWSTrustHeader
property.display: Return the WS-Trust Token as SOAP Header
property.summary: Return the WS-Trust tokens in the SOAP header rather than in SOAP body.
property.description: Rather than being put inside the SOAP body, the wst:RequestedSecurityToken can be wrapped by a wst:IssuedToken and returns as a SOAP header.

property.name: PPWSSCKeySource
property.display: Source of Shared Secret to Initialize Security Context
property.summary: Where to get the shared secret to initialize the WS-Trust/WS-SecureConversation Security Context.
property.description: When the WS-Trust Post Processing method is used, it will work as a on-the-box WS-Trust STS backed by WS-SecureConversation. A symmetric shared secret key is needed in order to initialize the WS-SecureConversation SecurityContext. This key can be an authenticated token from the request message (such as Kerberos token), a token generated by DP device(not supported), a randomness key, or a static shared secret.

property.name: PPSharedSecretKey
property.summary: Specify the static Shared Secret, which is defined by the CryptoSSKey object.
property.description: A shared secret key which may be used to initialize the Security Context. Please note: this setting specifies a static symmetric key to be used for every security context, hence it is less secure than any other key types and not recommended.

property.name: PPWSTrustRenewalWait
property.summary: Specify how many seconds the service may keep the expired token before a renewal is requested.
property.description: By default, once a WS-Trust token expires, it may be removed from the STS and is not allowed to renew after expiration, so you would have to renew it before a token expires. If the ws-trust request specifically asks that the issued can be renewed after expiration and this setting has value 0, the token will be issued/renewd with 1 hour (3600 seconds) wait time. Specify the number of seconds that you allow STS to keep the expired Security Context. The default value is 0. The maximum TTL is 31 days (2,678,400 seconds).

property.name: PPWSTrustNewInstance
property.display: Issue new Instance for WS-Trust Renewal
property.summary: Issue a new Instance when the request is to renew the WS-Trust Token.
property.description: When this setting is on, the SCT renewal request will create a new instance of the current context, if the request doesn't an instance name. If the request is for a valid existing instance, that instance will be renewed.

property.name: PPWSTrustNewKey
property.display: Update Context Key for WS-Trust Renewal
property.summary: Use a key different from the current one when the request is to renew the WS-Trust Token.
property.description: When this setting is on, the SCT renewal request will not use the existing shared secret key of the renewed context.

property.name: PPWSTrustNeverExpire
property.summary: Force the Security Context or Instance to live for ever unless being changed explicityly afterwards.
property.description: When this setting is on, the SCT or instance will be initialized to live for ever, its duration can still be changed afterwards with an explicit number of seconds.

property.name: Credential
property.description: Mapped Credential Name

property.name: Priority
property.description: Control the transaction scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services will be favored over lower priority services.

property.name: Authorization
property.description: Require Authorization

value.name: dp-pdp
value.description: Not supported.

value.name: custom
value.description: Use a custom stylesheet to map the AAA result and the input message to an XACML context and to generate the XACML context request to an XACML Policy Decision Point (PDP).

property.name: DeviceIP
property.description: Identifies the local management IP address of the device to which the statement is applied. Leave blank for all.

property.name: Domain
property.description: Identifies the application domain to which the statement is applied. Select (none) for all or if not applicable to resource type.

property.name: Type
property.description: Identifies the type of the resource to which the statement is applied. Select (all resources) for all resource types.

property.name: Name
property.description: Limits the statement to resources with the specified names. Use a PCRE to select groups of resource instances.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.description: Limits the access policy to the specified local addresses. A PCRE expression can be used to select a range of addresses.

property.name: LocalPort
property.description: Limits the access policy to the specified local ports. Use a PCRE expression to select a range of ports.

property.name: Directory
property.description: Limits the access policy to the specified directories. Applies only to the file resource type and the file management type. Use a PCRE to select sets of directories.

property.name: Filename
property.description: Limits the access policy to the specified local files. Use a PCRE to select a set of files.

property.name: Access
property.description: Defines the access rights for the resources that match this policy.

value.name: r
value.description: Allow read access to existing resources of same type.

value.name: w
value.description: Allow write access to existing resources of same type.

value.name: a
value.description: Allow adding of new resources of same type.

value.name: d
value.description: Allow deleting of existing resources of same type.

value.name: x
value.description: Allow execution or invocation of resource.

property.name: Access
property.description: With allow selected, the range of IP addresses is granted access to the service. With deny selected, the range of IP address is denied access to the service.

property.name: Address
property.description: An IP address and network mask that defines a contiguous range of IP addresses, either granted or denied access to the current service.

value.name: default
value.summary: Examine content-type and determine whether to parse
value.description: Examines the content-type in the response. If it indicates XML or is not provided, parse the response as XML. For any other value, store the response without parsing.

value.name: binary
value.description: Stores the response without parsing.

value.name: xml
value.description: Parses the response as XML.

property.name: RegExp
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*) Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?) Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] ) Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: AddHeader
property.description: Enter the Header field name here.

property.name: AddValue
property.description: Enter the Header value (a string) here.

property.name: RegExp
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*) Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?) Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] ) Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: AllowCompression
property.description: If set to on and the protocol allows it, transactions matching this policy will use compression

value.name: dynamic
value.summary: Deduce attachment format (MIME or DIME) from content

value.name: streaming
value.description: Allows messages attachments in streaming mode, but provides limited processing. Client requests in the form of a SOAP message package (that is, a SOAP message transmitted together with accompanying attachments) are supported. Processing can be applied to each attachment individually. The system will not build a manifest of all attachments and attachments must be accessed and processed in the order in which they appear in the document.

value.name: unprocessed
value.description: Allows messages with attachements but but does not process the attachments. This option permits forwarding of large attachments. root part of the message (typically containing a SOAP message) is subject to filter or transform actions. Accompanying documents can be passed intact to the server. No processing on parts other than the root part is possible.

property.name: RegExp
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set assigned to a specific HTTP proxy. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*) Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?) Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] ) Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: UserName
property.description: The user name used for BasicAuth.

property.name: Password
property.description: The password associated with the user name used for BasicAuth.

value.name: cpu-1
value.description: This fan is mounted to CPU 1. It is not field replaceable.

value.name: cpu-2
value.description: This fan is mounted to CPU 2. It is not field replaceable.

value.name: fan-tray-1
value.description: This fan is mounted in Fan Tray 1. If that Fan Tray is field replaceable, this fan is field replaceable.

value.name: fan-tray-2
value.description: This fan is mounted in Fan Tray 2. If that Fan Tray is field replaceable, this fan is field replaceable.

value.name: hard-disk-drive-tray
value.summary: Fan mounted in Hard Disk Drive Tray
value.description: This fan is mounted in the Hard Disk Drive Tray. This fan is field replaceable.

value.name: ok
value.description: This fan is present, and the measured speed is within the acceptable range.

value.name: failed-speed
value.summary: Fan has failed due to speed
value.description: This fan is present, and there is a speed reading available, and that speed reading is outside the acceptable range. This fan is not field replaceable, the entire unit must be replaced.

value.name: failed-speed-replaceable
value.summary: Fan has failed due to speed, field replaceable
value.description: This fan is present, and there is a speed reading available, and that speed reading is outside the acceptable range. This fan is in a Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), which needs to be replaced. The Location indicates which FRU.

value.name: failed-missing
value.summary: Fan has failed due to speed
value.description: There is no sensor reading available for this fan, probably because the Fan Tray is not in or connected to the system.

value.name: Request
value.description: Signifies the input of a server-originated document.

value.name: Response
value.description: Signifies the input of a client-originated document.

value.name: Fault
value.description: Signifies a fault condition.

value.name: AuthComplete
value.description: Signifies the completion of an authentication process.

value.name: aaapolicy
value.description: Provides access to the commands for configuring AAA Policy (aaapolicy in Global mode), Processing Metadata (metadata in Global mode), and XACML Policy Decision Point (xacml-pdp in Global mode).

value.name: acl
value.description: Provides access to the commands for configuring Access Control List (acl in Global mode).

value.name: common
value.description: Provides access to the majority of the show commands and the disable (Global mode) and switch domain (Global mode) commands.

value.name: compile-options
value.description: Provides access to the commands for configuring Compile Options Policy (compile-options in Global mode).

value.name: config-management
value.description: Provides access to the commands for configuring Import Package (import-package in Global mode), Include Configuration (include-config in Global mode), and Peer Group (peer-group in Global mode)

value.name: configuration
value.description: Provides access to the commands for configuring MTOM Policy (mtom in Global mode), the command for defining CLI shell scripts (alias in Global mode), the command for pinging a remote server (ping in Global mode), the command for restarting an application domain (restart-domain in Global mode), the command for saving error reports (save error-report in Global mode), the command for sending error report (send error-report in Global mode), the command for viewing statistics (statistics in Global mode), and the command for testing a TCP connection (test tcp-connection in Global mode).

value.name: crl
value.description: Provides access to the commands for configuring CRL (crl in Global mode).

value.name: crypto
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring cryptographic operations (crypto in Global mode), Crypto Certificates (certificates in Crypto mode), Crypto Identification Credentials (idcred in Crypto mode), Crypto Key (key in Crypto mode), Crypto Profile (profile in Crypto mode), Crypto Shared Secret Key (sskey in Crypto mode), Kerberos KDC Server (kerberos-kdc in Crypto mode), Kerberos Keytab (kerberos-keytab in Crypto mode), SSL Proxy Profile (sslproxy in Global mode), the command for generating a crypto certificate (keygen in Crypto mode), the command for generating a key (key in Crypto mode), the command for exporting crypto objects (crypto-export in Crypto mode), the command for importing crypto objects (crypto-import in Crypto mode), and the command for cloning an HSM key wrapping key, when using an HSM-enabled device (hsm-clone-kwk in Crypto mode).

value.name: device-management
value.description: Process access to commands for configuring SSH (ssh in Global mode), Telnet service (telnet in Global mode), Web Management Service (web-mgmt in Global mode), and XML Management Interface (xml-mgmt in Global mode).

value.name: diagnostics
value.description: Provides access to commands used for diagnostics of failures for serviceability

value.name: document-crypto-map
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Document Crypto Map (document-crypto-map in Global mode).

value.name: domain
value.description: Process access to commands for configuring Application Domain (domain in Global mode).

value.name: failure-notification
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Failure Notification (failure-notification in Global mode).

value.name: file-management
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring NFS Dynamic Mounts (nfs-dynamic-mounts in Global mode) and NFS Static Mounts (nfs-static-mounts in Global mode).

value.name: firewallcred
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Crypto Firewall Credentials (fwcred in Global mode).

value.name: flash
value.description: Provides access to configuring and managing the Flash (flash in Global mode).

value.name: httpserv
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring HTTP Service (httpserv in Global mode).

value.name: input-conversion
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring HTTP Input Conversion Map (input-conversion-map in Global mode).

value.name: interface
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Interface (interface in Global mode) and the command for starting and stopping a packet capture (packet-capture in Global mode).

value.name: load-balancer
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Load Balancer (loadbalancer-group in Global mode).

value.name: logging
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Logging Category (logging category in Global mode), Logging Target (logging target in Global mode), and the command for generating a log event (test logging in Global mode).

value.name: matching
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Matching Rule (matching in Global mode).

value.name: messages
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Message Matching (message-matching in Global mode) and Message Type (message-type in Global mode).

description.p: Provides access to commands for configuring Message Count Monitor (monitor-count in Global mode), Message Duration Monitor (monitor-duration in Global mode), and Message Filter Action (monitor-action in Global mode).
Does not provide access to configuring Web Service Monitor. For access to these commands, select Web Service Monitor.

value.name: mpgw
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Multi-Protocol Gateway (mpgw in Global mode), Application Security Policy (application-security-policy in Global mode), Error Policy (webapp-error-handling in Global mode), FTP Poller Front Side Handler (source-ftp-poller in Global mode), FTP Server Front Side Handler (source-ftp-server in Global mode), HTTP Front Side Handler (source-http in Global mode), HTTPS Front Side Handler (source-https in Global mode), MQ Front Side Handler (source-mq in Global mode), Name-Value Profile (webapp-gnvc in Global mode), NFS Poller Front Side Handler (source-nfs-poller in Global mode), Rate Limiter (simple-rate-limiter in Global mode), Session Management Policy (webapp-session-management in Global mode), Stateful Raw XML Handler (source-stateful-tcp in Global mode), Stateless Raw XML Handler (source-raw in Global mode), TIBCO EMS Front Side Handler, if licensed on XI50 only (source-tibems in Global mode), TIBCO EMS Server, if licensed on XI50 only (tibems-server in Global mode), Web Application Firewall (web-application firewall in Global mode), Web Request Profile (webapp-request-profile in Global mode), Web Response Profile (webapp-response-profile in Global mode), WebSphere JMS Front Side Handle, XI50 only (source-wasjms in Global mode), and WebSphere JMS Server, XI50 only (wasjms-server in Global mode).

value.name: mq-host
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring WebSphere MQ Host (mq-host in Global mode) and WebSphere MQ Proxy (mq-proxy in Global mode).

value.name: mq-node
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring WebSphere MQ Gateway (mq-node and mq-gateway in Global mode).

value.name: mq-qm
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring WebSphere MQ Queue Manager (mq-qm in Global mode) and WebSphere Queue Manager Group (mq-qm-group in Global mode).

value.name: network
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring DNS Settings (dns in Global mode), Host Alias (host-alias in Global mode), Network Settings (network in Global mode), and NTP Service (ntp in Global mode).

value.name: radius
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring RADIUS (radius in Global mode).

value.name: rbm
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring RBM Settings (rbm in Global mode).

value.name: schema-exception-map
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Schema Exception Map (schema-exception-map in Global mode).

value.name: service-monitor
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Web Service Monitor (service-monitor in Global mode).

value.name: snmp
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring SNMP Settings (snmp in Global mode).

value.name: sslforwarder
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring SSL Proxy Service (sslforwarder in Global mode).

value.name: stylesheetaction
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Processing Actions (action in Global mode).

value.name: stylesheetpolicy
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Processing Policy (stylepolicy in Global mode) and Web Service Processing Policy (wsm-stylepolicy in Global mode).

value.name: stylesheetrule
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Processing Rule (rule in Global mode) and Web Service Processing Rule (wsm-rule in Global mode).

value.name: system
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Crypto Certificate Monitor (cert-monitor in Global mode), NFS Client Settings (nfs-client in Global mode), System Settings (system in Global mode), Throttle Settings (throttle in Global mode), Timezone (timezone in Global mode), SSH Known Host (known-host in Global mode), XML File Capture (file-capture in Global mode), the command for setting the system clock (clock at the login prompt), and the command for shutting down the device (shutdown at the login prompt.

value.name: tam
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Tivoli Access Manager (create-tam-file and tam in Global mode) and Tivoli Federated Identity Manager (tfim in Global mode).

value.name: tcpproxy
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring TCP Proxy Service (tcpproxy in Global mode).

value.name: urlmap
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring URL Map (urlmap in Global mode).

value.name: urlrefresh
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring URL Refresh Policy (urlrefresh in Global mode).

value.name: urlrewrite
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring URL Rewrite Policy (urlrewrite in Global mode).

value.name: useragent
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring FTP Quoted Commands (ftp-quote-command-list in Global mode) and User Agent (user-agent in Global mode).

value.name: usergroup
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring User Account (user in Global mode) and User Group (usergroup in Global mode).

value.name: validation
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Crypto Validation Credentials (valcred in Global mode).

value.name: webservice
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring SLM Action (slm action in Global mode), SLM Credential Class (slm-cred in Global mode), SLM Policy (slm-policy in Global mode), SLM Resource Class (slm-rsrc in Global mode), SLM Schedule (slm-sched in Global mode), UDDI Registry (uddi-registry in Global mode), UDDI Subscription (uddi-subscription in Global mode), WS-Proxy Endpoint Rewrite (wsm-endpointrewrite in Global mode), WSRR Server (wsrr-server in Global mode), and WSRR Subscription (wsrr-subscription in Global mode).

value.name: wsm-agent
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Web Services Management Agent (wsm-agent in Global mode).

value.name: xmlfirewall
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring HTTP Proxy (http in Global mode) and XML Firewall (xmlfirewall in Global mode).

value.name: xmlmgr
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring Document Cache (documentcache in Global Mode), Parser Limits (xml parser limits in Global mode), and XML Manager (xmlmgr and xml-manager in Global mode).

value.name: xpath-routing
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring XPath Routing Map (xpath-routing in Global mode).

value.name: xslcoproc
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring XSL Coprocessor Service (xslcoproc in Global mode).

value.name: xslproxy
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring HTTP Proxy (http in Global mode) and XML Proxy Service (xslproxy in Global mode).

value.name: llm
value.description: Provides access to commands for configuring LLM service

type.name: dmCondition

property.name: Expression
property.summary: The expression to check for this conditional

property.name: ConditionAction
property.summary: The action to run if the expression was matched

type.display: Map XPath condition to Action to run
type.summary: XPath condition to check and action to run if it is found.
type.description: Used for the conditional action, this is a single condition which maps an XPath condition to search for in the input context to an action to run if it is found. If it is not found, then other conditions can be checked.

property.name: DeviceIP
property.description: Identifies the local management IP address of the device to which the statement is applied. Leave blank for all.

property.name: Domain
property.description: Identifies the application domain to which the statement is applied. Select (none) for all.

property.name: Type
property.description: Limits the statement to configuration with matching type. To match all types, select '(all resources)'.

property.name: Name
property.description: Limits the statement to resources with the specified names. Use a PCRE to select groups of resource instances.

property.name: Property
property.description: Limits the statement to the configuration property with the specified name.

property.name: Value
property.description: Limits the statement to configuration with matching property values. Use a PCRE Match Expression to select groups of configuration property values.

property.name: Match
property.description:
Matching configuration is modified. To create a match statement, type a correctly formatted resource match in the horizontal text box select Build. Selecting Build displays the Configuration Match Builder in a popup window.
A match statement takes the following general form:
Addr / Domain / Resource ? field = value
Addr Device Address. Must be fully specified host name, IP Address or local host alias. May be asterisk (*) to designate any.
Domain Application Domain. Must be fully specified. May be asterisk (*) to designate any.
Resource Resource Type. Must be fully specified resource type. May be asterisk (*) to designate any.
field An additional specification field, such as "Value". Must be fully specified.
value A PCRE match expression. For example, "Value=foo(*)bar"

property.name: Type
property.description: Selects the type of configuration modification.

property.name: Property
property.description: Specifies the name of the property to add.

property.name: Value
property.description: Specifies the value of the added or changed property.

property.name: DeviceIP
property.description: Identifies the local management IP address of the device to which the statement is applied. Leave blank for all.

property.name: Domain
property.description: Identifies the application domain to which the statement is applied. Select (none) for all.

property.name: Type
property.description: Limits the statement to configuration with matching type. To match all types, select '(all resources)'.

property.name: Name
property.description: Limits the statement to resources with the specified names. Use a PCRE to select groups of resource instances.

property.name: Property
property.description: Limits the statement to the configuration property with the specified name.

property.name: Value
property.description: Limits the statement to configuration with matching property values. Use a PCRE Match Expression to select groups of configuration property values.

value.name: invalid
value.description: Invalid Configuration

value.name: saved
value.description: Persisted Configuration

value.name: new
value.description: New Configuration

value.name: modified
value.description: Modified Configuration

value.name: deleted
value.description: Deleted Configuration

value.name: external
value.description: External Configuration

type.name: dmConformanceRejectLevel

value.name: warning
value.summary: Reject messages with conformance warnings or failures

type.summary: Degree of nonconformance to cause the message to be rejected

type.name: dmConformanceReportLevel

value.name: failure
value.summary: Record conformance reports that indicate conformance failures

value.name: warning
value.summary: Record conformance reports that indicate conformance warnings or failures

type.summary: Degree of nonconformance to cause a conformance report to be recorded

value.name: none
value.description: The device does not perform any cryptographic action on outbound cookies.

value.name: sign
value.description: The device signs outbound cookies with the specified Key. When the client sends back the cookies, the device verifies and removes the signature.

value.name: encrypt
value.description: The device encrypts the contents of outbound cookies with the specified Key. When the client sends back the cookies, the device unencrypts the contents.

property.name: CookiePolicy
property.description: Select how the client side of the inspected transaction handles cookies. The default is Allow.

property.name: Type
property.description: Specify whether the device signs, verifies, or neither signs or verifies outbound cookies for the application. The default is None.

property.name: Key
property.description: Signing and/or Encrypting cookies requires a secret passphrase for the cryptographic operation. If this key is the same on multiple devices, then each device can statelessly verify or decrypt a cookie generated by another device.

property.name: IPinWatermark
property.description: Normally the signed/encrypted cookie contains the client IP address and this prevents the client from using this cookie from any other host.
