Some proxy server environments may make this undesirable. Turning this property off will make the generated cookies address independent.

property.name: CookieGNVC
property.summary: Name/Value validation profile for cookie contents
property.description: Name/Value Profile for cookie contents. If not present, no profile is enforced. The profile allows you to validate data members of the cookie, filter out unknown ones, or map certain names to known values.

property.name: Name
property.description: Enter the name of the threshold. This name appears in the log files when the threshold is reached.

property.name: Interval
property.description: Enter the measurement interval in milliseconds. One second is expressed as 1000 here.

property.name: RateLimit
property.description: Specify the threshold value as a number of messages. A monitored message type that exceeds this value over the measurement interval specified by the Interval property is subject to the policy identified by the Action values list.

property.name: BurstLimit
property.description: Specify the maximum allowed message burst. Use a value approximately twice the value of Rate Limit.

property.name: Action
property.description: Select the monitor policy implemented by the monitor when the target message type exceeds the threshold value. This is a list of Message Filter Actions. Click the + button to create a new action.

value.name: all
value.description: Source address monitoring and information gathering is aggregated for the address range.

value.name: each-ip
value.description: Source address monitoring and information gathering is individualized for all IP addresses in the address range.

value.name: ip-from-header
value.description: Source address monitoring and information gathering is individualized for all IP addresses in the address range. IP addresses are determined by the value of the specified HTTP header.

value.name: requests
value.description: Increases the counter on the receipt of a client request of the target message type.

value.name: responses
value.description: Increases the counter on the receipt of a server response of the target message type.

value.name: xpath
value.description: Increases the counter on a call to the dp:increment-integer extension function from a custom stylesheet.

value.name: errors
value.description: Increases the counter on an HTTP error response, and increments. the counter on the execution of an error rule.

value.name: ignore
value.description: Ignores the certificate extension, if present.

value.name: require
value.description: Requires checks against, but does not fetch, the CRLs in the X.509 CRL Distribution Point extensions. Used only when the current Validation Credentials object is used for SSL Peer validation. In this case, the candidate certificate is deemed valid if the certificate chain is terminated by a trust anchor.

property.name: Name
property.summary: The name of the CRL retrieval policy
property.description: Enter the name of the CRL retrieval policy.

property.name: FetchType
property.summary: The protocol used to obtain the CRL
property.description: Select the protocol used to obtain the CRL from the authority.

property.name: IssuerValcred
property.description: A set of validation credentials used to verify the authenticity of the CRL issuer and thus the CRL. The certificate used by the CRL Issuer must be included in this Validation Credential in order for the CRL to be valid.

property.name: RefreshInterval
property.description: An integer (within the range 1 through 1440, with a default of 240) specifying the interval, in minutes, between CRL updates.

property.name: DefaultStatus
property.summary: Certificate status if no current CRL available
property.description: The default status of a certificate -- ok or revoked -- if no current CRL is available in the cache.

property.name: CryptographicProfile
property.summary: The SSL client profile to use for this connection.
property.description: A profile describing the SSL credentials and configuration parameters to use when establishing a connection over SSL to fetch the CRL. May be used with both CRL fetch over HTTPS, and CRL fetch over LDAP over SSL.

property.name: URL
property.summary: The URL of the Certificate Revocation List
property.description: A URL that specifies the location of the Certificate Revocation List -- required when the protocol used to obtain the CRL is HTTP.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the LDAP server from which to obtain the Certificate Revocation List. Required when the protocol is LDAP.

property.name: RemotePort
property.description: Specify an integer in the range of 1 through 65535 with a default of 389 that identifies the remote LDAP port. Required when the protocol is LDAP. For LDAP over SSL the standard port is 636.

property.name: DN
property.description: A string containing the DN (distinguished name) of the Certificate Authority that issued the target CRL. Required when the protocol is LDAP.

property.name: BindDN
property.description: A string containing the DN (distinguished name) used to login to the LDAP server.

property.name: BindPass
property.description: A string containing the password used to login to the LDAP server.

value.name: MIMEContentOnly
value.description: Process MIME part content only.

value.name: MIMEContentAndHeader
value.description: Process both MIME part content and MIME part header.

type.description: Determines whether only the MIME part content is processed or whether both the MIME part content and header are processed

type.name: dmCryptoSwAVersion
type.description: The version of WS-Security SOAP Messages with Attachment (SwA) Profile

value.name: legacy
value.display: Match exact certificate or immediate issuer
value.description: The behavior is that the Validation Credentials contains either the exact peer certificate to match or the immediate issuer's certificate, which could be an intermediate CA or a root CA. This mode is useful when you want to match the peer certificate exactly, but that certificate is not a self-signed (root) certificate.

value.name: pkix
value.description: The complete certificate chain is checked from subject to root when using this Validation Credentials for certificate validation. Validation succeeds only if the chain ends with a root certificate in the Validation Credentials. Non-root certificates in the Validation Credentials will be used as untrusted intermediate certificates. Additional untrusted intermediate certificates will be obtained dynamically from the context at hand (SSL handshake messages, PKCS#7 tokens, PKIPath tokens, and so forth).

type.name: dmCryptoWSSSignatureTokenReferenceMechanism

value.name: Direct
value.description: A BinarySecurityToken is placed in the message and a Reference element with a URI fragment pointing to the BinarySecurityToken is used to refer to it.

value.name: KeyIdentifier
value.description: A reference is made using a KeyIdentifier element with a SubjectKeyIdentifier ValueType and content.

value.name: ThumbPrintSHA1
value.description: A reference is made using a KeyIdentifier element with a ThumbPrintSHA1 ValueType and content. This is a WS-Security 1.1 feature. It should only be used if the "WS-Security Version" is set to at least 1.1.

value.name: ThumbprintSHA1
value.description: A reference is made using a KeyIdentifier element with a ThumbprintSHA1 ValueType and content. This is a WS-Security 1.1 feature. It should only be used if the "WS-Security Version" is set to at least 1.1.

value.name: X509IssuerSerial
value.description: A reference is made using an X509IssuerSerial element that identifies a certificate by its X.509 Issuer and Serial Number.

type.description: The method used to reference the security token in a WS-Security message.

type.name: dmCryptoWSSTokenReferenceMechanism

value.name: Direct
value.description: A BinarySecurityToken is placed in the message and a Reference element with a URI fragment pointing to the BinarySecurityToken is used to refer to it.

value.name: KeyIdentifier
value.description: A reference is made using a KeyIdentifier element with a SubjectKeyIdentifier ValueType and content.

value.name: ThumbPrintSHA1
value.description: A reference is made using a KeyIdentifier element with a ThumbPrintSHA1 ValueType and content. This is a WS-Security 1.1 feature. It should only be used if the WS-Security Version is set to at least 1.1.

value.name: ThumbprintSHA1
value.description: A reference is made using a KeyIdentifier element with a ThumbprintSHA1 ValueType and content. This is a WS-Security 1.1 feature. It should only be used if the WS-Security Version is set to at least 1.1.

value.name: EncryptedKeySHA1
value.description: A reference is made using a KeyIdentifier element with an EncryptedKeySHA1 ValueType and content. This is a WS-Security 1.1 feature. It should only be used if the WS-Security Version is set to at least 1.1.

value.name: X509IssuerSerial
value.description: A reference is made using an X509IssuerSerial element that identifies a certificate by its X.509 Issuer and Serial Number.

type.description: The method used to reference the security token in a WS-Security message.

value.name: http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509
value.description: Generates http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509

value.name: http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509v3
value.description: Generates http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509v3

description.p: Controls the value of BinarySecurityToken/@ValueType and of SecurityTokenReference/Reference/@ValueType when referring to a BinarySecurityToken that is an X.509 token.

Because of the differences between the final WS-Security 1.0 standards and the multiple draft versions of its errata document, different values of the ValueType attribute are used by different WS-Security implementations.
Compatibility with certain versions of .NET Web Services Enhancements (WSE) might require setting this option to #X509v3.
Compatibility with certain versions of WebSphere might require setting this option to #X509.
This setting is relevant only if the X.509 token type parameter is X.509.

value.name: http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509v3SubjectKeyIdentifier
value.description: Generates http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509v3SubjectKeyIdentifier

value.name: http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509SubjectKeyIdentifier
value.description: Generates http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509SubjectKeyIdentifier

description.p: Controls the value of KeyIdentifier/@ValueType.

Because of the differences between the final WS-Security 1.0 standards and the multiple draft versions of its errata document, different values of the ValueType attribute are used by different WS-Security implementations.
Compatibility with certain versions of .NET Web Services Enhancements (WSE) might require setting this option to #X509SubjectKeyIdentifier.
Compatibility with certain versions of WebSphere might require setting this option to #X509v3SubjectKeyIdentifier.
This option is relevant only when the WS-Security Version is 1.0 and the Token Reference Mechanism is KeyIdentifier.

value.name: X509
value.description: An X.509 signature-verfication certificate. (URI #X509v3)

value.name: PKCS7
value.description: A list of X.509 certificates and (optionally) CRLs packaged in a PKCS#7 wrapper. (URI #PKCS7)

value.name: PKIPath
value.description: An ordered list of X.509 certificates that are packaged in a PKIPath. (URI #X509PKIPathv1)

description.p: Determines the WS-Security X.509 Binary Security Token "TokenType" attribute for the created token

type.name: dmCryptoWSSXVersion
type.description: The version of WS-Trust/WS-SecureConversation specs to use, usally they are updated together.

type.name: dmDebugMode

value.name: on
value.description: Enables the probe, but can capture only three (3) concurrent transactions.

value.name: off
value.description: Disables the probe.

value.name: unbounded
value.summary: Enables the probe with unbounded maximum concurrency
value.description: Enables the probe and captures all concurrent transactions. The probe in this mode consumes significant resources and can slow down transaction processing.

type.description: Select the behavior of the probe.

property.name: Match
property.description:
Provide a literal or wildcard expression to define a URL set included in this cache policy. The following wildcard characters are available when defining the URL set.
asterisk (*) Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?) Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] ) Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: Type
property.description: Select the cache type. The cache type determines whether URL group members are cached and the mechanism to use to remove cache entries. The default is is Protocol-Based.

property.name: TTL
property.description: Configures lifetime in seconds of document in cache for policy type 'fixed'. Enter an integer between 5 and 86400. The default is 900 (seconds).

property.name: Priority
property.description: The priority value is used when the cache attains its maximum configured size, in documents or in bytes. When either size limit is reached, the cached document(s) with the lowest priority is removed. If multiple documents exist at the same lowest priority, a FIFO algorithm selects the document to be deleted. Allowable values fall within the range 1 through 255. The default is 128.

description.p:
Caches documents that are defined by the Match expression. HTTP caching rules (as defined in Section 13 of RFC 2616, Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP 1.1) specify the cache-lifetime. Policy is set as follows:
If the document does not contain a Data and/or Last-Modified header, do not cache.
If the document contains a Vary header, do not cache.
If the document contains an (HTTP 1.1) Cache-Control header, cache and use the contents of that field to determine a document cache-lifetime.
If the document contains an (HTTP 1.0) Expires header, cache and use the contents of that field to determine a document cache-lifetime.
If the document contains a Last-Modified header, cache and use the contents of that field, in conjunction with the Data header, to heuristically determine a document cache-lifetime. The cache-lifetime is not to exceed 8 hours.

value.name: no-cache
value.description: Does not cache documents that are defined by the Match expression.

value.name: fixed
value.description: Caches documents that are defined by the Match expression. The TTL property specifies the cache-lifetime, the length of time the document is retained in the cache.

type.name: dmDomainConfigMode

value.name: local
value.description: The domain configuration is maintained in the saved configuration of the local device.

value.name: import
value.description: The domain configuration is stored remotely. The configuration will be imported each time the domain or system is restarted. When selected, specify the URL of this resource.

type.description: Remote or local configuration.

value.name: CopyFrom
value.display: Allow files to be copied from
value.description: Files can be copied from the local: directory.

value.name: CopyTo
value.display: Allow files to be copied to
value.description: Files can be copied to the local: directory.

value.name: Delete
value.description: Files can be deleted from the local: directory.

value.name: Display
value.display: Allow file content to be displayed
value.description: File content can be displayed for the local: directory.

value.name: Exec
value.display: Allow files to be run as scripts
value.description: Files in the local: directory can be run as scripts.

value.name: Subdir
value.description: Subdirectories can be created in the local: directory.

value.name: Audit
value.description: Adding/Deleting file or directory generates audit events

value.name: Log
value.description: Adding/Deleting file or directory generates log events

value.name: http
value.description: Enable processing of 'http://' URLs in this domain.

value.name: https
value.description: Enable processing of 'https://' URLs in this domain.

value.name: snmp
value.description: Enable processing of 'snmp://' URLs in this domain.

value.name: ftp
value.description: Enable processing of 'ftp://' URLs in this domain.

value.name: mailto
value.description: Enable processing of 'mailto:' URLs in this domain.

value.name: mq
value.description: Enable processing of 'mq://' URLs in this domain.

type.name: dmDPSpecificFeatures

value.name: use-dynamic-enccert
value.display: Use Dynamically Configured Recipient Certificate For Encryption

value.name: verify-check-timestamp-off
value.display: Turn off Timestamp check during verification of signature

type.summary: WS-Security Policy: This turns on DataPower specific features

property.name: Name
property.description: Enter the name of the threshold. This name appears in the logs when the threshold action is taken.

property.name: Type
property.description: Retain the default value.

property.name: Value
property.description: Enter the threshold value in milliseconds.

property.name: Action
property.description: Select the monitor policy (Message Filter Action) implemented by the monitor when the target message type exceeds the threshold value. Click the + button to create a new action.

value.name: messages
value.description: The time interval between the receipt of a client request to the transmission of the associated server response. This interval is the full transaction cycle.

value.name: requests
value.description: The time interval between the receipt of a client request to its transmission to the target server. This interval is the time spent by the DataPower device in processing a client request.

value.name: server
value.description: The interval between the transmission of a client request to the server and the receipt of its associated server response. This interval is the server processing time.

value.name: responses
value.description: The interval between the receipt of a server response and its transmission to the target client. This interval is the time spent by the DataPower device in processing a server response.

type.name: dmEncodingScheme

value.name: NotSet
value.description: Uses the encoding set by the IMS Connect Handler object or by a transform action in the processing policy.

value.name: Default
value.description: Uses the encoding set by the message.

value.name: UTF8
value.description: Uses UTF8 encoding.

value.name: UCS2
value.description: Uses UCS2 encoding.

value.name: UTF16
value.description: Uses UTF16 encoding.

type.description: Unicode encoding schema

value.name: Auto
value.description: Perform standard IEEE 802.3 auto-negotiation for interface speed and direction. Preference is given to the highest speed. Preference is for full-duplex over half-duplex.

value.name: 1000baseTx-FD
value.description: Use 1000BASE-T PHY, always full-duplex. Tries to lock speed at 1000 mbps (1 gbps), but retains auto-negotiation over master versus slave. (On some interfaces, this setting is the same as Auto.)

value.name: 100baseTx-FD
value.description: Force 100BASE-TX PHY (100 mbps) in full-duplex mode.

value.name: 100baseTx-HD
value.description: Force 100BASE-TX PHY (100 mbps) in half-duplex mode.

value.name: 10baseT-FD
value.description: Force 10BASE-T PHY (10 mbps) in full-duplex mode.

value.name: 10baseT-HD
value.description: Force 10BASE-T PHY (10 mbps) in half-duplex mode.

property.name: ExtensionFunctionNamespace
property.description: Enter namespace of the extension function(s) used in the custom stylesheets. For example, "http://www.fredspace/extensions".

property.name: ExtensionFunction
property.description: Enter the extension function within the namespace to map. For example, "nodeset()".

property.name: LocalFunctionNamespace
property.description: Enter the local namespace if it is other than the DataPower default (shown in the box).

property.name: LocalFunction
property.description: Enter the local function to use in place of the extension function identified above. For example, "node-set()."

value.name: var://local/buffered-attachments
value.description: This variable returns data in the same format as the Attachment Manifest. However it only returns data for attachments that have been buffered in. It will not read more attachment data from the network as is the case for the Manifst.

value.name: var://local/attachment-content-ids
value.description: List of attachment identifiers (both content-location and content-id) including those that were processed through the system unbuffered (if multistep is told to save these attachment cids)

value.name: var://local/clone-attachments
value.summary: Copy the Attachments Into the Named Context
value.description: Copy the attachments in the context to the context with the name of the variable value. If the context does not exist it will be created. If the context does exist, any attachments in that context will be overwritten

value.name: var://local/_internal/ap_conformance/ap_cid
value.description: Internal variable used when creating multistep session for schema validating attachments for Attachment Profile. Indicates to current multistep session that input is an attachment (with content id the value of the variable) that should be validated against the wsdl

value.name: var://local/_internal/ap_conformance/results_err_msg
value.summary: Attachment Schema Validation Results Error Message
value.description: Internal variable used to store the error message when schema validating an attachment for Attachment Profile. Because the service://error_message will be cleared since we may be onError continue we need an additional variable to store attachment validation session errors

value.name: var://local/mime/conformance/results
value.description: Log of Attachment Profile 1.0 conformance failures for the attachments in this context

value.name: var://local/content-type
value.description: This variable returns the content-type value associated with a multistep context. It will return a multipart/related value if the context contains attachments.

value.name: var://local/_extension/responsecode
value.description: This variable is set on an Output context to indicate the protocol level response code of dp:url-open() extension function as well as results and fetch actions. For instance, if an action of the form "results tmpvar2 http://foo.bar.com/foome.asp tmpvar3" was successful, the value "200" would be automatically written into the variable var://context/tmpvar3/_extension/responsecode.

value.name: var://local/_extension/header/
value.description: The variables of the form "_extension/header/*" can be set to append headers to the dp:url-open() extension function as well as results and fetch actions connection when a context containing them is used as the Input context to an action. For example "setvar tmpvar2 var://local/_extension/header/X-foo bar" "results tmpvar2 http://foo.bar.com/foome.asp tmpvar3" would add the http header "X-foo: bar" to the HTTP request.

value.name: var://local/_extension/sslprofile
value.description: This variable can be set on the Input context to a dp:url-open() extension function as well as results and fetch actions. to override the selection of an SSL Proxy Profile used for that particular action. For instance "results tmpvar2 https://foo.bar.com/foome.asp tmpvar3" would normally use the SSL Proxy Profile associated with any user-agent config for the url "https://foo.bar.com/foome.asp" but if the profile needed to be determined progamatically, perhaps based on AAA it could be setup like this (dynamically resolving the value of *sslprofiletouse) "setvar tmpvar2 var://local/_extension/sslprofile var://context/notepad/sslprofiletouse" "results tmpvar2 https://foo.bar.com/foome.asp tmpvar3".

value.name: var://local/_extension/timeout
value.description: This variable can be set to override the default connection timeout parameters for this action when an action uses a context with these variables as its input. It is expressed in seconds.

value.name: var://local/_extension/response-header/
value.description: This variable in the output context of a dp:url-open() extension function as well as results and fetch actions that contain the response headers.

value.name: var://local/_extension/response-headers
value.description: This variable in the output context of a dp:url-open() extension function as well as results and fetch actions that contain the response header manifest.

value.name: var://local/_extension/allow-compression
value.description: This variable can be set to allow the compression of the outgoing results content and negotiate the returned document to be compressed if the underlying protocol supports it. If HTTP is being used that means the content-encoding and accept-encoding headers.

value.name: var://local/_extension/prevent-persistent-connection
value.description: This variable can be set to prevent persistent connections of the outgoing results and fetch calls that are associated with this context. Wherever appropriate, persistent connections are supported by default.

value.name: var://local/_extension/donot-follow-redirect
value.description: This variable can be set to prevent the following of protocol level redirect sequences on the outgoing results and fetch calls that are associated with this context. Redirects are followed by default.

value.name: var://local/_extension/http-10-only
value.description: This variable can be set to prevent the use of HTTP 1.1 when doing results and fetch actions on the related context.

value.name: var://local/_extension/error
value.description: This variable contains the error message, if any, from the last dp:transform(), dp:parse(), or dp:document() invocation. If the variable is empty, no error occurred. If an error occurs in any subsequent call to one of these functions, the existing error message, if any, will be overwritten.

value.name: var://local/_extension/donot-rewrite-host
value.description: This variable can be set to prevent the rewriting of the HTTP Host header on the outgoing results and fetch calls that are associated with this context. The HTTP Host header is rewritten by default.

type.name: dmExternalAttachedPolicy

property.name: ExternalAttachWSDLComponentType
property.description: Select a type of WSDL Component

property.name: ExternalAttachWSDLComponentValue
property.summary: The name of the WSDL Component
property.description: Enter the qname of a wsdl component formatted {ns}ncname

property.name: ExternalAttachPolicyURL
property.description: Select a document containing policy to be attached

property.name: ExternalAttachPolicyFragmentID
property.description: Matches Fragment Identifier

type.summary: Attach a policy document to a service

value.name: forbid
value.description: Forbids external references. The parser stops when the document contains external references.

value.name: ignore
value.description: The parser ignores external DTDs and replace external entities with an empty string.

value.name: allow
value.description: The parser resolves all external references.

type.name: dmFilePollerType
type.description: Type of file poller service.

value.name: notify
value.description: Adds a log entry at the specified log priority.

value.name: reject
value.description: Rejects the transaction and adds a log entry at the specified log priority.

value.name: shape
value.description: Adds a log entry at the specified log priority. Messages are buffered and processed at a rate that is less than the threshold. When the buffer is full, messages are rejected.

value.name: static-backend
value.description: The firewall communicates with the server that is identified by a remote IP address and remote port. The firewall can process request and response messages using the selected policy. An SSL Client Profile can be used for communication with the server. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

value.name: loopback-proxy
value.description: The firewall processes the incoming request using the selected policy and returns the result to the client. No server is involved. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

value.name: dynamic-backend
value.description: The firewall identifies the backend server by examining the request. The firewall can process request and response messages using the selected policy. An SSL Client Profile can be used for communication with the server. An SSL Server Profile can be selected to manage SSL communication with the client.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.description: The address on which the service listens. The default of 0 indicates that the service is active on all addresses. Click Select Alias to use an alias for this value. Local host aliases help to ease migration tasks between machines. See Local Host Alias under Networking for more.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: The local TCP port number that supports server operations
property.description: An integer (within the range 1 through 65535, with a default of 3000) that specifies the port monitored by the stateful raw XML over TCP service.

property.name: UseSSL
property.description: Use SSL for this front side server port. Make sure the ssl proxy profile configured on this object is configured for server/reverse connections

value.name: auth-off
value.description: Do not use the FTP AUTH command to encrypt the command connection. The username and password will be passed in the clear.

value.name: auth-tls-opt
value.description: Use the FTP AUTH TLS command to encrypt the command connection using TLS, if available.

value.name: auth-tls-req
value.description: Use the FTP AUTH TLS command to encrypt the command connection using TLS, fail if not available.

type.name: dmFTPCCCPolicy

value.name: ccc-off
value.description: Leave the FTP command connection encrypted after (optional) authentication with the USER and PASS commands. The command connection will remain secure, but will be incompatible with NAT and many firewalls.

value.name: ccc-opt
value.description: Use the FTP CCC command to request the end of encryption on the command connection using TLS, if supported by the server.

value.name: ccc-req
value.description: Use the FTP CCC command to request the end of encryption on the command connection using TLS, fail if the server does not support CCC. (Very few server support CCC.) Required for compatibility with NAT and many firewalls.

type.display: FTP Stop Encryption After Authentication Policy

value.name: disallow
value.description: Does not allow the FTP client to encrypt data connections.

value.name: allow
value.description: Allows, but does not require, the FTP client to encryp data connections. TLS must be allowed on data connections.

value.name: require
value.description: Requires the FTP client to encrypt data connections. TLS should be required on data connections.

value.name: enc-data-off
value.description: Even when the command channel is encrypted, do not encrypt FTP data connections. Use the FTP PROT C command when the command channel is or has been encrypted.

value.name: enc-data-opt
value.description: Request encryption of FTP data connections using the FTP PROT P command. Required when the command channel is or has been encrypted. Do not fail if server does not support data encryption.

value.name: enc-data-req
value.description: Request encryption of FTP data connections using the FTP PROT P command. Required when the command channel is or has been encrypted. Fail if server does not support data encryption.

value.name: ascii
value.description: Transfer files as ASCII data. This mode allow standardization of end-of-line conventions between different operating systems. This mode increases the overhead at both ends. Uses the FTP TYPE A command.

value.name: binary
value.description: Transfer files as image data. This mode transfers data as binary 8-bit bytes. This mode is more efficient (less overhead at both ends). Some XML files, such as signed files, must be transferred in this mode. Uses the FTP TYPE I command.

value.name: virtual-ephemeral
value.description: The FTP server will have an ephemeral virtual file system with subdirectories created by configuration. The contents of this file system are private to an individual FTP control connection to the FTP server. The contents of this file system will not persist after this FTP control connection ends.

value.name: virtual-persistent
value.description: The FTP server will have a persistent virtual file system with subdirectories created by configuration. The contents of this file system are shared by all FTP control connections to this FTP server with the same authenticated user identity. The user identity is determined by the FTP user name and, if used, by the TLS/SSL certificate. The contents of this file system will persist after all FTP control connections end for a duration defined by Persistent Filesystem Timeout. This mode is required to support checkpoint/restart using the REST command.

value.name: transparent
value.description: The FTP server has a transparent file system. The files and directories shown are those on the back end of the associated Multi-Protocol Gateway.

value.name: allow
value.description: Allows, but does not require, the FTP client to use the PASV command to open data connections to the FTP server.

value.name: disallow
value.description: Does not allow the FTP client to use the PASV command to open data connections to the FTP server. The FTP server will open all data connections to the FTP client (as directed by the FTP PORT command). This mode is not always compatible with firewalls.

value.name: require
value.description: Requires the FTP client to use the PASV command to open all data connections with the FTP server. This mode is useful when the FTP server is behind a firewall device that requires clients to use passive mode.

value.name: pasv-off
value.description: Do not use the FTP PASV command to allow the client to open the FTP data connections. The FTP server will open all data connections to the FTP client. Often incompatible with firewalls

value.name: pasv-opt
value.description: Use the FTP PASV command to request that the FTP client be allowed to open all data connections to the FTP server, but do not fail if the server does not support PASV.

value.name: pasv-req
value.description: Use the FTP PASV command to request that the FTP client be allowed to open all data connections to the FTP server, and fail if the server does not support PASV.

property.name: RegExp
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*) Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?) Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] ) Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: Passive
property.summary: Controls use of FTP Passive mode
property.description: Select how to use the FTP Passive mode to control in which direction FTP data connections are made.

property.name: AuthTLS
property.summary: Controls use of TLS to secure connections
property.description: Select how to use TLS to secure FTP command connections.

property.name: UseCCC
property.description: Select how to control the cessation of FTP command channel encryption after user authentication. Encryption must be stopped for compatibility with NAT (Network Address Translation) and other firewall applications. Although this might be a security risk, there is no other option when NAT is in use.

property.name: EncryptData
property.description: Select how to control encryption of file transfers. Compatible with NAT in all settings.

property.name: DataType
property.description: Select the default file transfer data type. In most cases, the value of binary is appropriate.

property.name: SlashSTOU
property.display: Write Unique Filename if Trailing Slash
property.summary: Creates a unique file if the name contains a trailing slash

description.p: Select how to create unique files if the name contains a trailing slash.

Some FTP servers provide the STOU command. Use the command only if the FTP server supports this command. The STOU command allows the server to choose the unique file name in the current directory. Using the STOU command does not require the client to choose a unique file name.
When enabled and a URL is given to write that ends in a /, the server uses the STOU command instead of the STOR command.

property.name: QuotedCommands
property.description: This specifies a list of FTP commands to be sent to the server before each FTP STOR, STOU, or RETR command. A typical use would be to use "SITE" commands, such as "SITE RECFM=FB" for the MVS domain on a z/OS system. These commands cannot be data-transfer related, such as STOU, RETR, PORT, PASV, etc.

property.name: SizeCheck
property.summary: Perform Size check after file transfer
property.description: If set to Optional, do a size check after the file transfer is complete. This uses the SIZE command, and compares the returned number to the number of bytes transferred "over the wire" for the file transfer. If the number is not equal, the file transfer is marked as failing. If the FTP server does not support the SIZE command, no error results. Some FTP servers, particulary vsftpd in the default configuration, provide inaccurate SIZE responses for files transferred in ASCII mode. If you get such errors, you can disable this feature. (Alternately you can reconfigure vsftpd.)

property.name: QuotedCommand
property.description: This is one command to send to the remote FTP server. The command must not be one that would create an FTP data connection. Normally this will be a SITE comamnd.

value.name: temporary
value.description: Stores response files in temporary storage on the system. This storage has limited size. Using temporary storage reduces the available system storage for processing. Temporary storage should not be used when using a virtual persistent file system. In virtual persistent file systems, it is highly unlikely that there would be enough space. After a system restart or power cycle, response files are not available.

value.name: nfs
value.description: Stores response files on the top level directory of the specified NFS server. Only the NFS server limits the storage space.

value.name: none
value.description: Indicates that no response is made available to the client. Any response from the backend server is dropped.

value.name: virtual-filesystem
value.description: Indicates that the response is made available as a file in the virtual file system that can be read by the FTP client. The directory for responses is configured on a per-virtual directory basis. The suffix specified by Response Suffix is added to the input file name and stored in the directory specified by Response Storage.

value.name: ftp-client
value.description: Indicates that the response is written by the FTP client. The response is not made available using the FTP server. The response is written to the URL specified by Response URL. The file name consists of the incoming file name plus the suffix specified by Response Suffix.

property.name: VirtualPath
property.summary: Directory in virtual file system of the FTP server
property.description: Enter the directory in the virtual file system of the FTP server where the FTP client can find this directory.

property.name: ResponseDirectory
property.summary: Virtual directory in which to put responses
property.description: Enter the directory in the virtual file system of the FTP server where the responses to files that are stored in this directory will go.

value.name: size-check-optional
value.description: If the FTP SIZE command is available, uses this command to check the file transfer size after file transfer.

value.name: size-check-disabled
value.description: Do not check file size after transfer.

description.p: Always use the supplied file name in the URL to generate the target file name requested on the server. If the URL ends in a slash, the request generally fails.
Uses the FTP STOR command to initiate the transfer. The STOR command is only a directory specification, without a file name specification.

value.name: slash-stou-on
value.display: Request Unique File Name When Trailing Slash

description.p: If the supplied file name ends in a slash, use the STOU command to write a unique file name. The slash must be before the ? that initiates the query parameters or before the ; that begins the suffix.

Uses the FTP STOU command to intiate the transfer and requests that the server generate a unique file name within the target directory. This approach is the only safe way to have multiple systems write files to the same directory without overwriting any files.
The transfer fails if the FTP server does not support the STOU command.

value.name: dynamic
value.summary: Deduce attachment format (MIME or DIME) from content

value.name: detect
value.summary: Detect attachment format from the message data

value.name: static-backend
value.description: The gateway sends all requests to the URL defined by the backend URL. The format of the URL determines the protocol that is used for the backend (server) communication.

value.name: dynamic-backend
value.description: The gateway determines the URL of the backend server dynamically during request processing. The URL determines the protocol used for the backend communication. Use this mode if any of the Front Side Handlers is Stateful Raw XML.

property.name: Direction
property.description: Select the direction of the message.

property.name: HeaderTag
property.description: Enter the name of the header to inject. Even though the headers are not defined in the original request, the device provides the specified headers to the backend server.

property.name: HeaderTagValue
property.description: Enter the value for the header tag.

property.name: Direction
property.description: Select the direction of the message.

property.name: HeaderTag
property.description: Enter the name of the header to suppress. When these headers are defined in the original request, the device removes the specified headers before forwarding the request to the backend server.

property.name: Front
property.description: Select the HTTP version to use on the client-side connection. The default is HTTP 1.1.

property.name: Back
property.description: Select the HTTP version to use on the server-side connection. The default is HTTP 1.1.

property.name: Name
property.summary: The name of an HTTP header field
property.description: Enter the name of the HTTP header field to be examined.

property.name: Value
property.summary: The value of HTTP Header field

description.p: Provide a literal or wildcard expression to define a set of values to include in or exclude from the traffic definition. If the contents of the specified header field fulfill the defined match criterion, the match succeeds.
The following wildcard characters are available:

tr.td: Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
Matches one occurrence of any single character

Defines a character or numeric range.
For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

value.name: front
value.description: The message travels from the DataPower device to the client.

value.name: back
value.description: The message travels from the DataPower device to the backend server.

type.name: dmHTTPInputEncoding

value.name: plain
value.description: The expected encoding is plain text and the requested processing is to XML escape the input. All <, >, and & characters are replaced by <, >, and & respectively. This option is synonymous with URL-encoded, because URL-encoding in an HTTP GET or POST is always decoded.

value.name: urlencoded
value.description: The expected encoding is URL-encoded, as in HTML forms, and the requested processing is to URL unescape, then XML escape the input. All <, >, and & characters are replaced by <, >, and & respectively.

value.name: xml
value.description: The expected encoding is an XML fragment and the requested processing, because the input is a literal, is no processing. If the fragment includes a leading XML declaration (of the form <?xml ?>), the declaration is removed. All other characters are passed unchanged. The input must be a balanced block of XML. If not balanced, the generated XML will not parse correctly. This option is synonymous with URL-encoded XML, because URL-encoding in an HTTP GET or POST is always decoded.

value.name: urlencoded-xml
value.description: The expected encoding is a URL-encoded XML fragment and the requested processing, because the input is a literal, is no processing. If the fragment includes a leading XML declaration (of the form <?xml ?>), the declaration is removed. All other characters are passed unchanged. The input must be a balanced block of XML. If not balanced, the generated XML will not parse correctly.

value.name: base64
value.description: The expected encoding is Base 64 and the requested processing is to pass the input through but add the XML attribute encoding="base64" to the generated <arg> element for each argument which has this input encoding. If the base 64 data should include any illegal <, >, or & character, it is replaced by <, >, and & respectively.

value.name: base64-xml
value.summary: The value is a Base64 encoded XML fragment (decoded).

type.description: Controls how the value in an HTTP form is traslated to generate XML. All of the options start with URL-decoding, except in an HTTP MIME POST. URL-decoding is not required for an HTTP MIME POST.

type.name: dmHTTPRequestMethods
type.summary: HTTP request methods that are allowed

type.name: dmHTTPResponseCodes

value.name: HTTP-100
value.summary: The client continues with its request

value.name: HTTP-101
value.summary: The server uses the Upgrade message header field to change HTTP version or protocol

value.name: HTTP-201
value.summary: The request succeeded and created a new resource

value.name: HTTP-202
value.summary: The request accepted for processing, but processing not complete

value.name: HTTP-203
value.summary: The request accepted, but the returned information is from a local or third-party copy

value.name: HTTP-204
value.summary: The request accepted and might return meta-information that does not change view

value.name: HTTP-205
value.summary: The request accepted and the view reset

value.name: HTTP-206
value.summary: The server fulfilled the partial GET request for the resource

value.name: HTTP-300
value.summary: The request matches one of a set of representations, and a choice must be made

value.name: HTTP-301
value.summary: The server returned the new permanent URI for a link

value.name: HTTP-302
value.summary: The resource temporarily resides at a different URI

value.name: HTTP-303
value.summary: The resource resides at a different URI

value.name: HTTP-304
value.summary: The client is using a local, cached copy

value.name: HTTP-305
value.summary: The request resource accessed through a proxy

value.name: HTTP-307
value.summary: The resource temporarily resides at a different URI

value.name: HTTP-400
value.summary: The server does not understand the request because of syntax

value.name: HTTP-402
value.summary: The request requires a charge-to header

value.name: HTTP-403
value.summary: The server understood the request and denied access

value.name: HTTP-404
value.summary: The server could not find the resource

value.name: HTTP-405
value.summary: The resource does not allow the specified method

value.name: HTTP-406
value.summary: The resource cannot generate a response because the contents are not acceptable

value.name: HTTP-407
value.summary: The request requires user authentication through a proxy

value.name: HTTP-408
value.summary: The client did not response to the server in the allocated time

value.name: HTTP-409
value.summary: The request could not complete because of a conflict is resource state

value.name: HTTP-410
value.summary: The resource is no longer on the server and no redirection known

value.name: HTTP-411
value.summary: The server refused the request because no the Content-Length header absent

value.name: HTTP-412
value.summary: A precondition in a request-header field evaluated to false

value.name: HTTP-413
value.summary: The server refused the request because it is too large

value.name: HTTP-500
value.summary: The server encountered an unexpected error and cannot process request

value.name: HTTP-503
value.summary: The server cannot process the request because the service is not available

type.summary: HTTP response codes that are allowed

value.name: normal
value.description: The server returns the requested documents.

value.name: echo
value.description: The server returns the GET and POST requests that it receives.

value.name: ZIP
value.description: Imports the configuration from a compressed ZIP bundle.

value.name: XML
value.description: Imports configuration from the exported XML configuration files.

property.name: InputMatch
property.summary: The PCRE to match an HTTP form name against.
property.description: The PCRE pattern that will be matched against the name of an HTTP form field. If the name matches this PCRE, the associated value will be processed by the rules of the Encoding. If a form field has no name, an empty string is used for the pattern matching.

property.name: Encoding
property.summary: The Encoding used for values whose name matches the Input Match
property.description: Select how to translate the value of a form field to the contents of the <arg> element in the generated XML.

value.name: up
value.summary: Enabled, goal operational state is Up

value.name: down
value.summary: Disabled, goal operational state is Down

value.name: Ethernet
value.description: Indicates that it is on the base Ethernet MAC interface.

value.name: VLAN
value.description: Indicates that it is on an IEEE 802.1Q VLAN on top of the base Ethernet MAC interface.

value.name: XPATH
value.summary: XPath Expression which is applied against input context to derive a nodeset of nodes, then loop with one iteration per node in the nodeset.

value.name: COUNT
value.summary: Integer count, there is one loop iteration for each number from one (1) through the count, inclusive.

value.name: byte
value.description: The message payload is accessed as a Java byte array.

value.name: text
value.description: The message payload is accessed as a Java string value. This message type is suitable for SOAP and XML input.

property.name: Active
property.description: Enable or disable a health check. The check will not run unless enabled

property.name: URI
property.description: The relative URI to test for each member of the group. XXX in http://www.foobar.com/XXX.

property.name: Port
property.description: Enter the TCP Port number to test.

property.name: SSL
property.description: If this Load Balancer group contains LDAP servers, an anonymous bind is performed. Otherwise, the server is checked with the configured SOAP Request Document.

property.name: Post
property.description: If this is set to on, the SOAP Request Document will be submitted to the web service (i.e via an HTTP POST vs an HTTP GET without a request document). The response is then analyzed using the XPath Expression configured below to verify the state of health of the server.

property.name: Input
property.summary: SOAP Request Document, only used if send SOAP request is true
property.description: Enter the URL of the SOAP Request Document. This may be a file on the local flash filesystem (for example, local:///healthcheck.xml). This document is POSTed to the server if Send SOAP Request is on.

property.name: Timeout
property.summary: Number of seconds to allocate for check
property.description: Enter an integer between 2 and 86400 to indicate the number of seconds to wait for a response to a health check post. The default is 10.

property.name: Frequency
property.description: Enter an integer between 5 and 86400 to indicate the number of seconds to wait between health check posts. The default is 180.

property.name: XPath
property.summary: An XPath Expression for a healthy SOAP response
property.description: Enter an XPath Expression that verifies the health of the server. The expression is applied to the server's response to the health check POST. If the expression evaluates to true, the server is deemed healthy. Otherwise the server is quarantined until it passes a health check.

property.name: Filter
property.description: Enter the URL of the stylesheet that evaluates the server response using the XPath Expression entered above. The default is supplied with the device.

property.name: SSLProxyProfile
property.description: Select an existing SSL proxy profile for use with this health check. This is required if the back end server is using SSL communications with the DataPower device.

property.name: Server
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address or the real server.

description.p: When balancing with Weighted Round Robin the weight property indicates the relative priority of this server versus the other members of the group. The greater the weight, the higher the preference. Use an integer between 1 and 65000.

For example, assume three server pool members, A, B, and C, with assigned weights of 5, 3, and 2 respectively. As a result of this weighting, server A can expect to receive approximately 50% of client requests, server B can expect to receive approximately 30% of client requests, with server C receiving the remaining 20%.

property.name: MappedPort
property.description: Specify the port on the real server. If non-zero, the associated real server is contacted on this port. Normally the real server is contacted on the same port number as that of the virtual server and this should not be set to a value other than zero. However, if you have services that run on different ports for different memebers of the group, you might need to define this value.

property.name: Activity
property.description: This is a deprecated field.

property.name: HealthPort
property.description: Specify the TCP Port number to test.

value.name: Standard
value.description: The server is checked with the configured SOAP Request Document.

value.name: LDAP
value.description: The load balancer group contains LDAP servers. An anonymous bind is performed.

value.name: IMSConnect
value.description: The load balancer group contains IMS Connect servers. An anonymous bind is performed.

value.name: subtree
value.description: Searches the entry-level of the tree and any of its descendants.

value.name: one-level
value.description: Searches the entry-level of the tree and any object that is one level below.

value.name: base
value.summary: Searches the entry-level of the tree only.

value.name: round-robin
value.description: Maintains a simple list of servers and forwards a new connection to the next server in the list.

value.name: weighted-round-robin
value.summary: Balance the servers proportionally according to weight
value.description: Maintains a weighted list of servers and forwards new connections in proportion to the weight that is assigned to each server.

value.name: hash
value.summary: Base on IP address of the client
value.description: Uses the IP address of the client as the basis for server selection. The same client is served the same server. Use this approach for applications that require the storage of server-side sate information, such as cookies.

value.name: least-connections
value.description: Mantains a record of current active server connections and forwards a new connection to the server with the least number of active connections.

value.name: first-alive
value.description: Based on the concept of a primary and some number of backup servers. Assuming that the primary server is healthy, all connections are forwarded to this server. Connections are forwarded to backup servers only if the primary is quarantined or unhealthy.

value.name: rpcsec-gss
value.summary: RPC Security - Generic Security Service for NFS

property.name: Class
property.description: Select one event category from the list. To create a custom event category, click the + button. This screen also appears from the Administration-Log Categories menu selection. See Log Categories above for more information.

property.name: Priority
property.description: Select a mininum event priority from the list. The priorities are hierarchical. The lowest is listed last.

value.name: rotate
value.description: Rotate the log file when the maximum size is reached. When rotated, a copy of the file is created and a new file is started. Archived copies are retained up to the specified number of rotations. After this number is reached and the log file has reached its maximum size, the oldest file is deleted and the current file is copied.

value.name: upload
value.description: Upload the log file when the maximum size is reached using the specified upload method.

value.name: ftp
value.description: Use the File Transfer Protocol (FTP), as defined by RFC 959, to upload the file.

value.name: scp
value.description: Use the Secure Copy (SCP) protocol to upload the file. This protocol uses the secure shell (SSH).

value.name: sftp
value.description: Use the Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) to upload the file. This protocol uses the secure shell (SSH).

value.name: smtp
value.description: Use the Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP), as define by RFC 821, to upload the file.

value.name: cbe
value.summary: Events in IBM Common Base Event (CBE) format

value.name: csv
value.summary: Events in Comma Separated Value (CSV) format

value.name: audit
value.summary: Events in formatted audit text format

value.name: alert
value.summary: Alert: action must be taken immediately

property.name: Class
property.description: Select one type of object. This filter will restrict log messages to only those messages generated by the selected object.

property.name: Object
property.description: Enter the name of an object of the selected type.

property.name: FollowReferences
property.summary: Add objects referenced by log object
property.description: When set to Yes, applying the filter will generate additional Object Filters for all configuration objects that are referenced by the selected object. For example, an XML Firewall or XSL Proxy references an XML Manager object; when this radio button is set to Yes, Object Filters will be generated for the referenced XML Manager as well.

value.name: active
value.description: Normal operation state, no failures.

value.name: warning
value.description: Target is approaching failure conditions. Messages might be dropped. Check Error Info for more information.

value.name: failure
value.description: Target has failed. No messages are collected. Check Error Info for more information.

value.name: suspended
value.description: The target is busy. It is sending messages off of the device.

value.name: syslog
value.description: Uses the syslog-style timestamp for events. Can be used with all log types.

value.name: numeric
value.description: Uses A numeric timestamp for events. Can be used with all log types except syslog and syslog-ng.

value.name: zulu
value.description: Uses the zulu-style timestamp for events. Can be used with all log types except syslog and syslog-ng.

value.name: syslog
value.summary: Forwards to a remote syslog daemon (UDP).
value.description: Forwards log entries using UDP to a remote syslog daemon. The local address, remote address, remote port, syslog facility can be set. The processing rate can be limited.

value.name: syslog-ng
value.summary: Forwards to a remote syslog daemon (TCP).
value.description: Forwards log entries using TCP to a remote syslog daemon. The local address, remote address, remote port, syslog facility can be set. An SSL connection to the syslog host can be created. The processing rate can be limited.

value.name: smtp
value.description: Forwards log entries as email to the configured remote SNMP servers and email addresses. Before sending, the contents of the log can be encrypted or signed. The processing rate can be limited.

value.name: file
value.summary: Writes to a file on the device.
value.description: Writes log entries to a file on the device. The file can be archived using the rotate or upload method. The file can be emailed. The entire file can be encrypted and signed.

value.name: soap
value.description: Forwards log entries as SOAP messages. The URL can be set. The processing rate can be limited.

value.name: snmp
value.description: Forwards log entries as SNMP traps issued to all configured recipients. The processing rate can be limited.

value.name: nfs
value.summary: Writes to a file on an NFS server.
value.description: Writes log entries to a file on a remote NFS server. The file can be archived using the rotate or upload method. The file can be emailed. The entire file can be encrypted and signed. The processing rate can be limited.

value.name: LTPA
value.description: LTPA token version used by WebSphere Application Server release prior to version 5.1.0.2 (for z/OS) and prior to version 5.1.1 for other platforms. The default format for releases prior to version 6.1.

value.name: LTPA2
value.description: LTPA token version introduced in WebSphere Application Server version 5.1.0.2 (for z/OS) and version 5.1.1 for other platforms. The default format for version 6.1 and later.

value.name: LTPADomino
value.description: The LTPA-like Domino Session ID cookie. Domino can consume WebSphere version 1 tokens.

value.name: LTPA
value.description: LTPA token version used by WebSphere Application Server release prior to version 5.1.0.2 (for z/OS) and prior to version 5.1.1 for other platforms. The default format for releases prior to version 6.1.

value.name: LTPA1FIPS
value.description: LTPA token version which is FIPS compliant used by WebSphere Application Server release. It is supported in WebSphere Application Server v6.0 and later.

value.name: LTPA2
value.description: LTPA token version introduced in WebSphere Application Server version 5.1.0.2 (for z/OS) and version 5.1.1 for other platforms. The default format for version 6.1 and later.

value.name: LTPA2WAS7
value.description: LTPA token version 2 introduced in WebSphere Application Server version 7.0. This is the same as previous LTPA token version 2. The difference is in the ValueType attribute of the BinarySecurityToken.

value.name: LTPADomino
value.description: The LTPA-like Domino Session ID cookie. Domino can consume WebSphere version 1 tokens.

property.name: LTPAUserAttributeName
property.summary: Name of the user attribute included in the LTPA token
property.description: Specify the name of the user attribute included in the generated token. LTPA attributes are relevant for WebSphere LTPA tokens only.

property.name: LTPAUserAttributeType
property.description: Select the type of user attribute.

property.name: LTPAUserAttributeStaticValue
property.summary: Static value of the user attribute included in the LTPA token
property.description: Specify the fixed value of the LTPA user attribute. If the value contains the characters '$', ':', or '%', these characters are escaped.

property.name: LTPAUserAttributeXPathValue
property.summary: XPath expression that evaluates to the value of the user attribute included in the LTPA token
property.description: Specify the XPath expression or use the XPath Tool to create the XPath expression to be evaluated against the input message at runtime. The result of which will be set as the value of the attribute.

value.name: static
value.description: The attribute value is known at configuration time. When selected, specify fixed value for the named attribute.

value.name: xpath
value.description: The attribute value is resolved at runtime. When selected, specify the XPath Expression in the input message to be evaluated.

property.name: Type
property.description: Select the type of match template to use for evaluation purposes.

property.name: HttpTag
property.summary: The name of an HTTP header field
property.description: Used only when Matching Type is http, specifies the specific HTTP header field to be examined.

property.name: HttpValue
property.summary: The value of HTTP Header Tag
property.description: Used only when Matching Type is http, a shell-style match pattern, or literal string, that specifies the value of HTTP header tag. If the candidate HTTP header fulfills the match conditions specified by the HTTP Header Tag and HTTP Value Match fields, the match match succeeds.

property.name: Url
property.description: Used only when Matching Type is url, fullyqualifiedurl, or host. The match pattern is evaluated against /foo if type is url, http://host:port/foo if the type is fullyqualifiedurl, and against host:port if the type is host.

value.name: url
value.description: A match template that uses the specified shell-style URL match pattern against URL strings.

value.name: http
value.description: A match template that uses the specified HTTP header tag and shell-style value match pattern against the values for HTTP header fields.

value.name: errorcode
value.description: A match template that uses the specified shell-style event code match pattern against event codes.

value.name: xpath
value.description: A match template that uses the specified XPath expression match pattern against file contents.

value.name: fullyqualifiedurl
value.description: A legacy matching type that creates a match template that uses the specified shell-style URL match pattern against the path part of a URL. The match must be against the entire path. Use URL instead.

value.name: host
value.description: A legacy matching type that creates a match template that uses the specified shell-style URL match pattern against the host and port portions of the URL. The match occurs against the HTTP host header, which is the way that HTTP 1.1 does virtual hosting. Use HTTP instead.

value.name: mq
value.description: The Metadata category to support WebSphere MQ services.

value.name: tibco
value.description: The Metadata category to support TIBCO EMS services.

value.name: wasjms
value.description: The Metadata category to support WebSphere JMS services.

value.name: http
value.summary: Metadata supported by HTTP and HTTPS protocol services
value.description: The Metadata category to support HTTP and HTTPS protocols.

value.name: header
value.summary: User-defined metadata based on names of protocol headers
value.description: The Metadata category to support user-defined metadata items from any physical or virtual protocol header.

value.name: variable
value.summary: User-defined metadata based on variable names
value.description: The Metadata category to support user-defined metadata items from any service, context, or system variable.

property.name: MetaCategory
property.description: Select the category for the Metadata Item. The Metadata Item selections change according to the selected category. To create a custom Metadata Item, select either Custom Header or Custom Variable. For a custom Metadata Item, specify the name of the metadata item and its data source.

description.p: For all except custom items, select a Metadata Item. The list provides an alias for the actual name of a protocol header or system variable. The elements contained in the XML nodeset that is returned by the Processing Metadata object have names that correspond to the actual data source
For custom items, enter an alphanumeric string for this custom alias. The string cannot contain white space.

property.name: DataSource
property.summary: Data source for a custom item
property.description: For custom items only, enter the name of the protocol header or the name of the variable (service, context, or system) that contains the data to be returned in the metadata XML nodeset. The provided value is the name of the element in the returned nodeset that contains the data.

value.name: terminate-at-first-throttle
value.description: Monitors execute in the order in which they are listed. After any monitor either shapes (buffers to delay) or rejects a message, no further monitors will execute. If there are six monitors and the second monitor executes and rejects the message, the remaining monitors (three to six) do not execute.

value.name: terminate-at-first-match
value.description: Monitors execute in the order in which they are listed. After any monitor matches a message and takes any action at all, no further monitors will execute. If there are six monitors and the second monitor executes and logs the message, the remaining monitors (three to six) do not execute.

property.name: ClientGetQueue
property.description: The name of the queue that is polled for responses on the MQ Queue Manager.

property.name: ClientPutQueue
property.description: The name of the queue on the Queue Manager where requests are Put.

property.name: ClientPort
property.summary: The HTTP port for proxying requests
property.description: The HTTP Server port to which MQ requests are proxied.

value.name: None
value.description: No header to excract Content-Type

value.name: MQRFH
value.description: MQRFH header to extract Content-Type

value.name: MQRFH2
value.description: MQRFH2 header to extract Content-Type

type.name: dmMQMSDebugTriggerType

property.name: RuleType
property.description: Select the rule direction or type that will trigger the probe.

property.name: XPath
property.summary: XPath expression to match element in message
property.description: Specify an XPath expression of use the XPath Tool to define an XPath expression to match against messages. Messages that contain the expression will trigger the probe.

type.summary: Types of triggers that capture transactions

property.name: ServerGetQueue
property.description: This queue is actively polled by the gateway.

property.name: ServerPutQueue
property.description: This queue is where the responses to the requests are placed.

property.name: ServerPort
property.summary: The HTTP port to listen for requests
property.description: This port responds to HTTP POST requests.

type.name: dmMQSSLCiphers
type.description: The available cipher specifications for use with MQ/SSL

property.name: ClientIP
property.summary: PCRE to match client IP addresses
property.description: Specify a PCRE to match against client IP addresses. Requests from clients with matching IP addresses will trigger the probe. To create a match for all IP addresses, specify .* instead of * as the PCRE.

property.name: InURLMatch
property.summary: PCRE to match inbound URL requests
property.description: Specify a PCRE to match against the inbound URLs. Requests from clients with matching URLs will trigger the probe. To create a match for all URLs, specify .* instead of * as the PCRE.

property.name: OutURLMatch
property.summary: PCRE to match outbound URL responses
property.description: Specify a PCRE to match against the outbound URLs. Responses from servers with matching URLs will trigger the probe. To create a match for all URLs, specify .* instead of * as the PCRE.

property.name: RuleType
property.summary: Processing rules direction or type to match
property.description: Select the rule direction or type that will trigger the probe.

property.name: RuleMatch
property.summary: PCRE to match names of processing rules
property.description: Specify a PCRE to match against names of processing rules. Rules with matching names will trigger the probe. To create a match for all names, specify .* instead of * as the PCRE.

property.name: XPath
property.summary: XPath expression to match element in message
property.description: Specify an XPath expression of use the XPath Tool to define an XPath expression to match against messages. Messages that contain the expression will trigger the probe.

property.name: XPath
property.description: An XPath expression that defines which schema element or schema elements are subject to this rule. Click XPath Tool to launch the XPath expression builder. To use this tool, upload an example document. After the example document is loaded, the tool allows you to select the elements to construct the corresponding XPath expression. After selecting the elements, click Done to return to the MTOM Rules Properties window.

property.name: ContentType
property.description: The Content Type for the extracted element data. This option overrides the value that is attained from the xmlmime:contentType attribute. If the provided XPath matches more than one element, each corresponding MIME attachment part will contain a content-type header with this value. If different content-type values are required, selective XPath expressions are required.

property.name: ContentID
property.description: If not explicitly configured, content IDs are automatically generated. Using this property allows for the explicit configuration of content-id headers and their associated href values. Rules that match multiple data elements result in one attachment part for all matched elements. The resulting attachment part contains data from the last match only.

property.name: MaxParts
property.description: Maximum number of parts allowed. Defaults to 4.

property.name: MaxSizePerPart
property.description: Maximum size allowed for any one part. Defaults to 5000000.

property.name: MaxSize
property.display: Maximum Aggregate Size of All Parts
property.description: Maximum size allowed for all parts combined. Defaults to 5000000.

property.name: ContentTypeRestricted
property.description: If set, this forces the individual form-data content types to be matched against the general list of request acceptable content-type expressions.

description.p: Enter the name of an input or output expected by the map. This must be the same as a cardname identified in the map file. For example, "cardnum1".

property.name: Context
property.description: Enter the name of the DataPower processing context that contains the input data or will contain the output data corresponding to the input or output expected by the map. Use INPUT to designate the context containing the original request. Use OUTPUT to designate the standard DataPower output context.

type.name: dmNamedInOutLocationType

value.name: default
value.summary: Uses Input and Output contexts defined at action level
value.description: The action will use the Input and Output contexts defined for the action. This default works when the map defines only one input and only one output.

value.name: explicit
value.summary: Uses explicitly defined named inputs and named outputs
value.description: The action will use the contexts explicitly defined on the Named Inputs and Named Outputs tabs of the action configuration panels. The Input and Output contexts defined at the action level are ignored.

value.name: dynamic
value.summary: For Design Studio testing purposes only
value.description: Used by WebSphere Transformation Extender (WTX) Design Studio to test their generated maps against the DataPower appliance. This value is not valid for use on the appliance during service or action development. In other words, do not use this value in a development, test, or production environment on a DataPower appliance.

type.summary: Named Inputs and Outputs can be specified explicitly or dynamically, or can default to the unnamed regular input and output.

property.name: UDPPort
property.summary: UDP port monitored by the DNS server
property.description: The UDP port number (within the range 1 through 65535) monitored by the DNS server. By default, UDP port number 53 is used.

property.name: TCPPort
property.summary: TCP port monitored by the DNS server
property.description: The TCP port number (within the range 1 through 65535) monitored by the DNS server. By default, TCP port number 53 is used.

property.name: MaxRetries
property.summary: Maximum number of resolution request retries
property.description: The maximum number of times that an unacknowledged resolution request is retransmitted to a DNS server. By default, an unacknowledged resolution request is retried 3 times.

property.name: AutomaticRetry
property.description: The device can automatically retry connecting to the remote host when a TCP connection failure occurs.

property.name: RetryInterval
property.summary: Seconds to wait between retrying failing connections.
property.description: This sets the number of seconds to wait between attempting to retry failed connections to a remote host.

property.name: ReportingInterval
property.summary: Only log a failure as an error at this interval.
property.description: The number of failed retries between creation of error log messages.

property.name: TotalRetries
property.summary: Total number of times to retry.
property.description: Total number of times to retry before giving up.

type.name: dmNFSAuthenticationType

value.name: auth_sys
value.description: Use the original system level authentication, based solely on IP address and host name.

value.name: krb5
value.description: Use Kerberos Version 5 for authentication of mounts, with no protection of the integrity or confidentiality of NFS data.

value.name: krb5i
value.summary: Kerberos Version 5 with data integrity protection
value.description: Use Kerberos Version 5 for authentication of mounts, with a secure hash to provide data integrity protection.

value.name: krb5p
value.summary: Kerberos Version 5 with data confidentiality protection
value.description: Use Kerberos Version 5 for authentication of mounts, with date confidentiality protection. Uses encryption to protect the data from being read by the network, in addition to using a secure hash to protect against undetected corruption by the network.

type.description: Type of NFS authentication on mounts.

type.name: dmNFSMountState

value.name: new
value.summary: The mount is newly created. Mounting has not yet started.

value.name: up
value.summary: The mount process is complete and healthy. Files can be opened.

value.name: down
value.summary: The mount process is complete, but the server is down or unreachable.

value.name: unmounting
value.summary: The unmount process is in progress.

value.name: unmountingForRemount
value.summary: The unmount process is in progress to change mount parameters. When the unmount process is complete, will remount.

value.name: defective
value.summary: The mount process cannot complete because of a corrupt state or because of the configuration.

type.description: State of an NFS Mount.

type.name: dmNFSMountType
type.description: Type of NFS mount service.

value.name: tcp
value.description: Uses TCP. TCP is more reliable and allows larger read and write operations than UDP. If selected and not available, falls back to UDP.

value.name: udp
value.description: Uses UDP. Some early NFS Version 2 servers support only UDP.

value.name: MQ2HTTP
