value.summary: Listen on a TCP port for an incoming HTTP request

value.name: HTTP2MQ
value.summary: POST the MQ data to the configured port

value.name: all
value.description: Monitor all operations that are defined in the WSDL file.

value.name: stream
value.summary: Specialized compilation mode for direct output to a network stream

value.name: context
value.summary: Specialized compilation mode for output to a temporary context variable

value.name: events
value.summary: Specialized compilation mode for event-driven output

value.name: timed
value.description: The duration is based on the specified time.

value.name: continuous
value.description: The duration is until stopped by the user.

value.name: xmlfile
value.description: Use DataPower AAA Info File

value.name: custom
value.description: Use a custom stylesheet

value.name: slm
value.description: Retain the default value. Defines an SLM peer group.

type.name: dmPKCS7CryptoEncryptionAlgorithm
type.description: Select the PKCS#7 algorithm for encryption.

type.name: dmPKCS7DataEncoding

value.name: none
value.description: Raw data. No encoding or decoding.

value.name: base64
value.description: Input data is base 64 decoded. Output data is base 64 encoded.

type.description: Encoding format for the data that is input to or output from PKCS#7 operations. The format is for the data, not the object itself. The data is decoded from the specified format on input to sign and encrypt before the operation is performed. The data is encoded into the specified format on output from verify and decrypt after the operation is performed.

type.name: dmPKCS7ObjectEncoding

value.name: der
value.description: ASN.1 object in raw binary

value.name: base64-der
value.description: ASN.1 object in raw binary that is then base 64 encoded.

value.name: pem
value.description: An ASN.1 object in PEM format that is base64 encoded and then placed between header and trailer lines to identify the content.

value.name: smime
value.description: An S/MIME message.

type.description: Encoding formats for the PKCS#7 ASN.1 object. The format is for the object, not the data.

property.name: PolicyAttachWSDLComponentType
property.description: Select a type of WSDL Component

property.name: PolicyAttachWSDLComponentValue
property.summary: The name of the WSDL Component
property.description: Enter the qname of a wsdl component formatted {ns}ncname

property.name: PolicyAttachFragmentID
property.description: Matches Fragment Identifier

property.name: Match
property.description: Select the Matching Rule that defines the matching criteria.

property.name: Rule
property.description: Select the Processing Rule to run.

property.name: ParameterName
property.description: Policy key name formated {policy-domain-ns}name

property.name: ParameterValue
property.description: Value for corresponding policy parameter key.

property.name: RegExp
property.summary: A shell-style match pattern for matching URLs
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. This set is then assigned to a specific HTTP proxy. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*) Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?) Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] ) Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: Skip
property.description: A switch specifying the treatment of the URL set defined by RegExp. If set to on, the URL set is not forwarded to an HTTP proxy, and, consequently, a proxy is not identified in the Remote Address and Remote Port fields. If set to off (the default condition), the URL set is forwarded to the HTTP proxy identifed in the Remote Address and Remote Port fields.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address that in conjunction with Remote Port identifies an HTTP proxy. Not used when Skip is on.

property.name: RemotePort
property.description: Specify an integer in the range of 1 through 65535 that in conjunction with Remote Host identifies an HTTP proxy. Not used when Skip is on.

property.name: RegExp
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*) Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?) Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] ) Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: CryptoKey
property.description: This is the private key to use for Pubkey authentication. Select a Crypto Key object from the list of available Key objects. Click the + button to create a new Crypto Key object. Select an object and click the ... button to edit an existing Key object.

value.name: buffer-until-verification
value.summary: Buffer messages until processing is complete
value.description: Buffers submitted messages until all processing is verified as complete. When verified, forward the messages.

description.p: Forwards messages before all processing is verified as complete. This setting can potentially increase speed.
If the XML Manager associated with this service has streaming enabled, select this option to be certain that the device will stream messages end-to-end.
If streaming of attachments is enabled, select this option.

property.name: Number
property.summary: List position of this RADIUS server
property.description: An integer that specifies the relative position of this RADIUS server within the list of all RADIUS servers known to the client implementation. The lower the number, the more preferred the server (the closer to the top of the list).

property.name: Secret
property.description: The password used to login to the RADIUS server. Enter the password twice to confirm its accuracy.

type.name: dmRaidPhysDiskRole

value.name: other
value.description: The physical disk is neither the Primary or Secondary disk of a RAID-1 volume.

value.name: primary
value.description: The physical disk the primary (source) member of the RAID-1 volume. This is the one that the other disk is synchronized to match.

value.name: secondary
value.description: The physical disk the secondary member of the RAID-1 volume. When this disk does not match the Primary disk, synchronization occurs to make it match the Primary disk.

type.summary: Gives the role of a physical disk in a RAID-1 Volume.

type.name: dmRaidPhysDiskState

value.name: online
value.description: The physical disk is online and available to the RAID Volume.

value.name: missing
value.description: The physical disk is missing or not responding. It is not available to the RAID Volume. It must be replaced.

value.name: not-compatible
value.description: The physical disk is present, but it is not compatible with the RAID Volume. It could be too small, or the wrong type of disk. It must be replaced.

value.name: failed
value.description: The physical disk is present, but it has been marked as failed. This could be caused by too many read/write errors. It must be replaced.

value.name: initializing
value.description: The physical disk is in the process of initializing.

value.name: requested-offline
value.description: The physical disk is marked as offline due to request by the software.

value.name: requested-failed
value.description: The physical disk is marked as faield due to request by the software.

value.name: other-offline
value.description: The physical disk is offline for an unspecified reason.

type.summary: Gives the state of a physical disk in a RAID Volume.

type.name: dmRaidVolumeInactiveStatus

value.name: active
value.description: The volume is active.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The reason for the volume being inactive is unknown.

value.name: stale-metadata
value.description: The RAID Volume is inactive due to stale metadata.

value.name: foreign-volume
value.description: The RAID Volume is inactive because it is a Foreign volume, which was initialized on another machine. If the RAID Activate action is taken, it will be accepted as a local volume, and activated on this machine.

value.name: insufficient-resources
value.description: The RAID Volume is inactive due to insufficient resources.

value.name: clone-volume
value.description: The RAID Volume is inactive due to clone volume.

value.name: insufficient-metadata
value.description: The RAID Volume is inactive due to insufficient metadata.

value.name: previously-deleted
value.description: The RAID Volume is inactive because it was previously deleted.

type.summary: Gives the inactive status of the RAID volume.

type.name: dmRaidVolumeState

value.name: optimal
value.description: The RAID Volume is in the optimal state, operating normally.

value.name: degraded
value.description: The RAID Volume is in a degraded state. It is still accessible, but a disk may be missing, resynchronization may be in progress, or there may be too many bad blocks.

value.name: failed
value.description: The RAID Volume has failed. It is not acessible.

value.name: missing
value.description: The RAID Volume is missing. It is not accessible.

type.summary: Gives the state of a RAID Volume.

type.name: dmRaidVolumeType

value.name: unknown
value.description: Unknown RAID volume type.

value.name: raid-0
value.description: This is a RAID-0 volume, proving disk striping.

value.name: raid-1
value.description: This is a RAID-1 volume, proving disk mirroring.

type.summary: Gives the Type of a RAID Volume.

value.name: zosnss
value.summary: Use z/OS NSS Server for SAF authentication

value.name: restricted
value.summary: Subset of local users can login

value.name: WSSecPasswordDigestNonce
value.summary: The nonce element for a WS-Security password digest token.

value.name: Custom
value.summary: An XPath expression for the message replay identifier.

value.name: crypto/tam
value.display: Create IBM Tivoli Access Manager Configuration

value.name: device/initialize-compact-flash-filesystem
value.display: Initialize File System on Compact Flash

value.name: device/initialize-raid-volume-filesystem
value.display: Initialize File System on Hard Disk Array

value.name: device/repair-compact-flash-filesystem
value.display: Repair File System on Compact Flash

value.name: device/repair-raid-volume-filesystem
value.display: Repair File System on Hard Disk Array

value.name: network/iscsi-fs-repair
value.display: Repair File System on iSCSI Volume

property.name: RegExp
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*) Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?) Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] ) Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: Restrict10
property.description: If set to on and the protocol is HTTP the transaction will not go above HTTP/1.0.

type.name: dmResultsMultiWayMode

value.name: first-available
value.summary: Send to only the first available target

value.name: require-all
value.summary: Send to all targets, all must succeed

value.name: attempt-all
value.summary: Send to all targets, errors are non-fatal

type.summary: Method to handle multiple targets in a results action

type.name: dmRootPartNotFirstAction

value.name: process-in-order
value.summary: Process the attachments and root part in the order they appear in the original message. All parts are still processed in streaming mode even though only attachments after the root will be streamed from the network.

value.name: buffer
value.summary: Buffer attachments before the root into memory. Then process the root part, buffered attachments, and subsequent attachments.

value.name: abort
value.summary: Abort the transaction and return an error

type.summary: Action to take when MIME message root part is not first

description.p: The Namespace URI given for the attribute. The Namespace URI must match to match on a name. If this field is left blank, the null namespace is used.
An example entry would be:
"http://www.examples.com".
This entry would match a message with the following attribute:
<Attribute AttributeName="cats" AttributeNamespace="http://www.example.com"> <AttributeValue>Winchester</AttributeValue><Attribute>
The local name of the attribute. For example, "cats" would match a message with the following attribute:
<Attribute AttributeName="cats" AttributeNamespace="http://www.example.com"> <AttributeValue>Winchester</AttributeValue><Attribute>
The value for the attribute with the corresponding name. For example, "Winchester" would match the following attribute:
<Attribute AttributeName="cats" AttributeNamespace="http://www.example.com"> <AttributeValue>Winchester</AttributeValue><Attribute>

value.name: xpath
value.description: Evaluates a custom XPath expression against the SAML attribute statement.

value.name: any
value.summary: Must match at least one name
value.description: Ensures the presence of at least one configured SAML attribute.

value.name: all
value.description: Ensures the presence of all configured SAML attributes.

value.name: any-value
value.summary: Must match at least one name and value
value.description: Ensure at least one configured SAML attribute name and value is found within the SAML attribute statement.

value.name: all-values
value.summary: Must match all names and values
value.description: Ensures all configured SAML attribute names and values are found within the SAML attribute statement.

type.name: dmSAMLVersion
type.description: The version of SAML messages.

value.name: pre-requisite
value.summary: Validate this policy and all matching policies before accepting
value.description: All matching profiles in the Application Security Policy are run. A failure of any of these profiles results in the failure of the transaction. Only when all matching profiles are successful will the transaction be accepted. A typical use of this style would be a broad match that enforces a basic item, such as maximum size, that is followed up with more specific matches with stronger criteria.

value.name: admission
value.summary: Validate this policy only before accepting
value.description: Only this policy is run. If successful, the transaction is accepted.

property.name: Rule
property.description: Select the rule to run.

property.name: Interval
property.description: Specify the interval between invocations in seconds. A value of 0 indicates a single invocation.

value.name: high
value.description: A service or transaction assigned this priority setting will receive above normal scheduling priority and resource allocation.

value.name: normal
value.description: A service or transaction assigned this priority setting will receive normal scheduling priority and resource allocation.

value.name: low
value.description: A service or transaction assigned this priority setting will receive below normal scheduling priority and resource allocation.

property.name: XPath
property.summary: An XPath Expression selecting elements of the Schema document
property.description: This is an XPath expression that identifies elements of the Schema document. These are the elements excepted from schema validation.

property.name: ExceptionType
property.description: Select the Exception type for encryption.

value.name: AllowEncrypted
value.description: Indicates that the element might or might not be encrypted in the document that is under validation.

value.name: RequireEncrypted
value.description: Indicates that the element must be encrypted in the document that is under validation. If not encrypted, validation fails.

property.name: Matching
property.description: Select the matching rule that is applied to candidate XML documents. Documents whose URL conforms to an expression contained in the matching rule are subject to XML schema validation.

property.name: ValidationMode
property.description: Select the procedure to use to validate a schema.

property.name: SchemaURL
property.summary: The URL of an XML schema
property.description: Enter the URL of the schema to use for validation. Used only when the Validation Mode is schema or schema-rewrite.

property.name: URLRewritePolicy
property.description: Select a URL Rewrite Policy from the list. Used only the Validation Mode is attribute-rewrite or schema-rewrite.

property.name: DynamicSchema
property.description: Select a dynamic schema used to perform document validation regardless of any validation processing instructions contained within the document. Dynamic schemas used Schema Exception Maps or Document Crypto Maps.

value.name: Strict
value.description: Items are added to the security header following the numbered layout rules described in the WS-Security Policy specification.

value.name: lax
value.description: Items are added to the security header in any order that conforms to WSS:SOAP Message Security.

value.name: laxtimestampfirst
value.description: As Lax except that the first item in the security header MUST be wsse:Timestamp.

value.name: laxtimestamplast
value.description: As Lax except that the last item in the security header MUST be wsse:Timestamp.

type.name: dmSensorDataType

value.name: other
value.description: A measure other than those listed below

value.name: unknown
value.description: Unknown measurement, or abitrary, relative numbers

value.name: voltsAC
value.description: Electric potential, Alternating Current

value.name: voltsDC
value.description: Electric potential, Direct Current

value.name: watts
value.description: Electric power in Watts

value.name: hertz
value.description: Frequency of oscillation measured in Hertz.

value.name: celsius
value.description: Temperature measured in Degrees Celsius.

value.name: percentRH
value.description: Relative Humidity as a percentage between 0 and 100.

value.name: rpm
value.description: Rotational speed in Rotations per Minute.

value.name: cmm
value.description: Volume in Cubic Meters per Minute.

value.name: truthvalue
value.description: Truth value, 1 if true, 2 if false.

type.summary: Identifies the measurement data type for a sensor.

type.name: dmSensorReadingStatus

value.name: lowerNonRecoverable
value.description: The current sensor reading value is below the lower non-recoverable threshold, which indicates that there is a risk of damaging the hardware if the device is allowed to remain in this state. If you cannot alleviate the cause of this reading, you should power down the device.

value.name: lowerCritical
value.description: The current sensor reading value is below the lower critical threshold, which indicates that the system is faulty, and may not be operating properly.

value.name: lowerNonCritical
value.summary: Sensor value is at low warning
value.description: The current sensor reading value is below the lower non-critical threshold, which is a warning that it is getting close to too low. The system should operate normally, but the cause of the sensor value should be investigated.

value.name: ok
value.description: The current sensor reading value is OK, and is within all limits.

value.name: upperNonCritical
value.summary: Sensor value is at high warning
value.description: The current sensor reading value is above the upper non-critical threshold, which is a warning that it is getting close to too high. The system should operate normally, but the cause of the sensor value should be investigated. This is commonly used on temperature sensors, where the investigation would be checking ambient air temperature and air flow.

value.name: upperCritical
value.description: The current sensor reading value is above the upper critical threshold, which indicates that the system is faulty, and may not be operating properly.

value.name: upperNonRecoverable
value.description: The current sensor reading value is above the upper non-recoverable threshold, which indicates that there is a risk of damaging the hardware if the device is allowed to remain in this state. If you cannot alleviate the cause of this reading, you should power down the device.

value.name: failure
value.description: The reading indicates a failure. Used for non-numeric readings.

value.name: noReading
value.description: The attempt to read the sensor failed, so the status cannot be checked.

value.name: invalid
value.description: An internal software error has been detected checking the status.

type.description: Gives the failure status for the current sensor reading. Indicates whether the reading is acceptable, and if not, why it is unacceptable.

value.name: var://service/response-mode
value.summary: Get the flag if the message is a response or not.
value.description: If the message is a response, this service variable returns the response-mode value.

value.name: var://service/rule-direction
value.summary: Get the direction of traffic that the rule is processing.
value.description: If the rule is processing a request message, this service variable returns 1. If the rule is processing a response message, this service variable returns 2.

value.name: var://service/slm-policy-name
value.summary: Used by SLM logic to associate a particular transaction to its resolved policy name.

value.name: var://service/output2original
value.summary: Used by MQ Host and MQ Proxy services to determine if an error rule can output data.

value.name: var://service/system/ident
value.description: Returns the system identification like product, model, configured device name, and serial number.

value.name: var://service/system/status
value.description: Returns the content of specific status providers. For instance var://service/system/status/LoadBalancerStatus2 returns the information of the Loadbalancer Status provider.

value.name: var://service/URI
value.summary: Get or set the request URI of a transaction

value.name: var://service/time-forwarded
value.summary: Get Timestamp of Request Message Forwarded

value.name: var://service/error-code
value.description: The assigned error code from the Result Code table.

value.name: var://service/error-message
value.description: The variable contains the detailed error condition causing the multistep processing to abort. Setting the variable will overwrite the error response to the client in an error condition.

value.name: var://service/error-protocol-response
value.description: Overwrite the protocol response code in an error condition.

value.name: var://service/xmlreqrspmode
value.description: The XML processing mode could be soap, xml, unprocessed

value.name: var://service/error-protocol-reason-phrase
value.description: Overwrite the protocol reason phrase in an error condition. The reason phrase is intended to give a short textual description of the protocol error response for human consumption.

value.name: var://service/error-subcode
value.description: Often the subcode is the same as var://service/error-code. Sometimes it is a more specific result code. It is used to help disambiguate the reason for invoking an error rule.

value.name: var://service/error-headers
value.description: The name of the HTTP header field that contains error information.

value.name: var://service/formatted-error-message
value.description: The error response send back to the client. The response can be overwritten by writing to var://service/error-message.

value.name: var://service/error-ignore
value.description: The flag that controls how the Front Side Handler processes error condition. If the value is set and greater than zero, it does not run any error handling actions and produces a regular response. The content of the message is produced by an error rule.

value.name: var://service/strict-error-mode
value.description: The setting controls the error mode for multistep processing. If set all dp:reject invocations will abort multistep processing. If it is not set, dp:reject with @strict-only = 'true' will only be logged but not abort multistep processing.

value.name: var://service/soap-fault-response
value.summary: Set when response rule input is treated as a soap fault
value.description: The flag indicates that the input to the response rule was a soap fault.

value.name: var://service/soap-oneway-mep
value.summary: Notify the transaction of a SOAP one-way Message Exchange Pattern
value.description: Notify the service layer that this transaction is performing a one-way MEP (Message Exchange Pattern) operation. This enables the service layer to optimize resource usage. When using WSA and one-way MEP's, service layer will timeout waiting for a response. Set this variable to true to prevent this.

value.name: var://service/max-call-depth
value.description: Defaults to 128 in each transaction. It controls how many levels of called rules can be layered before an error is thrown.

value.name: var://service/max-action-depth
value.description: Defaults to 128 in each transaction. It controls how many levels of directly-invoked actions, such as loops of loops, can be layered before an error is thrown.

value.name: var://service/system/frontwsdl
value.summary: Get Frontside WSDL URL of Service

value.name: var://service/transaction-client
value.summary: Get IP Address of Transaction Client

value.name: var://service/current-call-depth
value.description: Returns the current depth of called rules. The maximum is set in var://service/max-call-depth.

value.name: var://service/routing-url
value.description: This variable is an addition to dp:set-target() for dynamically routed gateways. The latter does not let you specify a protocol, but you express a routing-url just like the gateway backend-url. Whether the URI is honored depends on the propogate-uri property. This variable is implemented for XML Firewall objects, but it generates an error if the protocol is not HTTP or HTTPS. For a Multi-Protocol Gateway, it can be any valid backend protocol. Another key difference is that this variable can only be set once. The set-target can be called multiple times with the last one taking precedence. The advantage is that a connection is started immediately even while other multistep processing is occurring and less data might have to be buffered.

value.name: var://service/routing-url-sslprofile
value.description: This variable allows the setting of the SSL Proxy Profile that should be used on the dynamic route. It is needed only if the SSL property of the gateway is not sufficient for the route about to be selected. Use this variable before var://service/routing-url.

value.name: var://service/persistent-connection-counter
value.description: This variable notes the number of transactions that were completed on the current protocol session.

value.name: var://service/connection/note
value.description: This variable allows the user to annotate the current protocol session. The annotation could be an identifier which can be used to maintain state based on an existing protocol session.

value.name: var://service/mpgw/skip-backside
value.description: This variable set to 1 in a Multi-Protocol Gateway during front side processing allows to skip the backside from running, which makes a loopback essentially. Any data written to the backside will try and be written to the frontside instead.

value.name: var://service/mpgw/backend-timeout
value.description: This variable allows the user to get or set the backend timeout in a Multi-Protocol Gateway. Setting this variable will override the default timeout. It is expressed in seconds, and valid values are 1-86400.

value.name: var://service/mpgw/request-size
value.description: The size of the message received by front side protocol handler in bytes, excluding headers.

value.name: var://service/mpgw/response-size
value.description: The size of the message received by the back end in bytes, excluding headers.

value.name: var://service/header-manifest
value.description: Lists all protocol headers of current transaction.

value.name: var://service/set-request-header/
value.description: This variable correlates directly to the dp:set-request-header() extension function. var://service/set-request-header/FOO to value BAR would set the request header FOO to BAR.

value.name: var://service/set-response-header/
value.description: This variable correlates directly to the dp:set-response-header() extension function. var://service/set-response-header/FOO to value BAR would set the request header FOO to BAR.

value.name: var://service/original-content-type
value.summary: Get Original Request Content-Type Header Value
value.description: Returns the original request Content-Type header value. The value remains unmodified and is not subject to both service header rewrites and multistep header rewrites.

value.name: var://service/report
value.summary: Read and write the MQMD field for MQ Host and Proxy services

value.name: var://service/message-type
value.summary: Read and write the MQMD field for MQ Host and Proxy services

value.name: var://service/expiry
value.summary: Read and write the MQMD field for MQ Host and Proxy services

value.name: var://service/format
value.summary: Read and write the MQMD field for MQ Host and Proxy services

value.name: var://service/priority
value.summary: Read and write the MQMD field for MQ Host and Proxy services

value.name: var://service/persistence
value.summary: Read and write the MQMD field for MQ Host and Proxy services

value.name: var://service/message-identifier
value.summary: Read and write the MQMD field for MQ Host and Proxy services

value.name: var://service/correlation-identifier
value.summary: Read and write the MQMD field for MQ Host and Proxy services

value.name: var://service/reply-to-q
value.description: For the MQ host and MQ proxy, when read shows the input message value. When write changes the dynamic routing.

value.name: var://service/reply-to-qm
value.description: For the MQ host and MQ proxy, when read shows the input message value. When write changes the dynamic routing.

value.name: var://service/mqmd-reply-to-q
value.description: For the MQ Host and MQ Proxy set the output MQ message descriptor.ReplyToQ value

value.name: var://service/mqmd-reply-to-qm
value.display: MQ Reply-To Queue Manager output message
value.description: For the MQ Host and MQ Proxy set the output MQ message descriptor.ReplyToQMgr value

value.name: var://service/mq-error-code
value.summary: Get MQ Reason Code for the last MQ API call

value.name: var://service/mq-ccsi
value.summary: Set the MQMD character set for a MQ Host or Proxy service

value.name: var://service/wsm/back-binding-data
value.summary: Get WSM Backend (Original) Service Binding data

value.name: var://service/wsm/back-service-port-operation
value.summary: Get WSM Backend (Original) Service Port Operation

value.name: var://service/wsm/strict-fault-document-style
value.summary: Do not expect RPC wrappers on RPC faults

value.name: var://service/wsm/part-exists/
value.description: Internal variable used to test whether a part is referenced in the wsdl. Returns 1 or 0.

value.name: var://service/wsm/part-is-xml-element/
value.description: Internal variable used to test whether a part is referenced in the wsdl and is a schema validatable xml element. Returns 1 or 0.

value.name: var://service/wspolicy/required-policy-subjects
value.summary: Internal bitmask of policy subjects that require multistep actions

value.name: var://service/wspolicy/enforcement-mode
value.summary: Get policy enforcement mode (filter or enforce)

value.name: var://service/conformance/generatedPolicy
value.display: WS-Proxy Conformance Policy Name generated from WS-Policy
value.summary: WS-Proxy Conformance Policy Name generated from WS-Policy

value.name: var://service/multistep/input-context-name
value.summary: Input context name to current processing action

value.name: var://service/multistep/output-context-name
value.summary: Output context name to current processing action

value.name: var://service/multistep/loop-iterator
value.description: Get the loop iterator for the innermost for-each action. If the for-each action is set to run with a fixed iteration count, this variable retrieves the input context of the loop action. If the loop runs over a node-set, this retrieves the current element within the node-set.

value.name: var://service/multistep/loop-count
value.description: Get the current loop count for the innermost for-each action. If the current action is the first action run within the loop returns 1; the second action, 2; and so on.

value.name: var://service/wsm/http-parsed-url-replacement
value.display: WSDL HTTP Binding Parsed URL Replacement Algorithm
value.summary: WSDL HTTP Binding Parsed URL Replacement Algorithm

value.name: var://service/wsm/wsdl-content-type
value.summary: The HTTP Content-Type specified by the WSDL

value.name: transparent
value.description: The SFTP server has a transparent file system. The files and directories shown are those on the back end of the associated Multi-Protocol Gateway.

value.name: log
value.description: Posts a message to the log target.

value.name: throttle
value.description: Rejects transactions over the defined threshold.

value.name: log-only
value.description: Writes a log entry. Continues to process subsequent transactions.

value.name: reject
value.description: Writes a log entry. Drops traffic until the monitored entity is in conformance levels.

value.name: shape
value.description: Writes a log entry. The next 2500 transactions are queued for later transmission when the monitored entity is in conformance levels. After 2500 transactions are queued, further transactions are rejected.

value.name: aaa-mapped-credential
value.description: Uses the results from the Map Credential phase of the AAA Policy. The results might be a user name, a client DN, or another value. Use of this credential type requires that a AAA action be run before the SLM action in the Processing Policy.

value.name: aaa-username
value.description: Uses the results from the Extract Identity phase of the AAA Policy. Use of this credential type requires that a AAA action be run before the SLM action in the Processing Policy.

value.name: mq-application
value.description: Uses the name of the MQ application that is specified in the MQ message. This credential type is valid for MQ transport protocol messages only.

value.name: client-ip
value.description: Uses the IP address of the client that submitted the message.

value.name: request-header
value.description: Uses the name of the HTTP header that contains the credential to use. When selected, provide the name of this header field.

value.name: ip-from-header
value.description: Uses the name of the HTTP header taht contains the client IP address (for example, X-Client-IP). When selected, provide the name of this header field.

value.name: custom-stylesheet
value.description: Uses a custom stylesheet to extract a credential from the message. When selected, provide the URL for the stylesheet.

value.name: terminate-at-first-reject
value.description: Causes the policy to stop executing any statement after the first statement that rejects a message because a threshold has been met.

value.name: terminate-at-first-action
value.description: Causes the policy to stop executing any statement after the first statement that takes an action because a threshold has been met.

value.name: execute-all-statements
value.description: Causes the policy to execute all policy statements regardless of what action those statements take.

value.name: fixed
value.description: A fixed interval is a discrete block of time. For example, from 8:00 am to 9:00 am. Fixed intervals are calculated from the start of the schedule. If no schedule is assigned, fixed intervals are calculated starting from 12:00 am.

value.name: moving
value.description: A moving interval is a sliding window. For example, the last 60 minutes.

value.name: low
value.summary: The low or first limit threshold

value.name: high
value.summary: The high or second limit threshold

value.name: per-extracted-value
value.description: Allows the system to extract and keep a list of all unique objects of the specified type. Any configured policy then applies to each extracted object.

value.name: exact-match
value.description: Provides exact values to match. Only objects that match the values provided in the values list are subject to the SLM Policy.

value.name: regexp-match
value.description: Provides a PCRE-style expression to match. Only objects that match the values provided in the values list are subject to the SLM Policy.

value.name: aaa-mapped-resource
value.description: Specifies that members is defined by the resource identities that are the results of the Map Resource phase of a AAA Policy. Use of this resource type requires that a AAA action be run before the SLM action in the Processing Policy.

value.name: front-url
value.description: Specifies that membership is defined by the URL requested by the client or by the rewritten, client-requested URL.

value.name: destination-url
value.description: Specifies that membership is defined by the destination URL or the URL output to the destination (backend) server. This URL might be different from the URL requested by the client (front URL).

value.name: xpath-filter
value.description: Specifies that membership is defined by an XPath expression. When selected, provide the expression.

value.name: request-message
value.description: Specifies that membership is restricted to client request messages.

value.name: response-message
value.description: Specifies that membership is restricted to server response messages.

value.name: soap-fault
value.description: Specifies that membership is restricted to SOAP fault messages.

value.name: errorcode
value.description: Specifies the membership is defined by error codes. This value might be the error code that was generated by the backend server or by the device during message processing.

value.name: custom-stylesheet
value.description: Specifies that membership is defined by resource identifiers from a custom stylesheet. When selected, provide the URL for the custom stylesheet.

value.name: concurrent-connections
value.description: Specifies the membership is restricted to all concurrent TCP connections. The TCP connection is from the requesting client to the DataPower device. Generally, a client opens only one connection to the DataPower device at a time. Concurrent connections are not specific to user credentials.

value.name: concurrent-transactions
value.description: Specifies the membership is restricted to all other active transactions.

value.name: wsdl
value.description: Specifies that membership is defined by a local WSDL file. A Web Service Proxy might support more than one WSDL file.

value.name: wsdl-service
value.description: Specifies that membership is defined by the name of a service in an underlying WSDL file. Can be used by the Web Service Proxy service only.

value.name: wsdl-port
value.description: Specifies that membership is defined by the name of a port binding in an underlying WSDL file. Can be used by the Web Service Proxy service only.

value.name: wsdl-operation
value.description: Specifies that membership is defined by the name of an operation in an underlying WSDL file. Can be used by the Web Service Proxy service only.

value.name: request-mq-qname
value.description: Specifies that membership is defined by the name of the MQ Queue for client requests.

value.name: reply-mq-qname
value.description: Specifies that membership is defined by the name of the MQ Queue for server replies.

value.name: uddi-subscription
value.description: Specifies the membership is defined by the UDDI Subscription key. When selected, provide the key.

value.name: wsrr-subscription
value.description: Specifies that membership is defined by the WSRR Subscription.

property.name: SLMId
property.description: Each statement is uniquely identified by a positive integer. The statements are executed in their indexed order. Adding a statement with an identifier that duplicates a previous entry replaces the previous entry.

property.name: UserString
property.description: Specify a custom string or identifier to appear in log messages for this statement.

property.name: CredClass
property.description: Select the credential class to determine the credentials to which this statement applies. If no credential class is configured, the statement applies to all messages that are identified as valid resources without respect to credential classification. Without a credential class effectively considers all messages as belonging to a single global user.

property.name: RsrcClass
property.description: Select the resource class to determine the resources to which this statement applies. If no resource class is configured, the statement applies to all messages that pass the credential classification.

property.name: Schedule
property.description: Select theschedule that describes the applicable time frames for this policy statement.

property.name: Action
property.description: Select the SLM Action to run if the threshold of this statement is exceeded.

property.name: ThreshIntervalLength
property.description: Specify the length of each measurement interval in seconds. The default is 0, which allows all messages and never triggers the threshold to enforce the SLM Action.

property.name: ThreshIntervalType
property.description: Select how intervals are measured.

property.name: ThreshAlgorithm
property.description: Select the methodology for the threshold in the current interval.

property.name: ThresholdType
property.description: Select how the threshold level is applied to the count.

property.name: ThresholdLevel
property.description: Specify the count or value to allow before triggering the threshold and running the associated action. The default is 0, which means that no message is accepted.This property applies to all threshold algorithms.

property.name: ReleaseThresholdLevel
property.summary: The stop point of the High-Low algorithm
property.description: Specify the stop point (Low). The start point (High) is is the value of the Threshold Level property. This properties applies only when using the High-Low algorithm.

property.name: BurstLimit
property.summary: Maximum size of the committed burst
property.description: Specify the size of the committed burst. The committed burst defines how much traffic can be sent during a reporting interval. The burst size should be at least twice the value of the threshold level. This property applies only when using the Token Bucket algorithm. The default is 0, which means the burst limit is the configured threshold level.

property.name: ReportingAggregationInterval
property.description: Specify the base aggregation level in minutes for the reporting of statistics. This value is the statistic interval. This value does not affect the thresholding interval.

property.name: MaximumTotalReportingRecords
property.summary: Total number of records per reporting interval
property.description: Specify the totol number of records for a reporting interval. A single reporting aggregation interval can contain multiple records; for example, one record per resource or credential. This property allows you to define a maximum memory-consumption threshold.

property.name: AutoGeneratedByWebGUI
property.summary: Indicates whether the GUI created this statement
property.description: This read-only property indicates whether this statement was generated as part of a default SLM configuration. You cannot change this setting.

property.name: MaximumResourcesAndCredentialsForThreshold
property.summary: Maximum number of credentials-resource combinations to apply threshold
property.description: Specify the maximum number of credentials-resource combinations. The threshold is defined for the combination of credentials and resource. This property allows you to set a maximum memory-consumption threshold.

value.name: front
value.description: Monitors errors that occur at the front end (or client request) URL.

value.name: rate
value.description: Monitors the transaction rate per seconds.

value.name: greater-than
value.description: Specifies a simple numeric algorithm that triggers the SLM Action when the threshold level is greater than the defined value.

value.name: less-than
value.description: Specifies a simple numeric algorithm that triggers the SLM action when the threshold level is less than the defined value.

value.name: token-bucket
value.description: Specifies a rate-based algorithm that allows bursting. The algorithm consists of a bucket with a maximum capacity of N tokens that refills at a rate of R tokens per second. Each token typically represent a quantity of whatever resource is being rate-limited.

value.name: high-low-thresholds
value.description: Specifies an algorithm that triggers the SLM Action at the high threshold and continues to trigger until the low threshold is reached. This algorithm uses the values of the Threshold Level and the High-Low Release Level properties.

value.name: count-all
value.description: Specifies that the threshold measures all requests for resources that are defined by the SLM Resource Class.

value.name: count-errors
value.description: Specifies that the threshold measures only errors.

value.name: latency-internal
value.description: Specifies that the threshold measures processing time (internal latency).

value.name: latency-backend
value.description: Specifies that the threshold measures device-to-server latency.

value.name: latency-total
value.description: Specifies that the threshold measures backend latency and internal latency.

value.name: none
value.description: No access is allowed.

value.name: read-only
value.description: SNMPv3 get, get-next, and get-bulk operations are allowed.

value.name: read-write
value.description: SNMPv3 get, get-next, get-bulk, and set operations are allowed.

value.name: none
value.summary: The account has no authentication key.

type.name: dmSnmpContext

property.name: Context
property.summary: The name of an SNMPv3 context
property.description: An SNMPv3 context that will allow access to an application domain.

property.name: Domain
property.summary: Local application domain for this context.
property.description: The local application domain whose SNMP MIB may be accessed via this context using SNMPv3.

type.description: SNMPv3 context definitions, which provide SNMPv3 access to non-default application domains.

type.name: dmSnmpCred

property.name: EngineID
property.description: Specify the engine ID of the SNMP V3 engine for which this account is being defined. A value of 0 is the shorthand representation for the local engine ID. For any other engine ID, the value is a hexadecimal string that represents the five- to 32-byte value.

property.name: AuthProtocol
property.description: Select which authentication protocol to use.

property.name: AuthSecretType
property.description: Select the format of the authentication secret. This property is required for when the authentication protocol is either MD5 or SHA.

description.p: Specify the secret, or key, for authentication. This property is required for when the authentication protocol is either MD5 or SHA.

ul.li: If a password, specify a plaintext password that is at least eight characters long.
If a key and MD5 is the authentication protocol, specify the hexadecimal representation of a 16-byte key.
If a key and SHA is the authentication protocol, specify the hexadecimal representation of a 20-byte key.

description.p: You can use colons (:) between each two hexadecimal characters.

property.name: PrivProtocol
property.description: Select the privacy (encryption) protocol to use.

property.name: PrivSecretType
property.description: Select the format of the privacy secret. This property is required for when the privacy protocol is either DES or AES.

description.p: Specify the secret, or key, for authentication. This property is required for when the authentication protocol is either DES or AES.

ul.li: If a password, specify a plaintext password that is at least eight characters long.
If a key and MD5 is the authentication protocol, specify the hexadecimal representation of a 16-byte key.
If a key and SHA is the authentication protocol, specify the hexadecimal representation of a 20-byte key.

description.p: You can use colons (:) between each two hexadecimal characters.

type.description: SNMP V3 user properties.

property.name: Community
property.summary: The name of an SNMP community
property.description: Enter the name of a specific SNMP community. All SNMP Version 1 or Version 2c managers identifying themselves as a member of this community will have the Mode permissions set here for the Associated Domains selected here and must originate from the Remote Host Address specified here.

property.name: Domain
property.description: Specifies the application domain visible to the SNMP managers belonging to this community. The default value is the default application domain.

property.name: Mode
property.description: Select the access privileges accorded to SNMP managers that belong to this community. Use none to disable SNMP access.

property.name: Host
property.summary: IP address of an SNMP manager
property.description: The IP address of an SNMP manager belonging to this community. The default value of '0.0.0.0/0' indicates all hosts, or all SNMP managers claiming membership in the community.

value.name: none
value.summary: The account has no privacy key.

value.name: password
value.description: The secret is a password that will be converted to an intermediate key with a standardized algorithm, and then localized against the engine ID value.

value.name: key
value.description: The secret is a fully localized key. Specifying a fully localized key is useful when the key was initially created on another system.

value.name: noAuthNoPriv
value.description: Does not require authentication or encryption.

value.name: authNoPriv
value.description: Requires authentication, but does not require encryption.

value.name: authPriv
value.description: Requires authentication and encryption.

property.name: Host
property.summary: IP address of a recipient of SNMP Traps/Notifications
property.description: Specifies the IP address of a recipient of SNMP Traps and Notifications generated by the local SNMP agent or engine. The IP address must be unique for each recipient.

property.name: Port
property.description: Specifies the destination UDP port for SNMP Traps and Notifications generated by the local SNMP agent or engine. By default, SNMP Traps and Notifications are sent to port 162.

property.name: Community
property.summary: The name of an SNMP community
property.description: The SNMP community name included in SNMP Version 1 Traps and SNMP Version 2 Notifications. By default, a community name of public is used.

property.name: TrapVersion
property.description: Select the SNMP version to use for sending Traps and Notifications to the recipient. The default is version 1.

property.name: SecurityName
property.description: The name of the local SNMPv3 user to use for Notifications to this recipient. Determines what authentication and privacy (encryption) protocols are used, and what keys.

property.name: SecurityLevel
property.summary: The SNMPv3 security level for notifications
property.description: The SNMPv3 security level at which Notifications are sent to the recipient. The default is Authentication, Privacy.

value.name: lax
value.description: Allow the SOAPAction header to be an empty header or a header that contains an empty string. The SOAPAction header in the client request can be quoted. For example, SOAPAction: "" would be a match.

value.name: strict
value.description: Require that the client provides the exact header as specified in the WSDL. The client can quote the SOAPAction header.

value.name: off
value.description: Ignore the SOAPAction header when issued by clients. The header is never compared against the contents in the WSDL.

property.name: RegExp
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*) Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?) Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] ) Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: SoapAction
property.description: The value of the SoapAction header. If the value "http://example.org/add" is entered here, the header looks like "SoapAction: http://example.org/add"

type.name: dmSOAPHeaderDispositionItem

property.name: Namespace
property.description: Specify the namespace URI of the SOAP header element, the default value is a blank string, which indicates no restriction.

property.name: LocalName
property.summary: The SOAP Header element local name
property.description: Specify the local name of the SOAP header element, the default value is a blank string, which indicates no restriction.

property.name: ChildLocalName
property.summary: The SOAP Header's chile element local name
property.description: Specify the local name of the SOAP header's child element, the default value is a blank string, which indicates no restriction.

property.name: Action
property.summary: The action to take for this SOAP header.
property.description: Specify what action to take for this SOAP header and/or child element.

type.summary: The instruction to dispose a SOAP header
type.description: Specify what the SOAP header is and how to process it.

type.name: dmSOAPHeaderRefineType

value.name: processed
value.display: The specified element was processed, take default SOAP action

value.name: unprocessed
value.display: The specified element was not processed, take default SOAP action

value.name: keep
value.display: Keep this SOAP header or child element

value.name: remove
value.display: Remove this SOAP header or child element

value.name: fault
value.display: Generate a SOAP fault if the element exists

type.summary: Type of the actions to refine the SOAP header and children elements.
type.description: Specify what action to take to handle a SOAP header and or its children elements. By default the processing rule, defined by the SOAP specification, will be used to remove/keep/fault a SOAP header with the assumption that all the SOAP headers are already processed by the prior actions.

type.name: dmSOAPServiceType
type.summary: Is it working as a intermediary or ultimate service provider
type.description: SOAP Specification defines different SOAP header processing rules for different type of soap nodes or services, those processing rules are also different whether the soap header are successfully consumed by the prior actions or not.

type.name: dmSOAPValidation

value.name: body
value.description: Validate only the contents of the SOAP Body element. Do not apply special processing to SOAP faults.

value.name: body-or-detail
value.description: If the document is a SOAP fault, validate the contents of the detail element for SOAP faults. If the document is not a SOAP fault, validate the contents of the Body element.

value.name: ignore-faults
value.description: If the document is a SOAP fault, pass it through without validation. If the document is not a SOAP fault, validate the contents of the SOAP Body element.

value.name: envelope
value.description: Validate the entire message, including the SOAP Envelope (or other wrapper).

type.summary: How to validate SOAP documents and faults

type.name: dmSoapVersion
type.summary: Version of SOAP for log targets

value.name: QueryString
value.summary: Allows requests when the URL contains a ? (query string)

value.name: FragmentIdentifiers
value.summary: Allows requests when the URL contains a # (fragment identifier)

value.name: DotDot
value.summary: Allows requests when the URL contains a .. (dotdot)

value.name: CmdExe
value.summary: Allows requests when the URL contains cmd.exe

type.name: dmSQLDatabaseType
type.description: The database vendor name

property.name: ParamName
property.description: Enter the name of the configuration parameter.

property.name: ParamValue
property.description: Enter the value for the configuration parameter.

value.name: static
value.description: Run a predefined, static SQL query. The SQL statement is identical each time the action is invoked.

value.name: variable
value.description: Run an SQL statement that is stored in a named variable. This variable must be set earlier in the processing.

value.name: stylesheet
value.description: Run an SQL statement that is constructed as the result of processing a stylesheet against the input to the action.

property.name: RegExp
property.description:
A required shell-style expression that defines a URL set assigned to a specific proxy. The following wildcard characters are available when constructing a match pattern.
asterisk (*) Matches 0 or more occurrences of any character
question mark (?) Matches one occurrence of any single character
brackets ( [ ] ) Defines a character or numeric range. For example, [1-5] matches 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, while xs[dl] matches xsd or xsl.

property.name: SSLProxyProfile
property.description: Select an existing SSL proxy profile from the list of existing profiles. Click the + button to create a new profile. Select a profile and click the ... button to edit an existing profile.

type.name: dmSSLProxyDirection

value.name: forward
value.summary: Proxy acts as an SSL client

value.name: reverse
value.summary: Proxy acts as an SSL server

value.name: two-way
value.summary: Proxy acts as both an SSL client and an SSL server

type.summary: Role of the SSL Proxy in the connection

property.name: Group
property.description: An integer used to identify a standby group; allowable identifiers are in the range 1 through 255. All interfaces in a given standby group must have the same group number. This value must be distinct from all HSRP group numbers being used by IP routers or switches in the same broadcast domain. The active interface in the group will change its Ethernet MAC address to 00:00:0C:07:AC:XX, where XX is the group number. This number must also be unique among all standby groups on a given system.

property.name: VirtualIP
property.summary: The virtual IP address of standby group
property.description: The IP address that will be used by the active member of the standby group. External clients that want to be able to contact the active member of the standby group should use this IP address. This address must be on the same IP subnet as the primary address of the interface.

property.name: Preempt
property.description: With preempt mode disabled (the default), the active interface remains active unless it goes down. This is desirable as it mimizes the loss of TCP connections caused when the virtual IP address moves from one device or interface to another. With preempt mode enabled, the operational interface with the highest priority will always be the active interface, and have the virtual IP address. Use this when one interface or device is truly better than another, and it is worth increasing the disruption of TCP connections to enforce this.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: The device's priority within the standby group
property.description: The priority at which this interface will vie for being the active one in the standby group. The range is 0 to 255, with higher values winning over lower values, with a default of 100. There is no need to set the priority unless one system or interface is in some way better than another one.

property.name: AuthHigh
property.summary: The first four bytes of the HSRP Authentication field
property.description: The hexadecimal representation of an integer representing the first four bytes of the HSRP Authentication field. All devices in the same standby group should use the same authentication token. This is very weak authentication, so the default value is normally perfectly suitable.

property.name: AuthLow
property.summary: The last four bytes of the HSRP Authentication field
property.description: The hexadecimal representation of an integer representing the last four bytes of the HSRP Authentication field. All devices in the same standby group should use the same authentication token. This is very weak authentication, so the default value is normally perfectly suitable.

property.name: AuxVirtualIP
property.summary: Additional virtual IP address(es) that follow the active virtual IP address to the active interface.
property.description: Secondary virtual address(es). This address is on the same interface as the primary virtual IP and it is turned up and down in coordination with the primary virtual IP. Multiple auxiliary virtual IP addresses may be separated by colons.

value.name: active
value.summary: The interface is the active member in the load balancer group

value.name: standby
value.summary: The interface is a standby member in the load balancer group

type.name: dmStaticHost

property.name: Hostname
property.description: Specify the host name of the target host.

property.name: IPAddress
property.description: Specify the IP address of the target host.

type.summary: Static host name to IP address mapping
type.description: Under user control manually maps a host name to the host IP addresse without using DNS. Note that the device's DNS name resolver uses a cache, so static mappings will not usually result in significant performance improvements.

property.name: Destination
property.summary: IP address and subnet mask of target destination

property.name: Gateway
property.summary: IP address of the next-hop router

value.name: validate
value.description: Performs schema-based validation against XML documents using a user-specified method.

value.name: filter
value.description: Accepts or rejects check on incoming documents.

value.name: route-action
value.display: Route using Stylesheet or XPath Expression
value.description: Performs stylesheet-based routing or XPath expression-based routing. For stylesheet-based routing, provide the dynamic stylesheet that specifies the destination. For XPath expression-based routing, provide the XPath Routing Map that specifies the destination.

value.name: aaa
value.description: Invokes an Access control policy. An access control policy identifies a set of resources and procedures that determine whether a requesting client is granted access to a specific service, file, or document. Access control policies are filters in that they accept or deny requests for specific clients.

value.name: xformpi
value.description: Uses a processing instruction in an XML document to transform that XML document. This action passes embedded parameters to the specified XSLT stylesheet. The stylesheets and parameters are embedded in the document to be processed.

value.name: xformbin
value.description: Transforms a non-XML document, such as binary or flat text, using a processing control file. The control file, in turn, uses a flat file descriptor (FFD) file.

value.name: cryptobin
value.description: Signs, verifies, encrypts, or decrypts binary data. This action uses the syntax and methodologies described in RFC 2311, S/MIME Version 2 Message Specification, dated March, 1988, and RFC 2315, PKCS #7: Cryptographic Message Syntax 1.5, dated March, 1998.

value.name: xform
value.description: Transforms an XML document using a specified XSLT stylesheet.

value.name: convert-http
value.description: Converts non-XML CGI-encoded input (an HTTP POST, an HTML form, or URI parameters) into an equivalent XML message. This action in the active rule alerts the service to treat input as non-XML CGI-encoded input. For a service to use this action, the request type for that service must be set to XML.

value.name: log
value.description: Sends the contents of the input context as a log message to the identified location. The contents are sent with the log level and log type that are specified. The response, if any, is stored in the output context, if defined. When no output context is defined, this action sends the contents and does not wait for a response.

value.name: results
value.description: Sends a message to a URL. A results action can optionally specify a context in which to store the response.

value.name: results-async
value.description: Asynchronously sends a message to a URL. This action does not support sending a message to an output context. With this action, processing continues without waiting for a response.

value.name: setvar
value.description: Creates a variable for use in subsequent processing in a specified context. Variables are expressed in the var://URL format. Variables cannot be set when the context is the PIPE keyword.

value.name: fetch
value.description: Uses a user agent to retrieve a document from a specified location.

value.name: extract
value.description: Applies an XPath expression to a specified context and stores the result in another context.

value.name: rewrite
value.description: Rewrites HTTP headers or URLs using a URL rewrite policy.

value.name: route-set
value.description: Performs dynamic, variable-based routing.

value.name: strip-attachments
value.description: Removes all or specified MIME attachments from a specified context.

value.name: call
value.description: Invokes a named, reusable rule. After the action completes, processing continues to the next action, if any.

description.p: Defines a named rule that enables user-defined error handling when subsequent processing encounters errors. The on-error action either stops processing or continues to the next processing step. Optional, the action calls the named rule to handle the error condition. Without an on-error action, the default error handling is to stop processing and log a message.

A processing rule can contain one or more on-error actions. Each action defines error handling for subsequent actions until another on-error action is found. When another action is found, error-handling procedures are set to the new on-error action. As such, this action enables conditional error handling in a multistep context.

Note that a processing policy can contain on-error actions and an error rule. When a processing policy contains both on-error actions and an error rule, the on-error action overrides the error rule. An error rule, if the processing policy contains one, is invoked when an error occurs during processing. In this case, the error rule acts as an error handler.

value.name: checkpoint
value.description: Collects information for WS-Management agents and Service Level Monitors.

value.name: slm
value.description: Assigns and enforces an SLM Policy Statement to a processing rule. The SLM Policy operates on the Input context.

value.name: conditional
value.description: Evaluates a list of XPath expressions against the input context, and then runs the action that is associated with the first one that matches.

value.name: for-each
value.description: Loops through either all of the nodes in a nodeset or otherwise all of the natural numbers through the upper count limit. For each loop iteration, it runs the LoopAction.

value.name: event-sink
value.description: Looks through the list of named actions and waits for each of them to complete asyncronously in this Multistep Session at least once. Once they all have, then if any of them failed, then this action will fail with one of their errors. If they all eventually finish and succeeded, then this action will succeed, and control flow will continue. If this instruction times out while waiting for them to all finish (or even to be started), then this instruction will fail. This instruction can not be Asynchronous, it is inherently part of synchronous processing of asynchronous actions.

value.name: abort
value.summary: Cancel the processing of the current rule

keypair-cert: For signing operations, the name of the Certificate object to be used.
recipient: For encryption operations, the name of the Certificate object for the intended recipient.
valcred: For authentication, the name of the Validation Credentials object to be used.

description.p: Executes map in exported files without special options.
The map file must be an exported XML file from Design Studio.

value.name: no-map
value.display: Exported Files - Mapping Logic Disabled (To be Deprecated)
value.summary: Execute only input/output TypeTrees, without mapping logic

description.p: This option is only valid with maps that have exactly one input card and one output card. Further, the type of at least one of the cards must have XML intent. Note that, while legal, if both cards have XML intent, this option will disable all transformation, effectively making the map an identity transform.

If the input is non-XML, the input TypeTree alone will be used to transform the input to an XML representation of the underlying binary format. That XML representation will then be sent directly to the output context, without transformation. (Note the format of the XML representation corresponds to the input TypeTree, and may not match the XML format described by the output TypeTree).

If the output is non-XML, the output TypeTree alone will be used to transform the XML input to the output binary format.(Note the format of the XML input must correspond to the output TypeTree, which may not match the XML format described by the input TypeTree).

The XML format produced or consumed by the binary-to-xml transformation corresponds directly to the relevant input or output TypeTree, where each ITEM or GROUP is represented by an element whose name is the absolute name of the type, with spaces replaced by two dashes, and other non-NCName characters escaped as "-nn-" where nn is the decimal value of the character's code-point, without leading zeros. If the first charcter in the name, after any escaping, is not an XML Letter or underscore, the name is preceeded by an underscore. Thus a Type named Foo Bar Root will correspond to an element named Foo--Bar--Root , a Type named Foo_Bar Baz? Root will correspond to an element named Foo_Bar--Baz-63---Root , and a Type named #93 Root will correspond to an element named _-35-93--Root .

Only concrete (unpartitioned) ITEMs and GROUPs are represented in the XML format. When a binary input ITEM or GROUP is partitioned, the XML representation produced will have an element corresponding to the actual partition seen in the input, and not the partitioned base type. When a binary output ITEM or GROUP is partitioned, the input XML must contain an element corresponding to the actual partition to be produced, and not the partitioned base type.
Executes map in DPA file without special options.
The map file must be a map file that was created in Design Studio with the DataPower option and must be compiled in Design Studio before being transferred to the DataPower appliance.
The map file has the .dpa file extension.

property.description: Select UDDI subscription
