property.summary: Whether user's DN should be retrieved using an LDAP search.
property.description: If this option is enabled, the login-name presented by the user will be used along with the LDAP Search Parameters as part of an LDAP search to retrieve the user's DN. If this option is disabled, the login-name presented by the user will be used along with the LDAP Prefix and LDAP Suffix to construct the user's DN.

property.name: AULDAPBindDN
property.summary: Distinguished name used to bind to LDAP server
property.description: This Distinguished Name is used to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULDAPBindPassword
property.summary: Password used to bind to LDAP server
property.description: This Bind Password is the password used to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULDAPSearchParameters
property.description: The LDAP search parameters used to perform an LDAP Search in order to retrieve the user's DN. If the "Search LDAP For DN" option is enabled, this property is relevant and it must be specified; if the option is disabled, this property is not used.

property.name: AULDAPPrefix
property.description: This string is prepended to the username to form the beginning of a distinguished name (DN) for LDAP authentication. For example, if this string's value is "uid=" and the username is Bob, the LDAP DN will start with "uid=Bob". The LDAP suffix parameter is then appended to this string to form the complete DN.

property.name: LDAPsuffix
property.description: This string is appended to the username (separated by a comma) to form a distinguished name (DN) for LDAP authentication. For example, if this string's value is "O=example.com" and the username is "Bob", the LDAP DN will be "CN=Bob,O=example.com" (assuming that "CN=" is the LDAP prefix; this is the default value).

property.name: LDAPSSLProxyProfile
property.description: If a value is specified for the SSL Proxy Profile, communication with an LDAP server will take place over an SSL connection and use the SSL Proxy Profile specified.

property.name: AUCacheAllow
property.description: Select how to control caching of AAA authentication results.

property.name: AUCacheTTL
property.description: This sets the explicit time to live (TTL) for cached authentication decisions.

property.name: MCMethod
property.description: Allows for the selection of a method to map authenticated user credentials to access profiles.

property.name: MCCustomURL
property.description: The URL of the custom stylesheet used for Access Profile mapping.

property.name: MCLDAPSearchForGroup
property.summary: Whether the group name should be retrieved using an LDAP search.
property.description: If this option is enabled, the authenticated DN by the user will be used along with the LDAP Search Parameters as part of an LDAP search to retrieve the user's group. If this option is disabled, the authenticated identity of the user (i.e. DN or usergroup of local user) will be used directly as input credential to this step.

property.name: MCHost
property.description: Specify the domain name or IP address of the credentials server.

property.name: MCPort
property.description: Specify port number of the credentials server.

property.name: MCLDAPSSLProxyProfile
property.description: If a value is specified for the SSL Proxy Profile, communication with an LDAP server will take place over an SSL connection and use the SSL Proxy Profile specified.

property.name: MCLDAPBindDN
property.summary: Distinguished name used to bind to LDAP server
property.description: This Distinguished Name is used to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: MCLDAPBindPassword
property.summary: Password used to bind to LDAP server
property.description: This Bind Password is the password used to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: MCLDAPSearchParameters
property.description: The LDAP search parameters used to perform an LDAP Search in order to retrieve the group name (DN or attribute value) based on the authenticated user DN. If the "Search LDAP For Group" option is enabled, this property is relevant and it must be specified; if the option is disabled, this property is not used.

description.p: The URL of the AAA Info-conformant XML file used for credential mapping. The file can be local or on a remote server. For example, "local:///RBMPolicy.xml". May be the same file used for User Authentication.
Click the + button to invoke the Policy File Builder utility. Enter a valid URL and click the ... button to invoke the Policy File BUilder utility to edit an existing file.

property.name: LDAPVersion
property.description: Specifies the LDAP protocol version used.

property.name: FallbackLogin
property.description: The setting allows the configuration of a local fallback login if the remote user authentication failed. This allows for login in the case of network or infrastructure failure preventing primary authentication. It is recommended to enable fallback login for a restricted set of local users.

property.name: FallbackUser
property.summary: List of local users for fallback login
property.description: Specifies a set of local users having fallback login access. These users can login if the primary means of authentication fails and the fallback login mode is configured to allow the login by a subset of local users.

property.name: ApplyToCLI
property.description: The setting allows to enforce the RBM policy on CLI sessions. The RBM policy setting will overwrite both configured Command Groups and CLI Domain access for local users. RBM can not be enforced on CLI sessions if the Authentication method is 'client-ssl' and fallback-login is disabled.

property.name: RestrictAdminToSerialPort
property.summary: Restrict local admin user to serial port
property.description: Restrict the login of the local admin user to the serial port.

property.name: MinPasswordLength
property.summary: The minimum length of a valid password.
property.description: This input establishes the minimum length, in characters, of a valid password. Enter an integer between 1 and 128. This defaults to 6.

property.name: RequireMixedCase
property.summary: Enable to force new passwords to contain upper and lower case characters.
property.description: Enable this property to require all new passwords to contain both upper case and lower case characters, such as PaSSworD.

property.name: RequireDigit
property.summary: Enable to force new passwords to contain at least one digit.
property.description: Enable this property to require all new passwords to contain at least one numeric digit. For example PassWorD700.

property.name: RequireNonAlphaNumeric
property.summary: Enable to force new passwords to contain at least one non-alphanumeric character.
property.description: Enable this property to require all new passwords to contain at least one non-alphanumeric character. For example PassWorD700=.

property.name: DisallowUsernameSubstring
property.summary: Enable to disallow the username from appearing in a new password.
property.description: Enable this property to require all new passwords not to contain the username substring in the password. If the username is 'user', the password cannot be 'passuserword', for example.

property.name: DoPasswordAging
property.description: Enable this property to age passwords. When enabled, no password can age beyond the value set in the Maximum Password Age input field.

property.name: MaxPasswordAge
property.summary: When aging is enabled, passwords must be changed when reaching this age.
property.description: Enter an integer determining the maximum age, in days, of a password. The minimum value accepted is 1 and the maximum is 65535. The default is 30.

property.name: DoPasswordHistory
property.summary: Enable to disallow reuse of a recent password.
property.description: Enable this property to disallow the use of recent passwords. This prevents the user from switching back and forth between passwords. See Reuse History Size.

property.name: NumOldPasswords
property.summary: Configure how many past passwords to test against when password reuse is disallowed.
property.description: Enter an integer to determine how many past passwords are retained to test against any new password when Password Reuse is disallowed. The minimum value is 1 and the maximum is 65535. The default is 5.

property.name: CliTimeout
property.description: The time after which an idle session will be invalidated, requiring reauthentication. To disable the idle timer altogether, use the value '0'.

property.name: MaxFailedLogin
property.summary: The maximum number of consecutive failed login's.
property.description: The maximum number of consecutive failed login's before the account is locked out. To disable the lockout duration altogether, use the value '0'.

property.name: LockoutPeriod
property.summary: The lockout duration after consecutive failed login's.
property.description: The time for which an account is disabled after the maximum number of consecutive failed login's is reached. For permanent lockout, use the value '0'. Please note that the admin user can not be permanently locked out.

property-group.name: AUStep
property-group.summary: Click tab to display authentication settings

property-group.name: MCStep
property-group.summary: Click tab to display credentials mappings

property-group.name: PasswordPolicy
property-group.summary: Click tab to display password policy settings

property-group.name: AccountPolicy
property-group.summary: Click tab to display account policy settings

object.name: SOAPHeaderDisposition

property.name: Refine
property.summary: Define an instruction to process a SOAP header and/or child element.
property.description: Customer specifically asks this transformation to simply remove/keep/fault a SOAP header; or indicates whether a header was processed or not by the prior action, then this action will take the default behaviors.

object.description: The list of instructions provided by customers to control how the SOAP headers and/or children elements are handled. This object is used by store:///soap-refine.xsl transform stylesheet.

object.name: TAM

property.name: ConfigurationFile
property.description: Select the location of an existing TAM client configuration file. Configuration files must end in .conf or .cfg to be visible to the selection list. Files placed in either the cert: or sharedcert: directory can be read by the system but cannot be viewed by users. Click the Upload button to upload the file to the device.

property.name: SSLKeyFile
property.description: Select the location of the existing TAM SSL key file. Key files must end in .kdb to be visible to the selection list. Generally, these files are in either the cert: directory or the sharedcert: directory. Click the Upload button to upload the file to the device.

property.name: SSLKeyStashFile
property.description: Select the location of the existing TAM SSL stash file. Stash files must end in .sth to be visible to the selection list. Generally, these files are in either the cert: directory or the sharedcert: directory. Click the Upload button to upload the file to the device.

property.name: ReturningUserAttributes
property.description: For successful authorization requests, select whether TAM returns user attributes to the device.

property.name: LDAPUseSSL
property.description: Select whether the connection to the LDAP server uses SSL.

property.name: LDAPSSLPort
property.description: Enter the SSL port number for the LDAP server.

description.p: Select the location of the existing SSL key file that contains the LDAP server certificate. This key file handles the certificates that are used in LDAP communication. Generally, these files are in either the cert: directory or the sharedcert: directory.
Note: The TAM configuration file must contain the ssl-keyfile-pwd in the [ldap] stanza to access this file.
Click the Upload button to upload the file to the device.

property.name: LDAPSSLKeyFilePassword
property.display: LDAP Server SSL Key File Password
property.description: The password corresponding to the SSL LDAP key file.

property.name: LDAPSSLKeyFileDN
property.display: LDAP Server SSL Key File DN

description.p: When the LDAP SSL channel uses mutual authentication, this parameter specifies the label of the key file certificate that will be used to authenticate the client.
Note: this parameter is not needed when the SSL authentication is server-only.
This parameter toggles the FIPS setting for SSL communication between the Tivoli Access Manager client and the Tivoli Access Manager authorization server.

Replicas indicate the network location of the remote TAM authorization server. You must configure at least one replica if generating new files. You can configure additional replicas for failover purposes.
Note: If you are uploading a file that was created previously, it must have at least one replica entry.

object.description: IBM Tivoli Access Manager Authentication and Authorization Extensions

object.name: TFIMEndpoint

description.p: Specify the host name or IP address of the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager server.
For example:

ul.li: itfim.ibm.com

property.name: mServerPort
property.description: Specify the port number for the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager server.

property.name: mCompatibleMode
property.description: Select the currently configured version of TFIM. The selected value determines the details for the namespace and WS-Trust messages. When versions 6.0 or 6.1 are selected, version 1.2 of the WS-Trust specification is used. When version 6.2 is selected, version 1.3 of the WS-Trust specification is used. On a TFIM 6.2 server, this corresponds to the "Validate OASIS URI" Request Type. TFIM 6.2 also supports WS-Trust 1.2; 6.1 should be selected as the Compatibility Mode when WS-Trust 1.2 messages are to be used with a TFIM 6.2 server. This corresponds to the "Validate" Request Type on the TFIM 6.2 server.

property.name: mReqToken60Format
property.description: Select the format of the request token. The available formats depend on the selected value for Compatibility Mode.

property.name: mReqToken61Format
property.description: Select the format of the request token. The available formats depend on the selected value for Compatibility Mode.

property.name: mReqToken62Format
property.description: Select the format of the request token. The available formats depend on the selected value for Compatibility Mode.

property.name: mReqCustomURL
property.description: When Request Token Format is Custom, select the URL of the custom stylesheet file and click Upload. The custom stylesheet file must be in either the local: or store: directory.

description.p: When Request Token Format is not Custom, enter the scope for this security token. For example, enter the services to which this token applies. For example:

ul.li: http://tfim.ibm.com:9080/EchoApplication/services/EchoServiceUsername
http://9.33.97.251:9080/EchoApplication/services/EchoServiceUsername

description.p: Within the TFIM service, this information specifies the destination of the request. The TFIM trust service uses this information to determine which partner is being accessed.
To determine the correct value, consult either the WSDL document or your TFIM administrator. Within the WSDL document, this destination equates to the AppliesTo field.

When Request Token Format is not Custom, enter the identity that issued the request. In the WS-Security Management (WSSM) component, the issuer is either the WSSM token generator or the WSSM token consumer. For example:

ul.li: urn:itfim:wssm:tokenconsumer

description.p: To determine the correct value, consult either the WSDL document or your TFIM administrator. Within the WSDL document, this destination equates to the Issuer field.
When Compatibility Mode is v6.1 or v6.2 and when Request Token Format is not Custom, enter the Web services port type to use. A port type is a group of Web services operations. For example:
To determine the correct value, consult either the WSDL document or your TFIM administrator. Within the WSDL document, this destination equates to the PortType field.
When Compatibility Mode is v6.1 or v6.2 and when Request Token Format is not Custom, enter the name of the Web services operation as defined in the WSDL document. For example:
To determine the correct value, consult either the WSDL document or your TFIM administrator.

property.name: mSSLProxy
property.description: Select an existing SSL proxy profile from the list. This SSL Proxy will use the selected profile to manage SSL communications with the peer. The SSL Proxy Profile identifies the keys and certificates used in the handshake. Click the + button to create and assign a new SSL Proxy Profile.

property.name: mSchemaValidate
property.description: Specify whether responses from the TFIM server are schema-validated. When set to "on", TFIM responses are schema-validated using the WS-Trust version that is defined by the compatibility mode.

object.description: IBM Tivoli Federated Identity Manager Configuration

object.name: XACMLPDP

property.name: EqualPolicies
property.summary: All the policies are evaluated on the same level, there is no general policy-set.
property.description: In case of a top level policy-set is undefined, all policies are evaluated equally, PDP will use the PolicyCombiningAlg for the final decision.

property.name: GeneralPolicy
property.summary: The URL of the top level XACML policy/policy-set file.
property.description: The URL of top level XACML policy/policy-set file, if there is one. This file may reside on the local device (typically as local:///file) or on a remote server. Attempts to retrieve this file from remote servers may be governed by the User Agent in use by the XML Manager of the service. This may be useful for SSL connections, for example.

property.name: CombiningAlg
property.summary: The combining algorithm when there is not a top level general-policy.
property.description: Select the policy-combining algorithm when not using a top-level comprehensive XACML policy file. The default is First Applicable.

property.name: DependentPolicy
property.summary: The URL of dependent xacml policy/policy-set files to be used by this PDP.
property.description: Some of the XACML Policiesi/Policy-Sets are indirectly needed when the PDP evaluates a request. They are called Dependent Policy Files. Specify their URLs with this setting.

property.name: Directory
property.summary: The directory of all the other dependent policy files.
property.description: All the xacml policies in this directory (ending with .xacml or .xml) are dependent policies files. This option is used if there are too many policy files for this PDP that custom can simply specify the directory path that we can load those *.xacml and *.xml files automatically.

property.name: CacheTTL
property.summary: Time to cache the XACML policies.
property.description: This sets the explicit time to live (TTL) for cached XACML policies, either raw or compiled. The default value 0 means the cache never expire unless PDP explicitly refreshes the policies. The maximum TTL is 31 days (2,678,400 seconds).

property.name: PAP
property.summary: The external PAP which will provide any additional xacml policy/policy-set docs.

object.summary: Define the object for a XACML Policy Decision Point
object.description: The XACML policies can be evaluated on a DataPower device, This on-box XACML Policy Decision Point (PDP) allows customers to define the necessary information so that it can evaluate the corresponding XACML policies against a XACML request for an XACML Policy Enforcement Point (PEP). The DataPower PEP is implemented with AAA action.

object.name: AccessControlList
object.description: An Access Control List restricts the hosts which may connect to services on this device by source IP address. An Access Control List (ACL) denies all access by default. To deny access to only selected addresses, grant access to all addresses (allow 0.0.0.0) and then create the necessary deny statements.

object.name: AppSecurityPolicy

property.name: RequestMaps
property.description: A list of Web Request Profile objects and their matching criteria. If the client request meets the matching criteria, its Web Request Profile runs.

property.name: ResponseMaps
property.description: A list of Web Response Profile objects and their matching criteria. If the server response meets the matching criteria, its Web Response Profile runs.

property.name: ErrorMaps
property.description: A list of Error Policy objects (Processing Rules) and their matching criteria. If an error meets the matching criteria, its Error Policy runs.

object.description: An Application Security Policy establishes the rules to use to enforce security for a Web Application Firewall service. This policy employs request maps, response maps, and error maps that provide a detailed security configuration. Each of these maps, in turn, matches to a Web Request Profile, Web Request Profile, or Error Policy, as the case might be.

object.name: CompactFlash

property.name: ReadOnly
property.summary: Access permission to files on the storage volume
property.description: Set the access permission to files on the storage volume. When set to "on", the access permission is read-only. When set to "off", the default value, the access permission is read-write.

property.name: Directory
property.description: Specify the subdirectory in the local: and logstore: directories where the files on the storage volume are available. Each application domain contains these subdirectories. These subdirectories are not shared across application domains. The name can be up to 64 characters long. The name cannot start with a period. The name can consist of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numeric digits, dashes, underscores, and periods.

object.description: The configuration of a compact flash storage card as auxiliary data storage.

object.name: CompileOptionsPolicy

property.name: XSLTVersion
property.description: Select the XSLT processor version.

property.name: Strict
property.description: Enable strict XSLT error-checking; non-strict operation attempts to recover from certain errors such as use of undeclared variables, calling undeclared templates, and so forth.

property.name: Profile
property.description: Designates a set of stylesheets to be profiled based on their URL. This should not be used in production environments.

property.name: Debug
property.description: Designates a set of stylesheets to be run in debug mode. When a stylesheet is run in debug mode, it generates a custom web page instead of displaying its normal output. The web page details exactly what occurred during execution, including the values of variables and where particular pieces of the output came from. This should not be used in production environments.

property.name: Stream
property.description: Designates a set of stylesheets which must be run in streaming mode. Transformation of the document begins before the input is fully parsed. Not all stylesheets can be streamed; if a stylesheet cannot be streamed, an error will be issued and the input will not be processed. See the DataPower manual for suggestions on producing streamable stylesheets.

property.name: TryStream
property.description: Designates a set of stylesheets to attempt to run in streaming mode. Transformation of the document begins before the input is fully parsed. Not all stylesheets can be streamed; if a stylesheet cannot be streamed, a warning will be issued during compilation and the stylesheet will read in the entire input as normal at execution time. See the DataPower manual for suggestions on producing streamable stylesheets.

property.name: MinimumEscaping
property.description: Select a URL Map object from the list of URL Maps. Use the + button to create a new map. Output produced from stylesheets meeting the URL map criteria will not be escaped during processing (escaping is On by default). Minimal escaping is particularly useful when handling non-English character sets. For example, a Minimum Output Escaping Rule could prevent the system from producing Les naïfs rather than passing Les naïfs.

property.name: StackSize
property.description: Indicates the maximum number of bytes the stack is allowed to use while executing a stylesheet or other compiled content. This blocks infinite recursion. The minimum value is 10 kilobytes, or 10,240 bytes. The default is half a megabyte, or 524,288 bytes.

property.name: PreferXG4
property.description: Designates a set of stylesheets or schemas that must use XG4 hardware acceleration when possible. XG4 will be used only if the first action in a processing policy is a schema validation against a fixed schema. Any schemas specified here will use XG4 if hardware resources are available. Schemas not specified here may also use XG4, but those schemas will be displaced in favor of schemas specified here.

property.name: DisallowXG4
property.description: Designates a set of stylesheets or schemas that will never use XG4 hardware acceleration. XG4 will be used only if the first action in a processing policy is a schema validation against a fixed schema. Any schemas specified here will not use XG4 even if hardware resources are available.

property.name: WSIValidation
property.description: Select the validation behavior to apply to WSDL files that are checked for conformance to section 5 of WS-I Basic Profile (version 1.0, April 2004). The default is Ignore.

property.name: WSDLValidateBody
property.description: Select the validation behavior for the soap:Body. The default is Strict.

property.name: WSDLValidateHeaders
property.description: Select the validation behavior for the soap:Header. The default is Lax.

property.name: WSDLValidateFaults
property.description: Select the validation behavior for the fault detail. The default is Strict.

property.name: WSDLWrappedFaults
property.display: Require wrappers on fault-details specified by type
property.description: For compatibility, require a rpc-style wrapper around fault details that are specified by type.

property.name: AllowSoapEncArray
property.description: Designates a set of schemas that will accept most uses of elements with xsi:type='SOAP-ENC:Array' consistent with SOAP 1.1 Section 5, even when these attributes violate the XML Schema specification. Normally the xsi:type attribute must name a type equal to or derived from the actual type of the element. For schemas compiled with this option, xsi:type is accepted specifically for the SOAP 1.1 Encoding 'Array' complex type if the element's type is derived from SOAP-ENC:Array; this is the opposite of the normal allowable case.

property.name: ValidateSoapEncArray
property.description: Designates a set of schemas that will do extra validation following the encoding rules in SOAP 1.1 Section 5. This validates members of SOAP arrays, allows attributes such as @id and @href even if not allowed by the schema, and checks that @href values have a corresponding @id element.

property.name: WildcardsIgnoreXsiType
property.description: Designates a set of schemas where wildcards (xs:any elements) only validate children by element name. The XML Schema specification requires that, if a wildcard matches an element but that element does not have an element declaration, the element is instead validated according to an xsi:type attribute on it. This option ignores those xsi:type attributes. It should be used for cases such as SOAP envelope validation where a further validation step will validate the contents matching the wildcard, possibly using the SOAP 1.1 encoding rules.

property.name: WSDLStrictSOAPVersion
property.description: When on, follow the version of the SOAP Binding in the WSDL, allowing only messages bound to SOAP 1.2 to appear in SOAP 1.2 envelopes and messages bound to SOAP 1.1 to appear in SOAP 1.1 envelopes. The default is off.

property.name: XACMLDebug
property.summary: Compile XACML Policy with Debug Info
property.description: Setting to "on" to make the XACML compiler to put more debugging information when evaluate a policy. Please Note: the XACML debugging messages are also controled by the log event in 'XACML' category, please use the "debug" log level to view the full XACML debugging messages.

property-group.name: WSDLOptions
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display WSDL Compiler settings

object.description: Configure/Edit Compile Option Policies

property.name: AcceptedConfig
property.description:
Matching configuration is accepted during import. To create a match statement, type a correctly formatted resource match in the horizontal text box or select Build. Selecting Build displays the Configuration Match Builder in a popup window.
A match statement takes the following general form:
Addr / Domain / Resource ? field = value
Addr Device Address. Must be fully specified host name, IP Address or local host alias. May be asterisk (*) to designate any.
Domain Application Domain. Must be fully specified. May be asterisk (*) to designate any.
Resource Resource Type. Must be fully specified resource type. May be asterisk (*) to designate any.
field An additional specification field, such as "Name". Must be fully specified.
value A PCRE match expression. For example, "Name=foo(*)bar"

property.name: FilteredConfig
property.description:
Matching configuration is filtered during import. To create a match statement, type a correctly formatted resource match in the horizontal text box or select Build. Selecting Build displays the Configuration Match Builder in a popup window.
A match statement takes the following general form:
Addr / Domain / Resource ? field = value
Addr Device Address. Must be fully specified host name, IP Address or local host alias. May be asterisk (*) to designate any.
Domain Application Domain. Must be fully specified. May be asterisk (*) to designate any.
Resource Resource Type. Must be fully specified resource type. May be asterisk (*) to designate any.
field An additional specification field, such as "Name". Must be fully specified.
value A PCRE match expression. For example, "Name=foo(*)bar"

property.name: ModifiedConfig
property.description: Modified configuration during configuration deployment.

object.name: ConformancePolicy

property.name: Profiles
property.description: Profiles against which to check conformance

property.name: IgnoredRequirements
property.description: Requirements that should not be validated. A requirement is specified by a string of the form "<profile>:<reqid>", where <profile> names the profile and is one of BP1.0, BP1.1, BSP1.0 or AP1.0, and <reqid> names the requirement within that profile, and follows the naming convention used by the profile itself. For example, requirement R4221 in the Basic Security Profile 1.0 would be named as "BSP1.0:R4221".

property.name: FixupStylesheets
property.description: Stylesheets to invoke after conformance analysis. These stylesheets can manipulate the analysis results or repair instances of nonconformance.

property.name: AssertBP10Conformance
property.summary: BP1.0 Conformance Claim Assertion to conforming messages
property.description: Attach a Basic Profile 1.0 conformance assertion to messages that conform to BP 1.0, or remove a Basic Profile 1.0 conformance assertion to the messages that don't conform to BP 1.0.

property.name: ReportLevel
property.description: Select the degree of nonconformance to cause a conformance report to be recorded.

property.name: LogTarget
property.description: Target URL to which conformance reports will be sent

property.name: RejectLevel
property.description: Select the degree of nonconformance to cause the message to be rejected.

property.name: RejectIncludeSummary
property.summary: Include summary of conformance analysis in rejection message
property.description: Usually, a rejection response contains little information about the reason that the message was rejected. Setting this property causes the conformance action to include summary information about the conformance errors found.

property.name: ResultIsConformanceReport
property.summary: Deliver conformance analysis report as action result
property.description: The normal behavior of the conformance action is to deliver the original message, possibly modified by one or more stylesheets, to the next multistep stage. Setting this property will instead cause the analysis result to be used as the output. This is primarily intended for use within a loopback firewall, which will return the analysis results to the client.

property.name: ResponsePropertiesEnabled
property.summary: Allow different logging and rejection behavior to be configured for response messages
property.description: When placed inside a single conformance check action (as is typical in an XML gateway), a single set of logging and behavior parameters is sufficent. However, sometimes (as in the case of auto-generated WS-Proxy conformance checking), the same policy is used in checks in both the request and response directions. In this case, the conformance reports should likely be sent to different targets. This toggle allows for an alternate set of logging and rejection parameters to be specified for messages in the response direction.

property.name: ResponseReportLevel
property.description: Select the degree of nonconformance in a response message to cause a conformance report to be recorded.

property.name: ResponseLogTarget
property.summary: URL to send response conformance report
property.description: Target URL to which response conformance reports will be sent

property.name: ResponseRejectLevel
property.description: Select the degree of nonconformance to cause a response message to be rejected.

property.name: ResponseRejectIncludeSummary
property.summary: Include summary of conformance analysis in response rejection message
property.description: Usually, a rejection response contains little information about the reason that the message was rejected. Setting this property causes the conformance action to include summary information about the conformance errors found in response messages.

object.summary: Configuration of conformance checking of received messages

object.name: CertMonitor

property.name: PollingInterval
property.description: Enter an integer indicating the number of days between checks for expired certificates.

property.name: ReminderTime
property.description: Enter an integer indicating the number of days in advance to send notification that a certificate will expire.

property.name: LogLevel
property.description: Select the level of log messages sent to warn about certificates that will expire in the Reminder period. Log targets capture message at or above the configured level. The default is notice.

property.name: DisableExpiredCerts
property.description: By default, expired certificate objects are not disabled. Set this to on to disable expired certificates. Any object that uses the certificate object (such as a Validation Credential) will in turn be disabled.

object.description: The Certificate Monitor periodically checks all X.509 certificates stored on the device for expiration. The monitor automatically creates a log message for each certificate that is within the Reminder time of expiration. Expired certificates may be automatically disabled. Note that the Monitor checks all certificates immediately when the Monitor is first enabled.

property.name: CRLFetchConfig
property.description: Define the configuration of an HTTP-enabled or an LDAP-enabled CRL Update Policy. When HTTP, specify the Fetch URL. When LDAP, specify the LDAP bind information. For both, specify the Validation Credentials object and refresh interval.

object.name: CryptoCertificate

property.name: Filename
property.description: The file containing the public key and certificate. This may be the same file containing the private key.

property.name: Password
property.description: A cleartext password required to access the file containing the public key and certificate. This password will appear in cleartext in the device's configuration script.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.description: Setting this to "on" indicates that the password is actually a password-alias which was created using the password-map feature in the CLI on the device. The password-map encrypts the real password and stores it on the device so that it never appears in plaintext in a configuration script.

property.name: IgnoreExpiration
property.description: Use the toggle to allow the creation of a certificate prior to its activation date (the NotBefore value in the certificate) or after its expiration date (the NotAfter value in the certificate). Select "on" to create the certificate and places it in the up state. Although the certificate is in the up state, objects that reference the certificate use the internal expiration values. In other words, the certificate itself is in the up state, but Validation Credentials, Firewall Credentials, or Identification Credentials that references the certificate adhere to the internal expiration values. In other words, the certificate itself is in the up state, but Validation Credentials, Firewall Credentials, or Identification Credentials that references the certificate adhere to the internal expiration values. If the certificate is used for a certificate chain validation from a Validation Credentials and the certificate is not valid, validation fails. Similarly, if the certificate is used from an Identification Credentials, the DataPower device sends the certificate to the SSL peer for an SSL connection, but the peer can reject the certificate as not valid. Select "off", the default value, to prevent the creation of certificates outside of their internal expiration values.

object.description: The public key portion of a private/public key pair, as for RSA or DSA, plus the certificate with which the key pair is used.

object.name: CryptoFWCred

property.name: PrivateKey
property.description: A private key which may be used for asymmetric key operations with the xmlfirewall.

property.name: SharedSecretKey
property.description: A shared secret key which may be used for symmetric key operations with the xmlfirewall.

property.name: Certificate
property.description: A certificate which may be used for public key operations with the xmlfirewall.

object.summary: Crypto credentials usable with security extension functions
object.description: The set of crypto credentials (private keys, shared secret keys, and certificates) usable by an xmlfirewall when calling security extension functions to perform actions such as encryption/decryption and digital signing and verification. If a firewall is using a Firewall Credentials object and a particular certificate or key is not included in this list, the cryptographic operation trying to use the key or certificate will fail.

object.name: CryptoIdentCred

property.name: Key
property.description: Private key for this identity.

property.name: Certificate
property.description: Certificate for this identity containing the public key matching the specified private key.

property.name: CA
property.description: A set of one or more intermediate Certification Authority certificates. These are passed to the client so it can establish a trust-chain starting with the certificate containing the public key. CA certificates may be necessary when the CA signing this certificate containing the public key is not a standard, well-known CA. If the intermediate CA certificate is also not signed by a standard, well-known CA then an additional intermediate CA certificate may be required for that CA. As many intermediate CA certs as necessary may be specified.

object.summary: Private/public key pair identifying an sslproxy
object.description: An identification set consisting of a certificate (which contains a public key) and the corresponding private key. The identification set is used as the identity of an sslproxy, and the certificate is sent to an SSL peer when negotiating an SSL connection. It may also be used as the identity when signing, encrypting or decrypting documents.

property.name: Realm
property.description: The name of the Kerberos realm that the KDC is serving.

property.name: Server
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the remote Kerberos KDC server. Click Ping verify network connectivity.

property.name: UseTCP
property.description: Select to control whether to contact the Kerberos KDC server with UDP (the default, off) or TCP (on).

property.name: ServerPort
property.summary: TCP or UDP port of the KDC Server
property.description: Specify the UDP or TCP listening port on the Kerberos KDC server. Use an integer in the range of 1 through 65535. The default is 88.

property.name: UDPTimeout
property.description: The number of seconds to wait for a UDP response from the KDC before declaring failure.

property.name: Filename
property.description: The file containing the Kerberos keytab.

property.name: UseReplayCache
property.description: Whether to cache Kerberos authenticators on tickets destined for Kerberos principals in this keytab.

object.name: CryptoKey

property.name: Filename
property.description: The file containing the private key. This may be the same file containing the public key.

property.name: Password
property.description: A cleartext password required to access the file containing the private key. This password will appear in cleartext in the device's configuration script.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.description: Setting this to "on" indicates that the password is actually a password-alias which was created using the password-map feature in the CLI on the device. The password-map encrypts the real password and stores it on the device so that it never appears in plaintext in a configuration script.

object.description: The private key portion of a private/public key pair, as for RSA or DSA.

object.name: CryptoProfile

property.name: IdentCredential
property.description: The credentials which the device will use to identify itself to an SSL peer.

property.name: ValCredential
property.description: An optional set of validation credentials used to authenticate the certificate sent by a remote SSL peer during the SSL handshake.

property.name: Ciphers
property.description:
The cipher list consists of one or more cipher strings separated by colons. Commas or spaces are also acceptable separators but colons are normally used. The actual cipher string can take several different forms.
It can consist of a single cipher suite such as RC4-SHA.
It can represent a list of cipher suites containing a certain algorithm, or cipher suites of a certain type. For example SHA1 represents all ciphers suites using the digest algorithm SHA1 and SSLv3 represents all SSL v3 algorithms.
Lists of cipher suites can be combined in a single cipher string using the + character. This is used as a logical and operation. For example SHA1+DES represents all cipher suites containing the SHA1 and the DES algorithms.
Each cipher string can be optionally preceded by the characters !, - or +.
If ! is used then the ciphers are permanently deleted from the list. The ciphers deleted can never reappear in the list even if they are explicitly stated.
If - is used then the ciphers are deleted from the list, but some or all of the ciphers can be added again by later options.
If + is used then the ciphers are moved to the end of the list. This option doesn't add any new ciphers it just moves matching existing ones.
If none of these characters is present then the string is just interpreted as a list of ciphers to be appended to the current preference list. If the list includes any ciphers already present they will be ignored: that is they will not moved to the end of the list.
Additionally the cipher string @STRENGTH can be used at any point to sort the current cipher list in order of encryption algorithm key length.
Here are all of the permitted cipher strings and their meanings.
DEFAULT the default cipher list. This is determined at compile time and is normally
ALL :!ADH:RC4+RSA:+SSLv2:@STRENGTH. This must be the first cipher string specified.
ALL all ciphers suites except the eNULL ciphers which must be explicitly enabled.
HIGH "high" encryption cipher suites. This currently means those with key lengths larger than 128 bits.
MEDIUM "medium" encryption cipher suites, currently those using 128 bit encryption.
LOW "low" encryption cipher suites, currently those using 64 or 56 bit encryption algorithms but excluding export cipher suites.
EXP, EXPORT export encryption algorithms. Including 40 and 56 bits algorithms.
EXPORT40 40 bit export encryption algorithms
EXPORT56 56 bit export encryption algorithms.
eNULL, NULL
the "NULL" ciphers that is those offering no encryption. Because these offer no encryption at all and are a security risk they are disabled unless explicitly included.
aNULL the cipher suites offering no authentication. This is currently the anonymous DH algorithms. These cipher suites are vulnerable to a "man in the middle" attack and so their use is normally discouraged.
kRSA, RSA cipher suites using RSA key exchange.
kEDH cipher suites using ephemeral DH key agreement.
kDHr, kDHd cipher suites using DH key agreement and DH certificates signed by CAs with RSA and DSS keys respectively. Not implemented.
aRSA cipher suites using RSA authentication, that is, the certificates carry RSA keys.
aDSS, DSS cipher suites using DSS authentication, that is, the certificates carry DSS keys.
aDH cipher suites effectively using DH authentication, that is, the certificates carry DH keys. Not implemented.
kFZA, aFZA, eFZA, FZA ciphers suites using FORTEZZA key exchange, authentication, encryption or all FORTEZZA algorithms. Not implemented.
TLSv1, SSLv3, SSLv2 TLS v1.0, SSL v3.0 or SSL v2.0 cipher suites respectively.
DH cipher suites using DH, including anonymous DH.
ADH anonymous DH cipher suites.
3DES cipher suites using triple DES.
DES cipher suites using DES (not triple DES).
RC4 cipher suites using RC4.
RC2 cipher suites using RC2.
IDEA cipher suites using IDEA.
MD5 cipher suites using MD5.
SHA1, SHA cipher suites using SHA1.
AES cipher suites using AES.

property.name: SSLOptions
property.description: Select the OpenSSL options to modify the behavior of SSL connections during the SSL handshake.

property.name: ClientCAList
property.description: If this profile is being used for a server (reverse) sslproxy, and a valcred is defined in the profile, and this switch is on, then the SSL server will send the SSL client during the SSL handshake a list of CAs taken from the valcred.

object.description: A crypto profile describes a set of configuration information for creating SSL connections.

object.name: CryptoSSKey

property.name: Filename
property.description: The file containing the shared secret key. If the file begins with "0x" then it is assumed the rest of the file contains bytes in hexadecimal, for example, 0xabcd1234.

property.name: Password
property.description: A cleartext password required to access the file containing the shared secret key. This password will appear in cleartext in the device's configuration script.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.description: Setting this to "on" indicates that the password is actually a password-alias which was created using the password-map feature in the CLI on the device. The password-map encrypts the real password and stores it on the device so that it never appears in plaintext in a configuration script.

object.description: A shared secret key is a sequence of characters that is pre-shared between users for use with symmetric encryption.

object.name: CryptoValCred

property.name: Certificate
property.summary: Certificate aliases in the validation credentials list
property.description: Define the certificate aliases for the Cryto Validation Credentials object. Each certificate is the Validation Credentials object is the certificate that an SSL peer might send or is the certificate of the Certification Authority (CA) that signed the certificate sent by a peer or is the root certificate.

property.name: CertValidationMode
property.description: Select the method used to perform certificate validation.

property.name: UseCRL
property.summary: Whether to use CRLs during certificate chain processing
property.description: Select whether to use check Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs) during the processing of certificate chains. If enabled, CRLs are checked. If disabled, CRLs are not checked.

property.name: RequireCRL
property.summary: Require CRLs during certificate chain processing
property.description: Select whether to mandate the use of Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs) during the processing of certificate chains. If enabled, certificate chain processing fails if no CRL is available. If disabled, chain succeeds independent of the availability of a CRL.

property.name: CRLDPHandling
property.description: Select how to support certificate extensions for X.509 Certificate Distribution Points. This non-critical certificate extension specifies how to obtain CRL information. For information about Certificate Policies, see RFC 2527 and RFC 3280.

property.name: InitialPolicySet
property.summary: Certificate policy for certificate chain processing

description.p: Specify the unique object identifiers for the certificate policy that is associated with the current Validation Credentials object.

RFC 3280 refers to the certificate chain validation input variable as 'user-initial-policy-set'. This set of OIDs specifies the allow values of certificate policies at the end of chain processing. To use this functionality, enable 'Require Explicit Policy'. Otherwise, this set is used only if there are policy constraint extensions in the certificate chain.
By default, the initial certificate policy set consists of the anyPolicy OID (2.5.29.32.0). All members of the set are used in certificate chain processing as described in Section 6.1.1 of RFC 3280.

property.name: ExplicitPolicy
property.description: Support the initial-explicit-policy variable as defined by RFC 3280. If enabled, the chain validation algorithm must end with a non-empty policy tree. If disabled, the algorithm can end with an empty policy tree unless policy constraint extensions in the chain require an explicit policy.

object.summary: Set of certificates for authenticating peers' certificates

description.p: A validation credentials list is used to authenticate certificates that are received from SSL peers. It can also be used to validate certificates that are used in digital signature and encryption operations.

An SSL client requires a Validation Credentials object only when it authenticates the certificate presented by the remote SSL server. The SSL standard does not require authentication of the server certificate.
An SSL server requires a Validation Credentials objects only when it authenticates remote SSL clients. The SSL standard does not require authentication of the client certificate.

object.name: SSLProxyProfile

property.name: Direction
property.description: Indicates which end of the SSL connection this SSL Proxy Profile describes.

property.name: ForwardCryptoProfile
property.description: The CryptoProfile used when acting as an SSL client for a "forward" or "two-way" proxy.

property.name: ReverseCryptoProfile
property.description: The CryptoProfile used when acting as an SSL server for a "reverse" or "two-way" proxy.

property.name: ServerCaching
property.description: Enable/disable the caching of SSL sessions when acting as an SSL server.

property.name: SessionTimeout
property.description: The timeout in seconds for each entry in the server-side session cache.

property.name: CacheSize
property.description: The number of entries (multiplied by 1024) in the server-side session cache.

property.name: ClientCache
property.description: Enable/disable the caching of SSL sessions when acting as an SSL client.

property.name: ClientAuthOptional
property.description: When acting as an SSL server and performing client authentications, requests, but does not require, SSL client authentication by the application server. This property is meaningful when SSL client authentication is enabled in the server crypto profile. When both properties are enabled, SSL client authentication is optional. The request does not fail when there is no client certificate. When disabled (the default), SSL client authentication is required by the application server.

property.name: ClientAuthAlwaysRequest
property.description: When acting as an SSL server, always request SSL client authentication even when there are no validation credentials present in the server crypto profile. When disabled (the default), the SSL server only requests SSL client authentication when validation credentials are present in the server crypto profile.

object.summary: Profile describing SSL endpoint (client or server)
object.description: An SSLProxyProfile is associated with an xslproxy (or xmlfirewall) to describe how SSL connections should be made from or to the proxy's port.

object.name: ErrorReportSettings

property.name: Mode
property.description: Use the radio buttons to enable/disable system failure notification. It is disabled by default.

property.name: InternalState
property.description: This setting allows the inclusion of a snapshot of the internal state of the device.

property.name: AlwaysOnStartup
property.description: This setting allows the sending of the error-report on each firmware restart regardless of the cause.

property.name: UseSmtp
property.description: Enables the sending of an email notification containing the error-report.

property.name: LocationIdentifier
property.description: The location identifier (i.e customer name or system name) is part of the subject line of the error-report. It identifies the failed system.

property.name: SmtpServer
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the remote SMTP server to which the error-report is sent. Click Ping to verify network connectivity.

property.name: EmailAddress
property.description: Specify the email address to which send the error report.

object.description: The system will capture an error-report on system-failure and send optionally an email notification.

object.name: SystemSettings

property.name: ProductOID
property.description: A read-only string identifying the installed DataPower software.

property.name: Description
property.description: A read-only string identifying the device type.

property.name: SerialNumber
property.description: A read-only string that identifies the current serial number for the device.

property.name: EntitlementNumber
property.summary: Serial number for the device for entitlement
property.description: Specify the serial number of the original device after receiving a replacement device. Without the serial number of the original device, IBM cannot entitle the replacement device for future maintenance or warranty service.

property.name: ProductID
property.description: A read-only string identifying the type of the device.

property.name: Contact
property.description: A read-write string (for example, a name, a telephone number, an email address) identifying the individual or function responsible for device maintenance/management.

property.name: SystemName
property.description: A read-write string providing a user-specified device identifier.

property.name: Location
property.description: A read-write string specifying the device location.

property.name: Services
property.description: A read-only hexadecimal value indicating support for application, presentation, session, and data-link layer services.

property.name: ProductMode
property.summary: The operational mode of the device
property.description: A read-only string identifying the operational mode of the device.

property.name: LoginMessage
property.summary: Custom message displayed at user login.
property.description: This property is deprecated. Use the 'Custom User Interface File' property.

property.name: CustomUIFile
property.description: Specify the URL of the custom user interface file. This file contains custom messages for command line and WebGUI sessions as well as the custom command line prompt. The file must reside in the store: or local: directory on the appliance. The file cannot reside on a mounted file system, such as iSCSI.

property.name: AuditReserve
property.description: Configures the size of audit reserve space. The audit reserve sets aside disk space to prevent the loss of audit records in case of a full disk. If the disk is full and the audit reserve is released, all services will enter operational down state and stop processing traffic. Manual intervention is required to restore disk space and resume traffic processing, Enter an integer between 0 (disabled) and 10000 kBytes. Defaults to 40 kBytes.

object.description: Populate/edit the SNMP System Table and settings.

property.name: LocalTimeZone
property.summary: Device local time zone, relative to UTC
property.description: The time zone used to display times in the management interface. All timestamps in the CLI and Web Management Interface are displayed in this time zone. The default is EST-5EDT.

property.name: CustomTZName
property.summary: A symbolic name for this time zone

description.p: A symbolic name for this time zone, which is appended to local times. It must be three or more characters long and must not contain a leading colon, embedded digits, commas, nor plus and minus signs.
For example, if this property has the value 'STD', then times will be displayed like this:

property.name: UTCDirection
property.description: Select the direction relative to UTC. Asia is East, and North America is West. The default is East.

property.name: OffsetMinutes
property.summary: Distance from UTC, hour fraction in minutes

property.name: DaylightOffsetHours
property.description: If this time zone observes Daylight Savings or Summer Time, the offset in hours (normally 1).

property.name: TZNameDST
property.summary: Time zone name during Daylight Savings

description.p: A symbolic name for this time zone while in Daylight Savings (or Summer Time), which is appended to local times. It must be three or more characters long and must not contain a leading colon, embedded digits, commas, nor plus and minus signs.
For example, if this property has the value 'DST', then during Daylight or Summer time, times will be displayed like this:

property.name: DaylightStartMonth
property.description: Select the month of the year on which DST starts. The default is March.

property.name: DaylightStartDay
property.description: Select the day of the week on which DST starts. The default is Sunday.

property.name: DaylightStopMonth
property.description: Select the month of the year on which DST ends. The default is November.

property.name: DaylightStopDay
property.description: Select the day of the week on which DST ends. The default is Sunday.

object.name: SchemaExceptionMap

property.name: OriginalSchemaURL
property.description: This is the location of the full original schema document. This is required. This may reside on or off the device.

property.name: SchemaExceptionRules
property.description: Rules describe what elements may be excepted from the schema validation when the Original Schema is used for Schema Validation.

object.summary: A map of local XML Schema exceptions
object.description: This object describes exceptions to an XML Schema by identifying elements of the schema that may be encrypted in an instance document. When Schema Validation is performed on the document using this Exception Map, encrypted elements are considered valid when they appear in place of the specified elements.

property.name: NameSpaceMappings
property.description: The prefix and URI for namespaces that might be encountered in requests.

object.name: DocumentCryptoMap

property.name: Operation
property.summary: Operation to perform on selected document nodes
property.description: Select the operation to perform on the selected document nodes.

property.name: XPath
property.summary: An XPath Expression selecting document nodes for the specified operation.

description.p: Enter the XPath expression identifying the elements on which to operate in the blank field in front of the Add button. Click Add to add the expression to those included in the map.

Click the XPath Tool button to use the graphically oriented XPath Tool to construct the message. You will need to upload an example document to use this tool. Note that this example should be the encrypted document when the operation is decrypt.

object.summary: A map to drive partial document crypto operations
object.description: A Document Crypto Map indicates which elements, of a complete schema, to encrypt or decrypt. The indicated element or elements may also be signed.

object.name: XPathRoutingMap
object.summary: Information for routing documents based on XPath expressions

description.p: An XPath Routing Map matches XPath expressions with corresponding destination URLs. When the XPath expression evaluates to true when applied to the message submitted, the target destination for the message is set to the corresponding URL.
Use the Rules tab to establish these mappings. Use the Namespace Mapping tab to determine Namespace URIs for namespaces used in the XPath Expressions.

property.name: Type
property.description: Specify the type of the log target.

property.name: SoapVersion
property.summary: SOAP version used by log target
property.description: Specify the version of SOAP for use by SOAP log targets.

property.name: Format
property.description: Defines the format in which the log entries are represented.

property.name: TimestampFormat
property.description: Defines the format of the timestamp of the log entries.

property.name: LocalIdentifier
property.description: A descriptive string that may be used by a remote recipient to identify this specific log target. The string should not include any spaces for syslog destinations. Applies to log type smtp, syslog, or syslog-ng, or logs in CBE format.

property.name: EmailAddress
property.description: Specify the email address to which to email log entries. Applies to log types smtp or to log type file when the archive method is smtp.

property.name: SenderAddress
property.description: Specify the email address of the sender for log entries that are emailed elsewhere. The value must match the email address of crypto key if email messages are signed. Applies to log types smtp and to log type file when the archive method is smtp.

property.name: SMTPDomain
property.description: Fully-qualified domain name of the SMTP client, which will be sent as part of the SMTP session initiation (HELO command). Applies to log type smtp, or log type file when the archive method is smtp.

property.name: Size
property.description: Configures the maximum size of file log targets. Enter an integer between 100 and 50000. Defaults to 500.

property.name: URL
property.description: Enter a valid URL to which log entries are posted. Uses the default HTTP User Agent object. Applies to log type soap. Starting with http:// will use HTTP, starting with https:// will use HTTP over SSL.

property.name: NFSMount
property.description: Enter the name of a NFS Static Mount point that will be used to write the log over NFS.

property.name: SSLProxyProfile
property.description: The SSL proxy profile to use when Target Type is syslog-ng or soap and the URL starts with "https://". Select an existing SSL proxy profile from the list of existing profiles. Click the + button to create a new profile. Select a profile and click the ... button to edit an existing profile.

property.name: LocalFile
property.description: The name of the log file. For example, logtemp:///filename.log or logstore:///filename.log. The filename must be in the logtemp: or logstore: folder, and the name must only use the characters a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or '_', and may have subdirectories delimited by '/'. Filename must match Applies to log type file.

property.name: NFSFile
property.description: The path to the log file, relative to the NFS mount point. The filename must only use the characters a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or '_', and may have subdirectories delimited by '/'. Filename must match Applies to log type file.

property.name: ArchiveMode
property.description: Select the archiving mode.

property.name: UploadMethod
property.description: Select the upload method when archiving log files.

property.name: Rotate
property.description: Specify the maximum number of rotations for log files when using the rotate method for archiving log files. Specify an integer between 1 and 100. The default is 3.

property.name: UseANSIColor
property.description: Enables the use of ANSI X3.64 escape sequences to color-code displayed log messages by log level. Applies to log type console.

description.p: Specify the host name or IP address of a remote host (syslog host, SMTP server, or the host that accepts SCP or SFTP connections). Required when the log type is syslog, syslog-ng, smtp, or file with an archive mode of upload.

You can use SSL to establish a secure connection to a remote host by setting the Remote Host and Remote Port values to the values on the local system on which an SSL Proxy Service is listening. This local SSL Proxy can then forward the log entries over a secure SSL connection to the remote server defined in the SSL Proxy Service object.

property.name: RemotePort
property.description: Specify the listening port on the remote server. Required when the log type is syslog or syslog-ng.

property.name: RemoteLogin
property.description: The login used to access the remote server. Applies to log type file with archive mode upload and archive method of either sftp or scp.

property.name: RemotePassword
property.description: The password used to login to the remote server for non-pubkey authentication. Enter the password twice to confirm its accuracy. Applies to log type file with archive mode upload and archive method of either sftp or scp. Pubkey authentication can be configured through User Agent configuration settings.

property.name: RemoteDirectory
property.description: When the log type is FTP, SCP, or SFTP, specify the upload directory on the remote server. If the path is preceded with a forward slash (/ for SCP and SFTP) or an encoded forward slash (%2F for FTP), an absolute path from the root directory is assumed. If the path does not begin with a forward slash or encoded forward slash, a path that is relative to the user's login directory is assumed.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.description: Defines the local interface address for SMTP and Syslog-NG targets. If not 0.0.0.0, must be one of the interfaces' IP addresses.

property.name: SyslogFacility
property.description: Defines the log facility (per RFC 3164) that is included in messages sent to syslog log targets.

property.name: SigningMode
property.description: Enables signing of logs to ensure completeness and sequence. When signing mode is on (the default is off), log files and smtp messages are signed. A Crypto Identification Credentials value is then required for signing. Applies to log type file and smtp.

property.name: SignAlgorithm
property.description: Specifies the algorithm used for signing logs

property.name: IdentCredential
property.description: Select a valid local Crypto Identification Credential. Click + to create a new credential. Select and credential from the list and click ... to edit the credential. Applies when Signing Mode is on.

property.name: EncryptMode
property.description: Enables encryption of logs to ensure confidentiality. Applies to log type file and smtp.

property.name: EncryptAlgorithm
property.description: Specifies the algorithm used to encrypt logs.

property.name: Cert
property.description: The recipient's Crypto Certificate. Select a Crypto certificate from the list to use for encryption of logs. Click the + button to create a new crypto certificate object. Select an object and click ... to edit the crypto certificate object. Applies when Encryption Mode is on.

property.name: RateLimit
property.description: Limits the rate with which events are processed. Enter an integer between 1 and 1000.

property.name: FeedbackDetection
property.description: This setting allows for the suppression of log events triggered by the log subsystem itself. Log targets always suppress log events triggered by the target itself, but will pick up events generated by other log targets. Under certain circumstances with two or more log targets, those events can create a positive feedback loop which in turn can cause resource contention. Setting it to 'on' will suppress all log events triggered by the logging subsystem.

property.name: IdenticalEventSuppression
property.description: This setting allows for the suppression of identical log events which are generated by the same config object over a configurable time period. If set to 'on' the Log Target will retain a reference to each processed event for a configurable period of time and will only process the same event from the same configuration object again after the Suppression Period expired.

property.name: IdenticalEventPeriod
property.description: This setting allows the configuration of the time interval in which identical events are suppressed.

property.name: LogEventCode
property.description: You can create event subscription filters for the log target you are creating or editing using the Event Filters tab page. Subscription filters allow only those log messages containing the configured event codes to be written to this log target. Thus, it is possible to create a log target that only collects log messages for a particular set of event codes, that is, Operational State down.

property.name: LogEventFilter
property.description: You can create event suppression filters for the log target you are creating or editing using the Event Filters tab page. Suppression filters suppress those log messages containing the configured event codes to be written to this log target. Thus, it is possible to create a log target that collects a wide range of log messages except for a particular set of event codes, that is, Health Check connection logs.

property.name: LogObjects
property.description: You can create filters for the log target you are creating or editing using the Object Filters tab page. Filters allow only those log messages generated by selected configuration objects to be written to this log target. Filters are based on object classes, such as AAA Policy or XML Firewall. Thus, it is possible to create a log target that only collects log messages for a particular class of objects, such as XSL Proxy. You can further restrict the filter to particular instances of the chosen class by instance name (not just XML Firewall objects, but XML Firewall objects named "xyz").

object.name: LogTarget

property.name: Backup
property.description: Allows setting of a backup log target to redirect events to in case of an error on the current file-based log target. This setting has no effect on network-based log targets. For the latter use loadbalancer groups instead.

property.name: LogEvents
property.description: You can subscribe the current log target to particular event categories. Some example categories include auth (for authorization events), mgmt (for configuration management events), or xslt (for an xslt processing events). For each event category chosen (including the category all), you can establish a priority level which must be met before the log message will be captured by the current log target. If no event subscriptions are set, no events are included by default. To allow the target to capture messages, at least one event subscription must be configured, which can be for 'all' events.

object.description: Allows the configuration of a log target.

object.name: TraceTarget

property.name: Backup
property.description: Allows setting of a backup trace target to redirect events to in case of an error on the current trace target

property.name: LogEvents
property.description: Defines the log events the current trace target is subscribed to

object.description: Allows the configuration of a trace target.

object.name: FTPQuoteCommands

property.name: FTPQuotedCommands
property.description: This page is used to manage the ordered list of commands to send to the remote FTP server.

object.description: Use this page to create a named list of FTP commands to be quoted to a remote FTP server before a file transfer. These are referenced by the FTP Policies section of a User Agent configuration.

property.name: Priority
property.description: Control the service scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services will be favored over lower priority services.

property.name: FrontProtocol
property.description: Select a Front Side Handler and click Add, or create a new Front Side Handler to assign and click Add. This handler determines the network communication protocol, address, port, and other protocol-specific settings.

description.p: An XML Manager manages the compilation and caching of stylesheets, the caching of documents, and provides configuration constraints on the size and parsing depth of documents. You can enable streaming operation by configuring an XML Manager to use a Streaming Compile Option Policy.

Note that an XML Manager can optionally employ a User Agent. The User Agent settings, in turn, can affect the behavior of the gateway when communicating with back end servers or with clients when sending back responses.

More than one firewall may use the same XML Manager. Select an existing XML Manager from the list to assign the Manager to this firewall. Click the + button to create a new XML Manager that is assigned to this firewall. A default Manager is used if you do not create one.
Configure or edit a URL Rewrite Policy that defines rules for the following rewrite and replacement operations:

ul.li: Rewrite the entire URL or a portion of the URL
Replace a header value in a message
Rewrite the HTTP POST body in a message

description.p: The rewrite rules are applied before document processing. Therefore, the evaluation criteria in the Matching Rule is against the rewritten value.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.description: Select an existing SSL proxy profile from the list to assign the SSL proxy profile to this gateway. Click the + button to create a new SSL proxy profile and assign that SSL proxy profile to the gateway.

property.name: FWCred
property.description: Specifies an optional Credentials list for the XML Gateway. A Gateway Credentials list specifies which keys and certificates are available to support firewall processing. In the absence of an identified Credentials list, all locally-stored key and certificates are available to the gateway.

property.name: StylesheetParameters
property.description: Stylesheets used in Processing Policies can take stylesheet parameters. These parameters can be passed in by this object. More than one parameter can be defined.

property.name: DefaultParamNamespace
property.description: If a stylesheet parameter is defined without a namespace (or without explicitly specifying the null namespace), then this is the namespace into which the parameter will be assigned.

property.name: QueryParamNamespace
property.description: The namespace in which to put all parameters that are specified in the URL query string.

description.p: Specify the URL of the static backend server. The URL is parsed to determine the protocol to use. To use a load balancer, specify the name of an existing Load Balancer Group instead of the address-port pair in the URL.

ul.li: If the URL starts with http://, the DataPower service uses the HTTP protocol.
If the URL starts with https://, the DataPower service uses the HTTPS protocol. This protocol requires an SSL Proxy Profile.

If the URL starts with ftp://, the DataPower service uses the FTP protocol.
For a relative path to the login directory of the user, specify the URL in the ftp://user:password@host:port/path format.
For an absolute path to the root directory, specify the URL in the ftp://user:password@host/%2Fpath format. %2F is the URL encoding of a forward slash.

If the URL starts with dpnfs://, the DataPower service uses the NFS protocol.
For static mounts, specify the URL in the dpnfs://MountObjectName format, where MountObjectName is the name of an existing NFS mount.
For dynamic mounts, specify the URL in the dpnfs://host or dpnfs://host/path format.

If the URL starts with dpmq://, the DataPower service uses the MQ protocol. The Queue Manager object that is referenced in the URL must exist in the current application domain.
If the URL starts with mq://, the protocol is for a dynamic backend server.
This protocol is available on XI50 devices only.

If the URL starts with dpwasjms://, the DataPower service uses the WebSphere JMS protocol. The server object that is referenced in the URL must exist. For a secure connection, the server object must be associated with an SSL Proxy Profile.
This protocol is available on XI50 devices only.

If the URL starts with dpims:// or dpimsssl://, the DataPower service uses the IMS protocol.
This protocol is available on licensed XI50 devices only.

If the URL starts with dptibems://, the DataPower service uses the TIBCO EMS protocol. The server object that is referenced in the URL must exist. For a secure connection, the server object must be associated with an SSL Proxy Profile.
If the URL starts with tibems://, the protocol is for a dynamic backend server.
This protocol is available on licensed on XI50 devices only.

description.p: For assistance in building a URL, click the appropriate Helper button.
URI propagation is meaningful only when:

ul.li: The service uses a static backend.

The service uses a dynamic backend and routing is set with a route with stylesheet (route-action) action. In this case, use dp:set-target() to define the backend server.
For the other routing options that are available with route-action and route-set, the URI is absolute.

description.p: When set to on , the service rewrites the URI of the backend URL to the URI in the client request. If the client submits http://host/service and the backend URL is http://server/listener, the URL is rewritten to http://server/service.
If the backend URL employs MQ, TIBCO EMS, or WebSphere JMS, set to off .

property.name: ServiceMonitors
property.description: Specifies a list of Web Services Monitors for the service. Web Services Monitors target Web Services endpoints. Use the Web Services wizard on the Control Panel to supply a WSDL and configure a Monitor for an endpoint. The Monitor collects statistics, establishes count and duration monitors and can take action when thresholds are met or exceeded. A Monitor must be included here to be activated. Click + to create a new Web Services Monitor. Note that this is not the same Monitor as a Service Level Monitor (SLM) that can be included in the Processing Poligy of this service.

property.name: CountMonitors
property.description: Count Monitors watch for defined messaging events and increment counters each time the event occurs. When a certain threshold is reached, the monitor can either post a notification to a log or block service for a configured amount of time.
