property.name: Type
property.description: The type of mount service this NFS mount provides.

property.name: Name
property.description: The configuration identifier for this NFS mount.

property.name: Remote
property.description: The remote NFS mount point for this mount.

property.name: State
property.description: The state of this NFS mount. If the state is up, Files can be opened over this mount.

property.name: Version
property.description: The version of the NFS protocol being used for this mount.

property.name: Address
property.description: The IP address of the interface of the NFS server that NFS RPC traffic is being sent to, or was last sent to.

property.name: Transport
property.description: The transport protocol being used under the RPC protocol for this NFS mount.

property.name: Port
property.description: The UDP or TCP port number that RPC data for this NFS mount is sent to.

property.name: FilesRead
property.description: The number of files that were opened for reading over this NFS mount.

property.name: FilesWritten
property.description: The number of files that were opened for write (create) over this NFS mount.

property.name: FilesOpen
property.description: The number of files that are currently open for read or write (create) over this NFS mount.

object.name: NTPRefreshStatus
object.summary: Status of most recent NTP refresh.

object.name: ObjectStatus
object.description: Configuration object operational state

object.name: OtherSensors

property.name: Name
property.description: The name of the sensor that is being monitored.

property.name: Value
property.description: The most recent state of the sensor.

property.name: ReadingStatus
property.description: Indication of whether the current state is OK, or indicates a failure.

object.description: Sensors that read non-numeric (enumerated) values.

object.name: RaidPhysDiskStatus

property.name: VolumeNumber
property.summary: The RAID volume that this physical disk is part of
property.description: This is the RAID volume that this physical disk is part of. Each physical disk is only in one RAID volume.

property.name: DiskNumber
property.summary: The number of the disk within the RAID volume
property.description: The number of the disk within the RAID volume that this disk is. Numbering starts at 0.

property.name: PhysDiskNum
property.summary: The physical disk number of this disk
property.description: The physical disk number of this disk, as assigned by the RAID controller.

property.name: Target
property.summary: The SCSI target of this disk
property.description: The SCSI Target of this disk.

property.name: Location
property.description: A description of the physical location of this disk. "HDD0" is the top disk in the tray on the 9235, "HDD1" is the bottom disk in the tray on the 9235.

property.name: State
property.description: The current state of this physical disk.

property.name: Role
property.summary: The RAID-1 role of this disk in this volume
property.description: Shows whether this is the primary or secondary disk of this RAID-1 volume. The primary disk wins when the two disks disagree, and the secondary disk is normally synchronized to match the primary disk.

property.name: VendorID
property.description: The vendor identification string from the hard disk drive.

property.name: ProductID
property.description: The product identification string from the hard disk drive.

property.name: Revision
property.description: The vendor's revision string from the hard disk drive.

property.name: Identifier
property.description: The vendors identifier string read from the hard disk drive, normally unique for each physical drive.

property.name: OutOfSync
property.description: If this is a secondary drive, set when it is not fully sycnhronized to match the primary drive.

property.name: Quiesced
property.description: Indicates if this disk drive has been quiesced, which prevents it from receiving any read/write commands.

property.name: InactiveVolume
property.summary: Drive inactive due to inactive volume
property.description: If true, this physical disk is not a member of an active RAID volume.

property.name: OptimalPrevious
property.description: True if the previous state was optimal, else false.

object.summary: Show status of RAID Volume Physical Disks

property.name: VolumeNumber
property.summary: The number of this RAID volume
property.description: The number of this RAID volume within the system, with numbering starting at 0.

property.name: Type
property.summary: The type of this RAID volume
property.description: The Type of this RAID volume, such as RAID-0 or RAID-1. The incorporation of a particular type here does not mean that the software currently supports creating or using that Type of RAID volume.

property.name: VolumeID
property.summary: The Identifier of this RAID volume
property.description: The Volume ID assigned by the RAID controller to this volume.

property.name: NumPhysDisks
property.summary: The number of physical disks in this RAID volume
property.description: The number of physical disks configured to be part of this RAID volume.

property.name: State
property.summary: The state of this RAID volume
property.description: The overall state of this RAID volume.

property.name: Enabled
property.description: Is this RAID volume enabled. If it is not enabled, there is no filesystem access to the volume.

property.name: Quiesced
property.description: Is this RAID volume quiesced. When quiesced, the RAID volume is enabled, but no commands (read, write) may be sent to it.

property.name: ResyncInProgress
property.description: Is this RAID volume resynchronizing. For a RAID-1 volume, it will be resynchronizing when the secondary drive's data is not the same as the primary drive's data. It will copy blocks from the primary to the secondary until they are sycnhronized.

property.name: ResyncPercentage
property.description: This is the percentage of the total blocks of the RAID-1 volume that are presently not the same on the primary and secondary disk drives. This value is rounded to the nearest percent, except that the result will never be 100% unless resynchronization is abosolutely complete.

property.name: InactiveStatus
property.description: If the RAID volume is active, the status will be "active". If the volume is inactive, it gives the reason that it is inactive.

property.name: BadBlockTableFull
property.summary: Is the RAID volume's bad block table full
property.description: Indicates if the bad block table on this RAID volume is full.

object.name: ReceiveKbpsThroughput
object.description: Receive throughput in kbits/sec for all physical Ethernet interfaces. For physical and VLAN interfaces, see drStatusNetworkRecieveDataThroughput.

object.name: ReceivePacketThroughput
object.description: Receive throughput in packets/sec for all physical Ethernet interfaces. For physical and VLAN interfaces, see drStatusNetworkRecievePacketThroughput.

object.name: RoutingStatus

property.name: Destination
property.summary: The destination IP subnet of this route.
property.description: The IP subnet that is the destination of this route.

property.name: Interface
property.summary: The Ethernet interface this route is via.
property.description: The Ethernet interface this route is via.

property.name: Gateway
property.summary: The next hop gateway for this route.
property.description: The next hop gateway that traffic using this route is sent to. If the next hop is 0.0.0.0, then the route is via the interface (no next-hop router).

property.name: Metric
property.description: The metric for this route. Typically configured in units of hops, but it is really user-selected. Given ultiple routes with the same destination, the one with the lowest metric is used.

object.description: This table describes all the static IP routes on the system. This table was deprecated because it could not support VLANs.

object.name: RoutingStatus2

property.name: Destination
property.summary: The destination IP subnet of this route.
property.description: The IP subnet that is the destination of this route.

property.name: InterfaceType
property.summary: The type of device interface used for this route.
property.description: The type of device interface used for this route. Ethernet indicates that it is on the base Ethernet MAC interface. VLAN indicates that it is on an IEEE 802.1Q VLAN on top of the base Ethernet MAC interface.

property.name: MacInterface
property.summary: The Ethernet interface ( for example, eth0, eth1) used for this route.
property.description: The Ethernet interface used for this route. If it is via a VLAN interface, this is the Ethernet interface that VLAN is running over.

property.name: VlanName
property.summary: The name of the VLAN used for this route.
property.description: The name of the VLAN used for this route. If not using VLAN, this is empty.

property.name: Gateway
property.summary: The next hop gateway for this route.
property.description: The next hop gateway for traffic using this route. If the next hop is 0.0.0.0, then the route is via the interface (no next-hop router).

property.name: Metric
property.description: The metric for this route. Given multiple routes with the same destination, the one with the lowest metric is used.

object.description: This table describes all the static IP routes on the system.

object.name: SLMPeeringStatus

property.name: SLMPolicy
property.summary: The name of the SLM Policy invoked

property.name: Peer
property.summary: The SLM Peer with which monitoring data updated

property.name: Started
property.summary: Timestamp of first update with Peer

property.name: Updated
property.summary: Timestamp of last update with Peer

property.name: Count
property.summary: The number of updates exchanged with Peer

object.description: Counts of traffic exchange with SLM peers

property.name: EngineID
property.description: The engineID for the local SNMPv3 engine.

property.name: EngineBoots
property.description: The number of reboots for the local SNMPv3 engine.

object.name: SSHTrustedHostStatus

property.name: Host
property.description: The hostname of the peer.

property.name: Type
property.description: The key type recorded for peer.

object.description: SSH known host table

object.name: StandbyStatus

property.name: Name
property.description: The physical Ethernet interface assigned to standby

property.name: Group
property.description: An integer used to identify a standby group; allowable identifiers are in the range 1 through 255.

property.name: IP
property.summary: The virtual IP address assigned to the group
property.description: The virtual IP address managed by this group, which will be active on one member of the group at any given time. This is the address external clients use to contact the group.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Priority level of the interface within the group
property.description: The priority value (an integer within the range 100 through 255, with a default of 100) determines the device's eligibility for the active role. The device within the standby group with the highest assigned priority assumes the active role.

property.name: Mode
property.summary: Current state of this standby member.
property.description: The current state of this member of this standby control group. If it is active, this member is the one receiving traffic for the group's IP address. If it is standby, some other member of the group is active.

property.name: Preempt
property.description: With preempt mode enabled, a previously active (rather than standby) device regains its active status provided it has a high enough priority when returned to service following a failure. With preempt mode disabled (the default state), a previously active device assumes the standby role when returned to service following a failure.

property.name: GroupLeader
property.summary: The machine currently responding to virtual IP address
property.description: The address or host name of the machine in the group that currently responds to the virtual IP address

property.name: InterfaceType
property.summary: The type of interface standby control is on.
property.description: The type of the interface this standby control is on. This may be Ethernet or VLAN.

property.name: VlanName
property.summary: The VLAN the standby control is on.
property.description: If this standby control is on a VLAN, the name of that VLAN.

object.description: Status of standby control protocol on Ethernet interfaces or VLANs on top of Ethernet interfaces.

object.name: StylesheetCachingSummary

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: The name of the XML Manager managing the stylesheet.
property.description: The name of the XML Manager managing the stylesheet. May be used by more than one service.

property.name: CacheSize
property.summary: The size, in bytes, of the stylesheet cache.
property.description: The size, in bytes, of the stylesheet cache. Used by by all XML Managers.

property.name: CacheCount
property.summary: The number of stylesheets in the cache.

property.name: ReadyCount
property.summary: The number of stylesheets ready to execute in the cache.

property.name: PendingCount
property.summary: The number of stylesheets pending compilation in the cache.

property.name: BadCount
property.summary: The number of bad stylesheets in the cache.
property.description: The system may encounter errors when compiling stylesheets for use during runtime. When errors occur, the stylesheet is cached and marked as bad. These should be flushed from the cache to prevent runtime errors.

property.name: DupCount
property.summary: The number of requests to compile a stylesheet already cached.

object.description: The current status of the stylesheet cache. The cache contains a copy of all stylesheets or WSDL files compiled within the refresh time, total count limit, or total cache size.

The value 'stream' indicated specialized compilation mode for direct output to a network stream. The value 'context' indicates specialized compilation mode for output to a temporary context variable. The value 'events' indicates specialized compilation mode for event-driven output.

property.name: URL

property.name: tenSeconds

object.name: StylesheetProfiles
object.description: Profiling of the Execution Time for a Stylesheet

object.name: StylesheetProfilesSimpleIndex

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: The name of the XML Manager employed

property.name: ID
property.description: A number used to identify the stylesheet in the cache used for this processing request.

property.name: OutputMode
property.summary: The output mode used by the compiler.
property.description: The output mode used by the compiler. The value 'general' indicates general-purpose compilation mode, no specialization. The value 'stream' indicated specialized compilation mode for direct output to a network stream. The value 'tree' indicates specialized compilation mode for output to a temporary context variable. The value 'events' indicates specialized compilation mode for event-driven output.

property.name: URL
property.summary: The URL of the stylesheet used
property.description: The URL of the stylesheet used for processing. This may refer to a location off the device or to a location on the device.

property.name: Name
property.summary: Name of the template, global variable, or dp:profile node within the stylesheet
property.description: This is the name of the template, global variable or dp:profile node within the stylesheet that this entry represents. Each named template within the stylesheet will be listed if it is executed. Note that if a template is called from multiple places within the stylesheet, there will be multiple entries for each location it is called from.

property.name: Location
property.description: This reports the line number, within the stylesheet profiled, of where the template was called or the location of the declaration of a global variable or dp:profile element. For example, a report of local:///mine.xsl:16 indicates a template was called on line 16 of the stylesheet indicated. Entries with teh 'built-in' location refer to the implicit templates defined by the XSLT 1.0 specification.

property.name: Count
property.summary: The number of times the template executes
property.description: The number of times the listed entry was executed during the processing of a request by the stylesheet. A template or dp:profile node may be called more than once during processing of a stylesheet.

property.name: Type
property.description: This reports the type of this entry. It can be either a template, global variable, dp:profile node, or the total for the entire stylesheet execution.

property.name: TotalTimeMS
property.description: The total time, measured in milliseconds, spent processing the instructions represented in this entry. Note that the instructions represented by a given entry may execute more than once, as indicated by the count. Also note that the total time is the sum measured across all executions of the stylesheet. As some entries represented nested portions of the stylesheet's execution, the sum of all entries in the table will not equal the Total Time entry.

object.description: Table summarizing profiling information for Stylesheets. Each template, global variable, and dp:profile element that were executed at least once during all executions of the stylesheet are reported in their own entry. Note that no data is available unless an XML Manager using a Compile Options Policy with Profiling enabled matches a request or response processed by the device.

object.name: StylesheetStatusSimpleIndex

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: The XML Manager controlling the stylesheet.
property.description: The name of the XML Manager performing the compiling and caching of the stylesheet or WSDL.

property.name: ID
property.description: A unique identifier assigned by the system to the compiled stylesheet or WSDL.

property.name: OutputMode
property.summary: The output mode used by the compiler.
property.description: The output mode used by the compiler. The value 'general' indicates general-purpose compilation mode, no specialization. The value 'stream' indicated specialized compilation mode for direct output to a network stream. The value 'context' indicates specialized compilation mode for output to a temporary context variable. The value 'events' indicates specialized compilation mode for event-driven output.

property.name: URL
property.summary: The URL of the stylsheet or WSDL.
property.description: The URL of the stylesheet or WSDL compiled. This may reside on or off the device.

property.name: CompileOptions
property.summary: The Compile Options applied to the stylesheet or WSDL.
property.description: The Compile Options applied to the stylesheet or WSDL. Compile Options are set by a Compile Options Policy associated with the XML Manager used.

property.name: Status
property.summary: The current status of the compiled stylesheet or WSDL.
property.description: The current status of the compiled stylesheet or WSDL. The value 'ready' indicates ready for execution, does not require further compilation. The value 'pending' indicates that it is waiting for compilation, the system has a queue for compilation. The value 'bad' indicates that is failed to compile, cannot execute. Check the Compiler log for reasons. The value 'expired' indicates that it has expired from the cache; cannot execute. This indicates the file has not been required for processing for the cache lifetime amount of time. On next request, it will automatically recompile.

property.name: CompileSpeed
property.description: Time to compile, in milliseconds.

property.name: RefreshInterval
property.summary: Time between automatic refreshes, in iseconds.
property.description: Time between automatic refreshes, in iseconds. When an automatic refresh is in force, files are fetched and recompiled to maintain a fresh cache.

property.name: Flushable
property.summary: Indicates ability to remove (flush) from cache.
property.description: Indicates ability to remove (flush) from cache. If the compiled version of the file can be flushed from the cache (in effect forcing a refresh the next time the file is called), click the Flush Stylesheet Cache button on the XML Manager object page to optionally remove the file from the compiled cache. Useful during development and debugging.

property.name: LastRefresh
property.description: Timestamp of the last refresh. Indicates length of time in cache. Use the Refresh button to immediately refresh a compiled stylesheet or WSDL.

property.name: Message
property.description: Helpful compiler messages.

property.name: Log
property.description: Helpful compiler log messages. Any compilation errors can be found here.

property.name: XG4Enabled
property.summary: Status of XG4 acceleration for stylesheet.
property.description: Reports use (on) of XG4 acceleration during compile of particular stylesheet or WSDL.

property.name: XG4Size
property.description: Reports usage percentage of XG4 acceleration during compile of particular stylesheet or WSDL.

object.description: A report of the status of XSL stylesheets and WSDL files compiled during processing. The compiler log messages are helpful for debugging and development. Once compiled, these files are cached for speed. The compiled files may be flushed from the cache and/or refreshed periodically.

object.name: SystemUsage

property.name: Interval
property.summary: The interval of measurement, in milliseconds
property.description: The device collects and displays load statistics over the interval, expressed in milliseconds, given here.

property.name: Load
property.summary: Percent of load on the device
property.description: The percentage of total load on the device during the measurement interval. A load above 90 indicates the device is at or near load capacity.

property.name: WorkList
property.description: The number of pending messages in queue for processing by the device. This may include such activities as off-box logging and stylesheet or WSDL retrieval from remote locations.

object.description: The percentage of load on the device

object.name: TCPTable

property.name: localIP
property.description: The local IP address of this TCP connection. For connections in the listen state, an address of 0.0.0.0 means that connections will be accepted at any IP address of the system, a specific address indicates that connections will only be accepted at that IP address.

property.name: localPort
property.description: The local TCP port number of this TCP connection.

property.name: remoteIP
property.description: The remote IP address of this connection. This is 0.0.0.0 for connections in the listen state, and a specific IP address for connected connections.

property.name: remotePort
property.description: The remote TCP port number of this TCP connection.

property.name: state
property.description: The state of the TCP connection, with state names as defined in RFC 793.

property.name: serviceDomain
property.description: For TCP connections in the listen state, that were created by a configuration object, the domain that the configuration object that created the listener is in.

property.name: serviceClass
property.description: For TCP connections in the listen state, that were created by a configuration object, the type of configuration object that created the listener. For all other connections, this will be configBase.

property.name: serviceName
property.description: For TCP connections in the listen state, that were created by a configuration object, the name of the configuration object that created the listener.

object.description: This table describes all TCP connections on the system, both those listening for incoming connections, and active connections. For listening connections that are related to router configuration objects, it indicates what object that listener is associated.

object.name: TemperatureSensors

property.name: Name
property.summary: The name of the temperature sensor
property.description: The name of the temperature sensor that is being monitored.

property.name: Value
property.description: The most recent reading of the temperature sensor. There are only three signifigant digits.

property.name: UpperNonCriticalThreshold
property.description: The temperature at which there is a warning error of high temperature. If the current value is above this, the problem should be investigated.

property.name: UpperNonRecoverableThreshold
property.description: The temperature at which there is a risk of permanent damage due to high temperature. If the temperature is above this threshold, and the problem cannot be aleviated, the device should be powered down.

property.name: ReadingStatus
property.description: Indication of whether the current temperature is OK, or wheter it exceeds the non-critical or non-recoverable threshold.

object.description: Sensors that read temperatures, both of the air flowing through the system, and of key components in the system.

object.name: TransmitKbpsThroughput
object.description: Transmit throughput in kbits/sec for all physical Ethernet interfaces. For physical and VLAN interfaces, see drStatusNetworkTransmitDataThroughput.

object.name: TransmitPacketThroughput
object.description: Transmit throughput in packets/sec for all physical Ethernet interfaces. For physical and VLAN interfaces, see drStatusNetworkTransmitPacketThroughput.

property.name: Status
property.description: Status of Last Update

property.name: ServiceName
property.display: WSDL Service Name obtained from Registry

property.name: PortName
property.display: WSDL Port Name obtained from Registry

property.name: Namespace
property.display: Namepsace for WSDL Service and Port obtained from Registry

property.name: BindingName
property.display: WSDL Binding Name Obtained from Registry

property.name: BindingNamespace
property.display: Namepsace for WSDL Binding obtained from Registry

object.name: VlanInterfaceStatus

property.name: Name
property.description: This is the name assigned to this VLAN in the configuration.

property.name: InterfaceIndex
property.summary: The SNMP ifIndex of the VLAN
property.description: This is the SNMP ifIndex value of the row in the SNMP ifTable corresponding to this VLAN interface.

property.name: OnEthernet
property.summary: The Ethernet this VLAN is over
property.description: The Ethernet interface port that this VLAN is operating on.

property.name: VlanIdentifier
property.description: The VLAN Identifier that uniquely identifies this particular VLAN on its associated physical Ethernet network.

object.description: This table provides device-dependent status for all VLAN interfaces on the system.

object.name: VoltageSensors

property.name: Name
property.summary: The name of the voltage sensor
property.description: The name of the voltage sensor that is being monitored.

property.name: Value
property.description: The most recent reading of the voltage sensor. There are only three signifigant digits.

property.name: LowerCriticalThreshold
property.description: The lowest allowable reading of the voltage sensor.

property.name: UpperCriticalThreshold
property.description: The highest allowable reading of the voltage sensor.

property.name: ReadingStatus
property.description: Indication of whether the current voltage is OK, or wheter it exceeds the upper or lower critical threshold. If the status is not OK, and there is no other possible cause (overtemperature, failed fans), the device has failed, and needs to be replaced.

object.description: Sensors that read voltages, from the power supplies and other parts of the system.

object.name: WSMAgentSpoolers

property.name: Index
property.description: An identifier for this Subscriber, unique since the WSM Agent started.

property.name: Context
property.description: The identifying string provided by the Subscriber; not always meaningful to a human reader.

property.name: Protocol
property.description: Identifies which protocol the Subscriber is using.

property.name: SubProtocol
property.description: Identifies which variant protocol the Subscriber is using.

property.name: PollInterval
property.description: For Push mode Subscribers, the maximum interval between notifications.

property.name: Records
property.description: Number of messages on the queue which have not yet been successfully acknowledged by the subscriber.

property.name: LastReadIndex
property.description: The transaction ID of the last record read by the subscriber.

property.name: LastAckedIndex
property.description: The transaction ID of the last record successfully acknowledged by the subscriber.

property.name: LastReadTime
property.description: Timestamp of the last Read event for this subscriber.

property.name: LastAckTime
property.description: Timestamp of the last Ack event for this subscriber.

object.summary: Web Services Management Agent Spooler status

object.name: WSMAgentStatus

property.name: SpoolerCount
property.description: The total number of active subscribers for this Application Domain.

property.name: PolledSpoolers
property.description: The total number of Push mode subscribers for this Application Domain.

property.name: RecordsSeen
property.description: The total number of messages successfully enqueued since the WSM Agent was restarted.

property.name: RecordsLost
property.description: The total number of messages dropped due to resource constraints since the WSM Agent was restarted.

property.name: PendingRecords
property.description: The total number of messages currently in the queue for transactions which have not completed. This number is normally very low, and is approximately a product of the current transaction rate and external latency.

property.name: CompleteRecords
property.description: The total number of messages currently in the queue for completed transactions. This number is approximately a product of the current transaction rate and subscriber polling interval.

property.name: MemoryUsedKB
property.description: The amount of memory (in kilobytes) used by this Agent for transaction records and buffered messages. This number is compared to the configured Max Memory property of the Agent to limit resource usage.

action.name: CreateTAMFiles

description.p: The Tivoli Access Manager key database and key stash files are placed in the domain's cert: directory when created; this directory does not allow files to be moved out of it.
By selecting to create copies of the created files, a copy of the key database and stash files will be placed in the domain's temporary: directory, and can be downloaded off of the device.
The name used to form the created Tivoli Access Manager filenames, according to the following convention:

ul.li: The Tivoli Access Manager client authorization file. This file has a ".conf" suffix appended to the entered file name parameter, and is located in the local: directory.

The Tivoli Access Manager client key database and stash files. The key database has a ".kdb" suffix to the entered file name parameter, while the stash file has a ".sth" suffix. Both are located in the cert: directory.
For TAM client versions 5.1 and above, an obfuscation file is created, with a ".conf.obj" suffix. This file is placed in the local: directory.

parameter.name: Administrator
parameter.description: The Tivoli Access Manager Administrator username. This user must have permission to register the TAM client application.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: The Tivoli Access Manager Administrator password corresponding to the entered username.

description.p: The Tivoli Access Manager Domain that the client will operate in. This parameter's impact depends on the version of the Tivoli Access Manager firmware used by the device:

ul.li: For client version 4.1, this parameter has no effect, as Tivoli Access Manager domains were not present in the release.
For client versions 5.1 and higher, this is the policy server domain that the client will operate in.

parameter.name: Application
parameter.description: The application ID is used to create a unique identifier for the client in the Tivoli Access Manager policy server.

parameter.name: Host
parameter.description: The host name or IP address of the Tivoli Access Manager policy server

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: The listening port number of the Tivoli Access Manager policy server

parameter.name: SSLKeyFileLifetime
parameter.description: Length in days (between 1 and 7200) that the generated SSL key file will be valid

parameter.name: SSLTimeout
parameter.description: Length in seconds (between 1 and 600) that a Tivoli Access Manager request will wait before timing out

parameter.name: LDAPServer
parameter.description: The host name or IP address of the Tivoli Access Manager LDAP directory server

parameter.name: LDAPPort
parameter.description: The port for the Tivoli Access Manager LDAP directory server

parameter.name: LDAPBindPassword
parameter.description: The LDAP administrator password correspoding to the entered DN.

parameter.name: LDAPAuthenticateTimeout
parameter.description: Length in seconds (between 1 and 600) that an authentication request to the Tivoli Access Manager LDAP server will wait before timing out

parameter.name: LDAPSearchTimeout
parameter.description: Length in seconds (between 1 and 600) that a search request to the Tivoli Access Manager LDAP server will wait before timing out

parameter.name: LDAPCache
parameter.description: Toggle to indicate whether client-side LDAP caching will be used for similar queries

parameter.name: LDAPUserCacheSize
parameter.display: Number of entries in the LDAP user cache
parameter.description: The number of entries in the authorization client's LDAP user cache. This parameter is valid only for Tivoli Access Manager version 5.1 or later.

parameter.name: LDAPPolicyCacheSize
parameter.display: Number of entries in the LDAP policy cache
parameter.description: The number of entries in the authorization client's LDAP policy cache. This parameter is valid only for Tivoli Access Manager version 5.1 or later.
